description: On this weeks Popcast, Jon Caramanica tells of two consecutive nights spent at Madison Square Garden, hearing the Strokes and LCD Soundsystem: New York City in excelsis! And Jeremy Egner speaks to Ben Ratliff about the slow but thorough evolution of the singer-songwriter Bill Callahan, who once performed as Smog, and his new album, Apocalypse. Ben Ratliff is the host.

title: Kirkuk Tensions Highlight Concerns Over U.S. Troop Exit
description: BAGHDAD  Last summer, when the American military drew down to fewer than 50,000 troops here  from a high mark of more than 160,000 during the surge  commanders stressed that effectively nothing would change in terms of U.S. operations on the ground.

title: App Smart Extra: Baseball Scorecards
description: MLB at Bat 11 is the app of choice for baseball spectators this year, as my App Smart column this week points out.

title: 90 Minutes of Idol Cant Help Breaking In
description: A 90-minute edition of American Idol lifted Fox to first place in the ratings on Wednesday, but the network struggled to keep many of those viewers tuned in at 9:30 p.m. for its new sitcom Breaking In.

title: Styled to a T | La Seydoux
description: The Trend

title: A Fake Tax Rattles Classic Car Buffs
description: As April Fools gags go, the Shelby American Automobile Clubs 2011 spoof did not seem especially convincing. Until, that is, hundreds of classic car lovers across the country were duped, became enraged and started to organize against a nonexistent threat.

title: Galloping Food Price Index Shows First Dip in Months
description: In Thursdays Times, I write about the impact that cultivating food crops to manufacture biofuels has had on food prices, which have been at or near record highs over the last six months, On Thursday, the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization released its latest Food Price Index, which showed a slight decline for the month of March.

title: Video of Aftershock Shaking Japan
description: As my colleague Andrew Pollack reports, a 7.1 magnitude aftershock struck off the east coast of Japan on Thursday.

title: Mercedes-Benz Reveals A-Class Concept Car
description: Mercedes-Benz has revealed the concept version of its new A-Class, set for display at the coming Shanghai and New York auto shows. The smallest car in the German automakers line, the A-Class is a far cry from the original of 1997. That models novel architecture set passengers above the drive train, lending it a podlike quality and a resemblance to the cars of the Smart brand owned by Mercedes.

title: Guess Where This Is
description: This week, were going off-road. The hint: This city was the site of the first leg of a race in the World Rally Championship last month.

title: A Fake Tax Rattles Classic Car Buffs
description: From our colleagues at City Room:

title: N.F.L. Draft: Torrey Smith, 5th-Ranked Receiver
description: Matt Waldman is the author of The Rookie Scouting Portfolio, an 859-page testament to his depraved obsession with film analysis of rookie prospects at quarterback, running back, wide receiver and tight end. This series counts down his top five draft prospects at each position. 5.Torrey Smith, Maryland (6-0, 204)

title: From Behind the Scenes, an Influential Adviser Speaks Out
description: Roger C. Altman  whose Evercore Partners has had advisory role in some of the latest big deals, including Nasdaqs play for the New York Stock Exchange, AT&Ts proposed acquisition of T-Mobile USA, and Berkshire Hathaways bid for Lubrizol  talks to CNBC about the budget battle, issues with the AT&T deal, and the insider trading speculation about David L. Sokol, who recently resigned from Berkshire.

title: Instant Loops of Images, From an iPhone App
description: An animated GIF created with the 3Frames app. If the animation is driving you batty, then this post may not be for you.

title: Putting the Juice in Jerusalem
description: DURING rehearsals in 2009 for the London production of Jerusalem, Jez Butterworths play about outcasts in modern England, the actor Mark Rylance drove one Sunday to the rural village of Pewsey to look up Micky Lay, a retired builder who was the inspiration for Rooster Byron, Mr. Rylances drug-dealing, authority-defying character. The encounter did not go well. Mr. Rylance walked past the wrecked cars in Mr. Lays yard and knocked on his front door, where wood had been nailed over shattered glass. Mr. Lay answered with an Awww whata ye want? said Mr. Rylance, who identified himself and asked for a word. In colorful profanity, Mr. Lay told him to go away.

title: Microsoft to Produce Telematics System for Toyota
description: Toyota and Microsoft this week announced a partnership that will expand Microsofts penetration in automotive telematics, while providing Toyota with on-board communication, control and entertainment electronics. While this marks the first time the two companies have joined forces to develop in-car systems, they have worked together for more than 10 years on a mobile Internet project for Japan.

title: City Shuts Fatty Cue After It Gets 115 Violation Points
description: Even some of the best restaurants in town have had trouble passing health inspections. But Eater reports that Fatty Cue, Zakary Pelaccios very popular Asian barbecue restaurant in Brooklyn, has been shut down by the city health department after it rang up 115 violation points in an inspection on Monday. (You need fewer than 14 points to get an A, and fewer than 28 to get a B.)

title: Pictures of the Day: Yemen and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Yemen, Libya, Iraq and Japan.

title: OMG!!! Exploring Slang
description: Overview | What role does slang play in our language? How does slang both shape and reflect culture? In this lesson, students consider the slang words they use daily and the role slang plays in our culture. Then, they explore the etymologies of these and other slang words and display their findings in a visually interesting way, as well as compile a class dictionary.

title: Anatomy of a Scene: Hanna
description: In the action thriller Hanna, Saoirse Ronan plays a teenager who was raised in an isolated environment in Finland and trained to be an assassin. This scene is set in Morocco and shows her coming into contact with modern technology for the first time. The director Joe Wright discusses some of the ideas behind the scene and the techniques he used to bring its objects to life.

title: Anatomy of a Scene: 'Hanna'
description: The director Joe Wright narrates a scene from the action thriller "Hanna," starring Saoirse Ronan.

title: The GoSmart Clip: A Well-Made Bad Idea
description: The GoSmart Clip is the best engineered bad idea Ive seen in a long time.

title: House Leaders Exchange Barbs as Government Shutdown Looms
description: Passions were running high in the House on Thursday morning as a federal government shutdown loomed and members of Congress began to get queasy about the prospect of being blamed for the ensuing disruptions.

title: Justice Memo Upholds Libya Strikes
description: President Obama had the constitutional power to lawfully launch military strikes in Libya without permission from Congress because he could reasonably determine that such use of force was in the national interest, the Justice Department concluded in an internal memorandum released on Thursday.

title: Disney Cruises Adds New York as Port of Call
description: Most destinations for the Disney Cruise Line promise sun and sand (the Bahamas, Grand Cayman) or stunning scenery (Alaska, the Mexican Riviera). But a different set of attractions  and perhaps a little big-city attitude  characterizes the newest addition to its lineup of ports of call: New York City. Starting in May 2012, the Disney Magic cruise ship, which accommodates about 2,700 passengers, will sail 20 cruises, departing from the Manhattan Cruise Terminal on the Hudson River.

title: The High (G)Low | NOOKA Zub Zirc Watch
description: What: NOOKA Zub Zirc low watch

title: Video Interview With Woman Who Said She Was Raped by Qaddafi Forces
description: Over the objections of Libyan information ministry officials, but with the support of Saadi el-Qaddafi, one of the Libyan leaders sons, on Thursday CNN broadcast an on-camera interview with Eman al-Obeidy, a Libyan lawyer who was dragged away from foreign journalists nearly two weeks ago, after she said that she had been gang-raped by government security forces.

title: The Caucus: Budget Negotiations Falter
description: April 7, 2011 - Jennifer Steinhauer reports from Capitol Hill where Democrats and Republicans remain far apart on a budget deal to avert a government shutdown on Friday night.

title: Towards a Talking Newspaper
description: A recently developed app uses an iPhones computing power to recognize an image and insert a video matching the photo onto the screen, for instance, creating a moving image inside a newspaper.

title: Surprise in Kidnapping Case: Suspect Pleads Not Guilty
description: PLACERVILLE, Calif.  Phillip Garrido, the convicted sex offender accused of kidnapping and holding Jaycee Dugard captive for 18 years, pleaded not guilty on Thursday as his lawyer challenged the composition of the grand jury that indicted him and his wife last fall.

title: Facebook Opens Up Its Server and Data Center Designs
description: In the movie Fight Club, Tyler Durden, the character played by Brad Pitt, says, The first rule of fight club is you do not talk about fight club.

title: Four Foreign Journalists Held in Libya
description: Forces loyal to Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi have detained four foreign journalists in Libya, the GlobalPost news organization said Thursday, among them one of its contributing reporters, James Foley.

title: Garden Shop | Marni
description: The Salone del Mobile design fair in Milan starts this week, and every year its a similar story: chairs and sofas as far as the eye can see and yet not so many places to sit and relax. In a nod to the once-abundant greenery in this city, Marni has installed a courtyard oasis in front of its shop at Via Spiga 50.

title: The Scooba Robot Also Mesmerizes Children
description: When I was young, I always thought robot meant something with arms and legs and a head. I can still remember feeling cheated when I saw an automotive factory robot on TV that was nothing more than an arm that drilled holes. And Ill bet Im not alone. Ill bet all kinds of children encounter that moment of disillusionment when they first encounter robot inflation.

title: The Good Girl
description: Its a shame that the snarky characters on iCarly dont measure up to the actress Miranda Cosgrove as good role models. The shows humor is often based on teasing, harsh sarcasm and destructive practical jokes. The character of Sam boasts about her multiple arrests. As I tell my sons: In real life, no one would laugh.MELISSA JANOSKI,Dallas, Pa., e-mail

title: The Seekers
description: As a young female graduate student in the sciences, I take issue with your description of Bridget Moynahans character in I, Robot as the impossibly gorgeous scientist. I dont think that its acceptable to propagate wrongful stereotypes. This may seem like a minor note, but its these small mistakes that can lead to people holding unconscious and damaging attitudes toward us.MARGARET HO,Pasadena, Calif., e-mail

title: The Soloist
description: Although I applaud Tim Crothers for featuring the talented Indi Cowie, its unfortunate that his article implied that the students of Green Hope High School are unimpressed with her skill. As a student myself, I would have encouraged Crothers to interview a student, as he would have found a welcoming group who wish her nothing but the best. While it nicely portrayed Cowie as an afterthought, the misspelling of her name in both our talent-show program and school newspaper were mistakes. The article left the reader with an impression that Cowie is surrounded by people who are unwelcoming or prone to jealously, which is simply not the case.

title: A Year After G.M. Unloaded It, Saab Is in Trouble Again
description: Little more than a year after General Motors engineered a sale that saved Saab from oblivion, the carmaker is facing a fresh bout of financial troubles that threaten to spread pain across Sweden.

title: Battle Starts Over British Bank Rules
description: As Wall Street banks fight to fend off further regulation, the battle in Britain over how best to manage financial institutions considered too big to fail is just beginning.

title: Among the Guerrillas
description: Bill Kellers statement that The Times pretty much overlooked the Holocaust as it was happening is an understatement. Burying news of mass genocide deep in the back pages of a trusted news source is burying it  much as the papers co-opting and continuous use of the term ethnic cleansing (eventually even omitting the quotation marks) has sanitized news of mass genocide and slaughter.

title: Just Add Water
description: Since I was a little girl, Ive been collecting flowers and floral fabrics, says Emilie Bon, the swimwear designer behind the year-old lingerie-inspired line Lilibon. The latest collection of eight petal-printed items includes bandeau and pinup-style maillots and bikinis trimmed in lace and tulle. Bons inspiration? A pressed anemone she found among her childhood keepsakes.

title: How to Cook a Screaming Eagle
description: Funny to see this article on the same day that many students received their acceptance packets from colleges for the Class of 2015. Congrats to future consumers of greasy, cheesy, crusty sandwiches at college campuses everywhere. Youre all about to make some great college dining memories.

title: Girl With the Dragon Tattoo Sells More Than 1 Million Digital Copies
description: In what is believed to be a first for an e-book, The Girl With the Dragon Tattoo, by the Swedish novelist Stieg Larsson, has sold more than a million copies in its digital format, Knopf said on Thursday. Knopf, part of Random House, said the combined digital sales for all three books in the blockbuster Millennium series, which includes The Girl Who Played With Fire and The Girl Who Kicked the Hornets Nest, is now more than three million copies. The trilogy is selling at a clip of more than 500,000 copies a month in all formats. The Girl With the Dragon Tattoo, which went on sale in the United States in September 2008, has sold more than 300,000 copies in hardcover.

title: Showtime Orders New Series Starring Don Cheadle and Claire Danes
description: Once the network of female protagonists in unexpected professions and/or life-or-death situations, Showtime continues its transition to the network of offbeat celebrity casting that were willing to at least give a chance. (And also Gigolos.) Adding to a roster of original programming that includes The Borgias, Shameless, Weeds and The Big C, Showtime said on Thursday it had picked up the first seasons of two new series: House of Lies, a comedy starring Don Cheadle and Kristen Bell, and Homeland, a drama starring Claire Danes, Damien Lewis and Mandy Patinkin.

title: Inquiry Finds No Evidence of Undue Influence on Safety Agency
description: There is no evidence that safety investigations conducted by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration have been influenced by former agency officials who now work for automakers or the former auto officials who work for the agency, said a report released on Thursday by the Office of the Inspector General for the Transportation Department, which oversees N.H.T.S.A.

title: Feeding Your Family From a Dumpster
description: Two years ago, Corbyn Hanson Hightower was earning six figures. Then the Great Recession hit, and Ms. Hightower and her husband sold their car, found a cheaper, draftier home, canceled cable and Internet, worked odd jobs, depleted their savings and stripped ourselves to the bare minimum while supporting three children.

title: R.A. Dickey Ready for Home Opener  Again
description: PHILADELPHIA  R.A. Dickey will make his second start in a home opener Friday, but his first as a primarily knuckleball pitcher.

title: Video: Government Shutdown Nears as Budget Negotiations Falter
description: Read Jennifer Steinhauers related story, Gung-Ho for Big Cuts in Spending, Less Fond of the Ones That Hurt Back Home, published in Thursdays Times.

title: City to Appeal Order to Release Police Shooting Data
description: In February, a Manhattan judge gave the city 60 days to turn over 13 years of the internal documents generated whenever a city police officer opens fire on a civilian.

title: Brooklyn Bridge, 12:07 P.M.
description: In some countries, couples put padlocks on bridges and throw the keys in the river to symbolize their enduring love. Including this one.

title: After Cathie Black
description: The big news of the day, at least in the realm of education, is that Cathleen Black is stepping down after just a few months as New York Citys schools chancellor. To the opponents of education reform who vilified her  and who are now most likely celebrating her departure  Black was a perfect emblem of the reform movements arrogance, a power-suited publishing executive who had never attended, let alone worked at, a public school. To the reformers, this was at least part of her virtue. She was further proof that what is needed to repair our badly broken public schools is the fresh perspective of an outsider.

title: Pictures of the Day: Yemen and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Yemen, Libya, Iraq and Japan.

title: Bob Dylans Legal Fan Club
description: Its been a big week for Bob Dylan news.

title: TimesCast | April 7, 2011
description: David D. Kirkpatrick reports on recent NATO airstrikes and the disorganized rebel forces in eastern Libya.

title: Gay Couples Closer to Receiving Medicaid Spousal Protections
description: Same-sex couples are one step closer to receiving protections that heterosexual married couples get when they receive long-term care through Medicaid  that is, the healthy partner will be able to keep some of the ailing partners money and remain in their home.

title: Kultur Shock Plays the Balkans
description: A Gypsy punk metal band from Seattle provided a few hours relief from the ethnic, political and social tensions in Bosnia.

title: A Grand Transformation in 'Arthur'
description: Jason Winer, the director of "Arthur," narrates a look at a scene shot inside Grand Central Terminal.

title: Can Obama Leave Washington With Budget Unresolved?
description: Will President Obama leave Washington in the hours before a possible government shutdown?

title: O Pioneers! | Kelly Reichardts Anti-Western
description: The director Kelly Reichardt is one of very few women in American independent cinema who has managed to have a sustained career making full-length features. Her small-scale, slow-burn tales of the lost and dispossessed, like Old Joy and Wendy and Lucy, have garnered critical acclaim for their larger social and political relevance. In her latest film, Meeks Cutoff, opening Friday in New York, the lost are a group of pioneers crossing the Cascade Mountains in 1845, who find themselves wandering the high plain desert after they decide to take a shortcut. Here, Reichardt discusses her unorthodox take on the Western genre, starring her frequent collaborator Michelle Williams.

title: Hugh Grant Pays Back The News of the World, In Kind
description: The New Statesman has published an article by the actor  and tabloid victim  Hugh Grant, who managed to secretly tape a former News of the World journalist (now a pub owner, how perfect) saying that the News of the Worlds editor at the time knew all about the phone hacking going on at the paper. You can read a little bit of the story on the New Statesmans Web site  the rest is behind its pay wall (enough said)  but The Guardian spills most of the beans. And this is a good moment to have another look at our magazines excellent piece on the hacking scandal.

title: Other Than That, We Loved the Place
description: My wife went to New York City last week to see a show. Afterward, she went to dinner with some friends who ran into some other friends and they all dined together.

title: Of New Albums and Old Friends
description: Rolling Stones Web site has a free stream of Robbie Robertsons new album, How to Become Clairvoyant, his first since 1998.

title: State Education Chief to Step Down
description: The New York state education commissioner, David M. Steiner, said Thursday that he would be resigning from his position in August.

title: Bellini Work at Frick Is Seen in a New Light
description: Since 1915, when Henry Clay Frick bought Giovanni Bellinis St. Francis in the Desert, that Renaissance painting has hung in the grand Living Hall of the Frick Collection, in the company of works by El Greco, Holbein and Titian.

title: Twins Misery Against Yankees Is Compounded by Injury
description: It is a remarkably common bit of baseball. The second baseman fields the throw from the third baseman and fires the ball to first to try to record a double play. The runner slides aggressively, barreling into the second baseman in an effort to disrupt his throw. There is a collision. Sometimes the runner succeeds in breaking up the double play. Sometimes he does not. Both players dust themselves off and go about their business.

title: And the Cobras Name Isssssss
description: Mia.

title: The Battle for Libya | April 7, 2010
description: For the second time in less than a week, rebel fighters say NATO warplanes mistakenly attacked their troops.

title: Here Comes the Bride, a Wedding Crasher in Pursuit
description: Babies with money is one characters all-too-accurate description of the guests at the Long Island wedding of Zoe (Uma Thurman) and Whit (Lee Pace) in Max Winklers romantic comedy Ceremony. The willowy bride-to-be certainly acts like an infant. Throughout the movie, Ms. Thurmans facial expressions suggest a peevish spoiled child about to stomp her feet and throw a full-scale tantrum.

title: Augmented Reality Comes Closer to Reality
description: Last week I wrote about how cyber politics and crime on the Internet had been foreseen with eerie accuracy by science fiction writers. For example, the computer scientist Vernor Vinges classic 1981 novella True Names described the impact of the Net long before most people had personal computers, let alone an Internet connection.

title: A Bar That Counts on Its Regulars
description: IN the universe of academic disciplines, one of the easiest to master is tavern math.

title: Golfing in New York
description: Images of some of the golf courses in the city.

title: Fairways Where Golf Becomes the City Game
description: LETS get this out of the way: The golf courses in New York City will never be confused with Pebble Beach, Bethpage Black or any of Americas great public courses. If you want a four-and-a-half-hour round, meticulously manicured greens or even an unfailingly polite playing partner, consider going elsewhere.

title: The Anguish of Identity
description: To Die Like a Man, a ruminative exploration of gender identity, desire and aging, begins with a close-up of a young mans face being daubed with camouflage paint by a fellow soldier in preparation for a training mission. For the rest of this melancholic film by the Portuguese director Joo Pedro Rodrigues that image lingers as a mental double exposure with the visage of the movies protagonist, Tonia (Fernando Santos), a fading drag queen in 1980s Lisbon. The war paint and makeup worn by Tonia, who appears in various stages of drag, are both disguises.

title: Expedia Plans to Split Into Two
Theater Listings: April 8  14
description: Theater

title: Hazards: For Children in E.R., a Big Increase in CT Scans
description: The number of computed tomography scans performed on children visiting hospital emergency rooms has increased fivefold in recent years, to 1.65 million in 2008 from 330,000 in 1995, a new study has found.

title: Man Needs Caffeine Jolt or Reversal of Fortune
description: There are movies that are so low key they risk enervation. If the movie is purposely chill, you may be able to go with the relaxed flow; but if its too subdued, you might feel like slapping it (or yourself) awake. Henrys Crime, a muted comedy with Keanu Reeves, is a painless, at times likable, drifty comedy. But its mood is so muffled and point so submerged, its difficult to see why Mr. Reeves and the rest of the cast pooled their talents to make a movie about a nowhere man going no place in particular in Buffalo.

title: Conyers Releases Report on Panther Case
description: The ranking Democrat on the House Judiciary Committee, Representative John Conyers of Michigan, on Thursday released a 78-page Justice Department report about a much-disputed voter-intimidation case involving the New Black Panther Party, a radical fringe group.

title: A Fresh Take on Sea-Level Rise
description: For readers who are following the science of sea-level rise, a new overview paper has been published that makes indispensable reading. One of the great experts in the field, John A. Church of Australia, and his collaborator Neil J. White analyze records from instruments called tide gauges, starting in the 19th century and running into the 21st, and they also incorporate the satellite measurements of sea level that have been available since 1993.

title: Vessels of Clay, Centuries Old, That Speak to Modernity
description: More than most other kinds of art or craft, ceramic works can seem unbound by time. A vase might be hundreds of years old and yet look as if it were made only decades ago. That is partly because glazed and fired clay does not show its age the way paint, canvas, wood and even stone do. And it is partly because some styles practiced in the past by forgotten artisans embody feelings of liveliness and immediacy that modern artists love to emulate.

title: House Votes to Bar E.P.A. From Regulating Industrial Emissions
description: WASHINGTON  The House voted 255 to 172 on Thursday to halt the Obama administrations program to regulate industrial air emissions linkedto climate change,delivering a rebuke to a central tenet of the presidents energy and environmental policy.

title: Gleaning the True Identity of an Enigmatic Forger
description: Elmyr de Hory, a Hungarian-born painter known for forging works by Picasso, Modigliani and Matisse, was the subject of biographies and documentaries full of his own lies about his background. In 1976, while under investigation for art fraud, he committed suicide by overdosing on sleeping pills, leaving behind boxes of paperwork that are now yielding some truths.

title: Keeping Score: Underdogs Have Little Bite in N.B.A. Playoffs
description: Justin Kubatko is the creator of Basketball-Reference.com, an online basketball encyclopedia. He is also a statistical consultant for the Portland Trail Blazers.

title: 2011 Masters Replay: Day 1
description: After Arnold Palmer and Jack Nicklaus teed off, the first round of the 2011 Masters was under way.

title: Now, Chinatown Has Its Own Blog
description: A group of Asian-American journalists has started a new blog, Our Chinatown, that seeks to bring comprehensive and immediate news coverage to a complicated and intriguing city neighborhood that is often overlooked by reporters.

title: After Final Entreaties, Jury Gets Bonds Case
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Federal prosecutors gave one final appeal to jurors in Barry Bondss perjury case Thursday, asking for them to find Bonds guilty and emphasizing how simple it would have been for him to avoid this trial.

title: Gallantry in Real Estate
description: IT started as just another Chelsea studio, a space being offered by Citi Habitats for $1,700 a month. But for Jason Saft, one of the agencys brokers, this little apartment with the puce-colored wall and worn floors turned into the ultimate object of desire.

title: Two Jersey Shore Spin-Offs Set for 2012
description: When the cast of Jersey Shore gets back from Italy later this year, three of the cast members will start work on their own reality shows. MTV said Thursday that it had ordered two such spin-offs, one featuring Paul DelVecchio, known as DJ Pauly D, and the other featuring Nicole Polizzi and Jenni Farley, known as Snooki and JWoww.

title: A Lush Life Revisited, With Nanny on Board
description: It would be conventional to describe Arthur as a vehicle for the talents of Russell Brand, who plays the boozy billionaire of the title, but that would be to get it backward. Mr. Brand, with his stringy hair, stretched-out body and nutty British demeanor, is more like the beast of burden, charged with hauling this grim load of mediocrity to the box office. The film, directed by Jason Winer and based on a fondly recalled 1981 comedy of the same name starring Dudley Moore, has been made according to a lazy and cynical commercial blueprint. Youve seen it in the lesser work of Will Ferrell, Adam Sandler and most other male comedians who walk the line between popularity and overexposure. The star does his patented shtick, supported by a handful of blue-chip supporting performers, as the story lurches through contrived, seminaughty comic set pieces toward a sentimental ending.

title: Avoiding Refinancing Costs After Divorce
description: DIVORCED homeowners wrangling with the task of removing a former spouses name from the mortgage after buying out his or her equity stake in the marital house may think that refinancing is the only choice.

title: Its Yale Glee Clubs Year to Look Back, and Ahead
description: They came in bow ties and crimson gowns, spry of step or aided by walkers, their college memories more or less intact. On Feb. 12, nearly 650 members of the Yale Glee Club, past and present, poured into Woolsey Hall on the universitys campus in New Haven with a singular purpose: to celebrate the ensembles 150th anniversary. And naturally, to sing.

title: 36 Hours in Abu Dhabi
description: Once aloof from the spendthrift ways of neighboring Dubai, Abu Dhabi is now ticking off items on a five-star shopping list.

title: In Macaques, Familiarity Breeds...More Macaques?
description: Among rhesus macaques, a females face becomes darker when she ovulates, and males can pick up the signal  but some males get the message more clearly than others.

title: Another Financial District Building Converts to Residential
description: JOHN STREET, a narrow sliver that runs just eight blocks from Broadway to the South Street Seaport, has been the site of a large number of the office-to-residential conversions in the financial district. Now, one of its last remaining office towers has been tapped to become a rental building.

title: 36 Hours in Abu Dhabi
description: WHAT would you do with $600 billion in cash? If youre the capital of the United Arab Emirates, rich in oil, the answer is easy: go shopping. Once aloof from the spendthrift ways of neighboring Dubai, Abu Dhabi  which, so far, has not experienced the unrest many Arab countries are facing  is now ticking off items on a five-star shopping list. Top-notch museums? New branches of the Louvre and Guggenheim are rising from the sands. High-profile events? The Abu Dhabi Grand Prix, Abu Dhabi Film Festival and Gourmet Abu Dhabi have made their debuts in recent years. Toss in a multibillion-dollar hotel project and a stunning new mosque and you have one of the worlds most ambitious new destinations.

title: At Least He Wont Cost a Meal
description: A close friend is getting married. When he invited us, I was pregnant and said, I hope we can come, but it depends how new parenthood is treating us. Since then, weve accepted and booked nonrefundable plane tickets. Now it occurs to me that our baby might not be welcome at the wedding. But Im afraid to ask, because if we cant bring him, well have to miss it and eat the cost of the tickets. My plan is to feign ignorance, bring the baby and hope for the best. Is that wrong? Melanie, Boston

title: JPMorgan Paid Dimon $20.8 Million in 2010
description: JPMorgan Chase paid Jamie Dimon, its chief executive, a total of $20.8 million last year, a substantial increase from $1.3 million he received in 2009, the bank disclosed on Thursday afternoon in a regulatory filing.

title: Daddys Lethal Girl Ventures Into the Big, Bad World
description: In the last Rocky flick, a boxing guru tells the tired, sexagenarian fighter played by the tired, middle-aged Sylvester Stallone that hes a wreck, with arthritis in his neck and calcium deposits in his joints. Rocky has to get in shape if he wants to ascend the stairs of victory again, so the trainer recommends that they employ good old-fashioned blunt force trauma and start building some hurtin bombs! The spookily pale and pretty underage killing machine in Hanna played by Saoirse Ronan, then 16, doesnt have a couple of bombs that hurt: she has a veritable nuclear arsenal of pain at her quick, kinetic disposal.

title: Base Camp in a Bomb Crater
description: Bryson Voirin, a doctoral student at the Max Planck Institute for Ornithology in Germany and a fellow at the Smithsonian Tropical Research Institute in Panama, writes from Panama, where he is studying sleep in wild frigate birds.

title: The Uncertain Fate of an Ex-Department Store
description: ITS more than odd; its wonderfully bizarre: the round-cornered, Pepto-pink loft building at Grand and Orchard Streets. This ancient, creaky thing from 1886 is one of the oldest department store structures in New York, the last traces of Ridleys, once famous but now a dot at the end of a footnote. The question at hand: Is it a landmark, or a development site?

title: Bacterium Puts Insect on Evolution Fast Track
description: It appears to be a case of high-speed evolution.

title: Sharing the Shame After My Arrest
description: WE had been married for just over a year when the F.B.I. showed up at our house at 6 a.m. and arrested me. They arrested my husband, too, although at the time that seemed beside the point. A stickler for rules who had never even gotten a speeding ticket, I was handcuffed in my mismatched pajamas and hauled away. My teeth werent even brushed.

title: Pablo Picassos Blue Pajama Period
description: Photograph by Taea Thale. Fashion editor: Jason Rider. Fashion assistant: Elena Hale. Grooming by Andre Gunn at the Wall Group.From left, on Keegan Monaghan: Michael Kors jacket, $495, and pants, $295. Go to saks.com. Headtrippaz LTD T-shirt, price on request. Go to headtrippaz.com. On Darius Greyson: N. Hoolywood shirt, price on request. Go to n-hoolywood.com. On Oto Gillen: Marc by Marc Jacobs shirt, $168. Call (212) 929-0304. Marni trunks, $297. Go to marni.com. On Eugene Wasserman: Band of Outsiders shirt, $200, and pants, $225. For shirt, go to shopconfederacy.com. For pants, go to contextclothing.com.If you want to listen to Pablo Picassos first record, go to the bands Web site and download it for free. It was meant to be consumed that way  no record label, no distribution, no expensive studio time, just free MP3s. I dont really have much hope of making money from our music, says Eugene Wasserman, the bands guitarist. And we just thought it would be better to do it ourselves. The band  Wasserman, Darius Greyson (vocals), Keegan Monaghan (bass) and Oto Gillen (drums)  recorded the whole thing in their New York practice space. I think the live show is the most important thing anyways, Greyson adds. The record just sounds the way we play them onstage.

title: Fatty Cue Reopens
description: Fatty Cue, which was shut down by the city health department on Monday, just reopened after a reinspection Thursday afternoon.

title: For Obama, a Mini-Vacation Is in Limbo
description: President Obama has some real motivation for getting a budget deal: his family vacation.

title: Slaughterhouse Shortage Stunting Areas Eat-Local Movement
description: One might expect the Bay Area  as the epicenter of the eat-local movement and a region with a long tradition of cattle ranching  to be a mecca for producers of organic and grass-fed beef. But there is a problem: a shortage of slaughterhouses is so acute that it is stunting the growth of this emerging industry.

title: Rooms With a View
description: Images from the exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: Romantics Shining Clear Light on Daily Existence
description: The first thing that distinguishes Rooms With a View: The Open Window in the 19th Century, a compact, quietly splendid exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, is simply this: Its galleries have been painted a wonderful shade of oyster-grayish white. In the context of the Met, where the walls of special exhibitions tend toward plum, russet or evergreen, this pale, elegant hue is the visual equivalent of smelling salts.

title: A Cozy Studio in a Presentable Building
description: BENJAMIN BILBAO knew a nice apartment in his native borough of Queens was well within his reach. But Manhattan had been his home for most of his adult life, and even with its higher price tag, that is where he wanted to be.

title: Megacarats From Menus of the Rich
description: The recipe for making an exquisite piece of jewelry is akin to haute cuisine: masters employ special techniques to mix and adorn top-quality ingredients, creating something that is far greater than the sum of its parts. So says the unctuous wall text introducing Set in Style: The Jewelry of Van Cleef & Arpels, a banquet of the most distasteful variety at the Cooper-Hewitt National Design Museum.

title: Weekend Miser
description: Film can take us anywhere we want to go, and sometimes to places we dont. Luckily, the hosts of the movies featured in this weeks column arent charging much for transportation.

title: Guitar Rock, Stretched on the Canvas of a Big Stage
description: The movie-palace splendor of Radio City Music Hall made an appropriately majestic backdrop for Explosions in the Sky, an instrumental rock band from Austin, Tex., whose music can swell to fill any grand space. The group was headlining a triple bill  with the band Low and a solo-piano set by Eluvium, a k a Matthew Cooper  that elevated modest brooding to monumental scale. The big-hall concert was in part a reward for indie-rock perseverance: Explosions in the Sky released its first recordings in 2000, Low in 1994.

title: How Secrecy Undermines Audit Reform
description: For the auditing industry, the financial crisis was really not that bad.

title: Ever-Growing Image of a Stumbling Third Term for Bloomberg
description: Inselecting Cathleen P. Black as schools chancellor,Mayor Michael R. Bloombergwas, in many ways, playing to type:a man famous for ignoring advice, relying on his own instincts and doing the opposite of what an ordinary politician would do had chosen as leader of the nations largest school system a woman with no relevant experience whom he knew socially.

title: Time Warner Cable and Viacom Seek Ruling on iPad App
description: Time Warner Cable and Viacom each filed lawsuits on Thursday that seek to resolve a stormy dispute in the television business over the right to stream channels to new devices like iPads.

title: After Quick Start, Mets Trip Ends Badly
description: PHILADELPHIA  What began with so much promise and a little surprise ended with a flattening thud Thursday. After starting the season with victories in three of their first four games, raising expectations that they could return home as unexpected conquering heroes, the Mets lost the final two games of their season-opening trip and went home with a modest 3-3 record.

title: Like Old Times, Almost, in an English Household
description: There is a sly grace note tucked into Upstairs Downstairs, the sequel to the legendary series of the 1970s. The parlor maid Rose Buck (Jean Marsh) is back in service at 165 Eaton Place, and she worries that her new mistress considers her over the hill.

title: Blazing a Trail
description: Images from Kelly Reichardts Meeks Cutoff.

title: Trump Plans Meeting on Arizona Birth Bill
description: Donald Trump is investing more in the conspiracy theories about President Obamas birth certificate as he explores his own bid for the presidency.

title: Attitude and Hip-Hop for the Naughty Sides, Ballet for the Nice
description: Its harder to put together a well-balanced program of dances than most audiences realize. Artistic directors have to consider each pieces mood, dance style, music and general aesthetic, then layer the works in a way that builds to a satisfying conclusion. Its even harder when the company is a junior troupe like Ailey II, the younger branch of the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater that offers a bridge between student and professional years.

title: Out on the Frontier, Bringing All That Baggage With Them
description: The first thing you see in Meeks Cutoff, after a hand-scrawled title card placing the action in the Oregon Territory in 1845, is a small group of settlers fording a river. Its a treacherous, tedious undertaking, and Kelly Reichardt, the director of this tough, quiet revelation of a movie, films it in an uninflected style that makes everything feel at once mundane and mysterious. We are seeing the world more or less exactly as it looked to those hardy, foolish souls on screen (and almost forgetting to notice that most of them are actors we recognize from elsewhere). The way that world looked to them was unimaginably strange, every hill and rock loaded with portent, promise and menace.

title: House Tour: Saugerties, N.Y.
description: A five-bedroom house on 12 acres overlooks the Hudson River in Saugerties, N.Y.

title: Furlough Notices Arrive for Federal Workers
description: A government shutdown may yet be averted, but a last-minute deal by President Obama and Congressional leaders will come too late for some of the most fragile egos in Washington.

title: House Tour: Saugerties, N.Y.
description: WHAT Five-bedroom house on 12 acres overlooking the Hudson River

title: Good News for Spouses of Reverse Mortgage Holders
description: In the face of a lawsuit from the AARP Foundation, the Department of Housing and Urban Development has backed off an apparent policy change that was putting some widows and widowers on the brink of foreclosure.

title: Mitchell C. Hochberg
description: Mr. Hochberg, 58, is the managing principal of Madden Real Estate Ventures, a real estate investment, development and advisory firm specializing in hospitality and residential projects.

title: Ellsworth Kelly
description: Reliefs 2009-2010

title: David Altmejd
description: Andrea Rosen Gallery

title: Stuart Brisley
description: Performance, Paintings, Sculpture, Video

title: Q & A
description: When Sponsor Units Are in Foreclosure

title: Emma Bee Bernstein
description: An Imagined Space

title: Preserving the Gems of the Gold Coast
description: THOUGH lovingly restored in the last eight years, Salt Meadow, the circa 1846 colonial in the tony Harriman Estates section in Sands Point, hardly compares to the newer and more ostentatious mansions nearby. Its owners, Arlene Getz and Rob Schapiro, admit that its the runt of the block  albeit a runt with a vineyard and 2.7 acres.

title: New Projects, at last, for Mount Vernon
description: MOUNT VERNON, all but bypassed in recent years as developers set their sights on cities like White Plains and Yonkers, now has two residential projects under way: market-rate condominiums and a mixed-use rental complex to include moderately priced housing and units for retirees.

title: Spare Times for April 8-14
description: Around Town

title: Revitalizing a Neighborhood in Jersey City
description: JERSEY CITY

title: Getting to the Bottom of Youre the Top
description: An illustrated look at some of the references in Cole Porters lyrics for a number from the musical Anything Goes.

title: St. Francis in the Desert
description: A closer look at Bellinis painting at the Frick Collection in New York.

title: Spare Times: For Children, for April 8-14
description: REVOLTING RHYMES

title: Before Going Dark, One Last Attempt at Explaining New York City
description: Eons ago, the student newspaper that I wrote for and edited at City College of New York had a tradition for former editors who were graduating. It gave them a final crack at the typewriter to produce what we called a Thirty column.

title: They Huffed and Puffed and Waited to Exhale
description: It may be that Your Highness, a self-conscious, sometimes overly self-satisfied goof about ye olde high times, may be better enjoyed in an herb-enhanced condition. Getting stoned is, after all, a running joke in this comedy, which is as thin as rolling paper and just as ephemeral. Certainly its milieu  a fantasy past filled with mythical beasts, a dwarf kingdom and bare-breasted wild women smeared in white who look as if they stepped off the cover of a classic punk album by the Slits  seems to have been hatched in an altered state. Conjoined laughing and groaning is often the point when jokes are calibrated to go up (or down) with smoke.

title: A Bar That Counts Its Regulars
description: IN the universe of academic disciplines, one of the easiest to master is tavern math.

title: Older Parents Find More Joy in Their Bundles
description: THE GIST Older parents are happier than younger parents.

title: Movie Listings for April 8-14
description: Movies

title: Dance Listings for April 8-14
description: Dance

title: Success in These M.&A. Deals Appears on a Report Card
description: Tina Fineberg for The New York TimesChristina Feng, standing, teaches a high school class on Wall Street deals.

title: As Standoff Continues, a Bleaker Outlook for Ivory Coast
description: ACCRA, Ghana  Surrounded, outnumbered and under repeated attacks, the Ivory Coast strongman Laurent Gbagbo has held out against all odds, refusing to budge from the presidential residence in a last stand that has both befuddled and infuriated the international powers that are demanding his surrender.

title: Pop and Rock Listings for April 8-14
description: Pop

title: Jazz Listings for April 8-14
description: Jazz

title: Classical Music/Opera Listings for April 8-14
description: Classical

title: Instead of Helping, Trustee Program Is Hurting Veterans, Families Say
description: LANCASTER, Tex.  During the Korean War, Billy Brown faced enemy bullets, starvation and bitter cold. Now the benefits that he earned for his sacrifice have been tied up by the Department of Veterans Affairs, which in 2009 diverted his payments to trustees who have taken control not only of those funds, but of his life savings of some $100,000 as well.

title: Museum and Gallery Listings for April 8-14
description: Art

title: Soul Surfer Is Bethany Hamiltons Shark Tale
description: Make no mistake, Soul Surfer celebrates Christianity. The church is a somewhat stealthy supporting player within the film, based on the true tale of Bethany Hamilton, the rising 13-year-old amateur competition surfer in Hawaii who in 2003 lost an arm to a shark. But the piety takes a backseat to the welcome glimmers of grit. As a portrait of a spirited, resilient athlete, the movie succeeds best, unafraid to face its heroines daunting challenges directly.

title: Unions Move In at Chicago Charter Schools, and Resistance Is Swift
description: In a trend that worries charter school operators, teachers at 12 of Chicagos charters have formed unions over the past two years, and the Chicago Teachers Union is seeking to organize all 85 of the schools.

title: From Safe Distance, U.S.-Japanese Team Draws Up Plan to Demolish Reactors
description: TOKYO  Hydrogen explosions. High levels of radiation. Thousands of gallons of contaminated water dumped into the sea. With the drumbeat of bad news, including another powerful aftershock on Thursday, it will take months, if not years, to stabilize the reactors and spent fuel pools that were damaged in last months earthquake and tsunami at the Fukushima Daiichi plant.

title: Chicago Lawyers Caught Between Clients and Country
description: Jeffrey Colman, a Chicago lawyer, got a collect call Tuesday from a convicted murderer at Menard Correctional Facility in downstate Chester.

title: Satellite Photos Show Weaponry in Sudan
description: KAMPALA, Uganda  Tanks and attack helicopters have been spotted near the volatile Abyei region of Sudan, escalating concerns that northern and southern forces are engaging in a mass buildup of weaponry as negotiations between the sides continue to stagnate.

title: Say Her Name
description: Chapter One

title: A Marriages Tragic Early End
description: In the first scene of Francisco Goldmans passionate and moving autobiographical novel (or fictionalized memoir, depending on your bias), he travels to Paris with his young girlfriend, Aura Estrada. At her insistence, they go to the Jardin des Plantes to see the exotic salamanders Julio Cortzar wrote about in his famous story Axolotl. She wants to stare at them through the glass of their aquarium like the storys protagonist. The wish to stare through glass to come to an understanding (of the axolotl, of the workings of a writers mind, of what cannot truly be understood) elegantly conveys the project of Say Her Name, this beautifully written account of Goldmans short marriage to Estrada, a fiction writer who died in a bodysurfing accident in 2007, two years into their marriage, when she was 30.

title: A Bright-Burning life
description: An oddly sterile documentary inspired by a particularly fecund imagination, American: The Bill Hicks Story recounts a bright-burning life while leaving us mostly in the dark.

title: In Grand Crossing, a House Becomes a Home for Art
description: The wooden floors of the house at 6918 South Dorchester Avenue came from a West Side bowling alley. The stacks of vinyl records once stocked a Hyde Park record shop, and some of the windows once served as doors in a museum. Viewed from the kitchen, the words Museum Hours: 9 to 5 run backward across the glass.

title: John Rice Reflects on Losing
description: Just a few years ago, the 36th Ward Democrats were an important cog in Mayor Richard M. Daleys machine, and their leader enjoyed a central role in the citys building boom.

title: Facing Financial Instability, City Opera Seeks to Plug $5 Million Deficit
description: The New York City Opera is putting off an announcement of next seasons plans as it struggles to plug a $5 million deficit and to establish financial stability, the companys new chairman said in an interview on Thursday.

title: Mets Roof to Be Tamer This Season
description: There will be no climbing on the roof of the Metropolitan Museum of Art this summer. Nor are there likely to be lines of eager, sneaker-clad visitors hoping to glimpse Central Park from new heights.

title: Stuff Piled in the Aisle? Its There to Get You to Spend More
description: Americans like stuff.

title: Cuts to Family Planning May Add to States Expenses
description: Ross Ramsey, the managing editor of The Texas Tribune, writes a regular column for the Tribune.

title: Views on Monastic Life
description: Faces of monastic Christianity are examined at what seems like considerable length in Mysteries of the Jesus Prayer, a documentary seeking to shed a light on the beliefs and practices of monks living in cloistered solitude. Leading this spiritual journey are two educators: the Rev. Dr. John A. McGuckin, a priest-theologian of the Romanian Orthodox Church and a professor of Byzantine studies at Columbia and Union Theological Seminary, and Norris J. Chumley, a documentary veteran, columnist at Belief.net and The Huffington Post, and director of media for Columbias Institute for Religion, Culture and Public Life.

title: Its Senate vs. Austerity in Fight Over a Budget
description: Democrats did something rare on Sunday on the floor of the Texas House: They pleaded with their colleagues in the Senate to stop a budget bill they did not have the votes to block, and used strong words to send their message across the Rotunda.

title: Forest Service Copes With a Busy Wildfire Season
description: BROWNWOOD  At Camp Bowie, an army training center in west-central Texas, fire covered a hillside with gray smoke. A Black Hawk helicopter hovered above another smoking hill, dumping water. An army captain estimated that about 30 people  civilian and military  were fighting the blaze, which scorched nearly 3,000 acres by the time it was put out this week.

title: The Doctor Is In ...or Maybe She Isnt
description: To the Editor:

title: Tycoons Project: Nimby With a French Accent
description: PARIS  Bernard Arnault, the man who runs LVMH Mot Hennessy Louis Vuitton, usually gets what he wants, including, most recently, the Italian jewelry company Bulgari, which he purchased for an estimated $5.3 billion.

title: A Freak Folk Music Moment
description: As rumpled and scruffy as youd expect a documentary about its subjects to be, The Family Jams captures a moment, the summer of 2004, when the freak folk singers Devendra Banhart and Joanna Newsom, as well as the band Vetiver, crossed the country in a modest tour that preceded their individual breakout successes. The headliners have a penchant for intimate, largely acoustic songs, and in these settings  galleries, record stores and small, sweaty clubs  their gifts are on vivid, arresting display.

title: The Power of the Playground
description: Ask a young child, How was school today? and youre likely to hear about recess. My son is 7 years old, and like many children his age, recess is the emotional core of his school day. Whether he comes home light- or heavy-hearted depends on what happened during play time. This is common. Researchers say that one of the best predictors of whether kids feel happy in school is whether they feel comfortable and competent during recess.

title: Egypt's Re-Revolution
description: Egyptians continue fighting to root out prominent allies of Hosni Mubarak, suggesting that it is more difficult to change a system than to oust a leader.

title: Transition to Democracy
description: To the Editor:

title: GTT
description: Our quirky, discerning picks for the most interesting things to do around the state this week.

title: Oil Pipeline From Canada
description: To the Editor:

title: Hitting Children: Should It Be Outlawed?
description: To the Editor:

title: A Girl Moves Toward Adulthood
description: Taking its own sweet time to release information, Kati With an I, Robert Greenes endearing documentary about a strong-willed Southern girls transition to adulthood, finds virtue in vagueness and significance in the everyday.

title: The Obesity Stigma
description: To the Editor:

title: Sound Familiar?
description: To the Editor:

title: A Nature Film in Another Dimension
description: There appears to be a growing trend to let nature, which has already taken over large chunks of the television grid, invade movie houses as well; blame those marching penguins from back in 2005. This practice should probably be reined in before it goes much further, lest the eye-popping become commonplace. That said, Born to Be Wild 3D, the latest example, is pretty cool to look at.

title: Billionaires Unleashed
description: SEATTLE  The loneliest man in this city may be the pear-shaped billionaire whose yacht occasionally glides across Lake Washington at dusk, heading for a big empty house filled with stuff to keep him distracted.

title: The Ryan Journey
description: For decades, academics and think tankers have been proposing plans to avert a fiscal catastrophe. The ensuing debates were always sedate, high-minded affairs. Now Republican political leaders have come up with a bold proposal of their own and the atmosphere is totally different. Liberals are on the warpath. Republicans are aroused. This is great. Its democracy  how change begins.

title: N.F.L. Sides Agree on the Need for New Talks, but Not on Who Should Listen
description: One day after a federal judge encouraged them to resume negotiations in their labor standoff, the N.F.L. and lawyers for players sent letters to each other and to the court in which they agreed to start talking again with the help of a mediator.

title: Exotic Pets on the Run
description: After watching Michael Webbers alarming documentary The Elephant in the Living Room, you would be forgiven for believing that the State of Ohio is just one enormous, unfenced zoo.

title: Ludicrous and Cruel
description: Many commentators swooned earlier this week after House Republicans, led by the Budget Committee chairman, Paul Ryan, unveiled their budget proposals. They lavished praise on Mr. Ryan, asserting that his plan set a new standard of fiscal seriousness.

title: Pennsylvania Calls for More Water Tests
description: Pennsylvania environmental regulators said Wednesday that they were calling for waste treatment plants and drinking water facilities to increase testing for radioactive pollutants and other contaminants, to see whether they are ending up in rivers because of the growth of natural gas drilling in the state.

title: International Court Hears Charges in Kenyan Election Violence
description: PARIS  Three prominent Kenyans appeared Thursday before the International Criminal Court in The Hague on charges that they were responsible for the violence that followed Kenyas disputed elections in 2007. Three other Kenyans are to face similar accusations on Friday.

title: Apple Patent Application Shows Second Display
description: An Apple patent application  that surfaced online Thursday indicates that Apple could add a secondary display on the exterior of a future iPhone.

title: Literary Journals Thrive, on Paper and Otherwise
description: With local independent bookstores like A Different Light in the Castro and Modern Times in the Mission struggling to make ends meet, not to mention Borders bankruptcy and the general panic of the book publishing industry in the face of the e-reader, it would seem that literary pursuits of all kinds are under attack in this digital age.

title: Strip Clubs and Custody Battles
description: Flimsier than the stage outfits of its female star, Meet Monica Velour may be a teen-geek fantasy but its execution is unexpectedly mature.

title: Promising Much, but Doing Little to Aid the Terminals Homeless
description: Scott James writes a column for The Bay Citizen.

title: A Real Estate Showdown at BART
description: A two-year effort by BART to transform a key transit hub by selling development rights has stalled as rival board members champion their favored developers.

title: It May Be a Budget Battle, but Some Skirmishes Have Little to Do With Money
description: WASHINGTON  There are fights about money and fights about ideas, and the battle over a spending plan to keep the government open is increasingly centered on the latter.

title: Meeting Spencer Dissects Showbiz Machinations
description: Its not a backstage comedy, exactly, since the setting is Frankie & Johnnies, the well-known theater-district steakhouse, but Meeting Spencer is all about showbiz machinations, cogitations and aspirations. The film, though, directed by Malcolm Mowbray, isnt quite savvy enough to compete with the slyest entries in that genre or madcap enough to run with the zaniest.

title: When Blame Isnt Enough
description: Washington

title: On Devilish 10th Hole, Off-Color Whispers, Off-Line Putts
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  Martin Kaymer, the worlds top-ranked golfer, was walking through shrubs more than 50 yards to the left of the 10th fairway. He stepped into a clearing as if he was headed for the porch of one of the adjacent cabins at Augusta National Golf Club, as if he might snatch a burger off someones barbecue.

title: The Mess at the Top of New Yorks Schools
description: The New York City schools chancellor, Cathleen Black, acted in the best interest of the citys schoolchildren on Thursday when she stepped down after 95 days on the job.

title: Egypt Protests Go On, Seeking New Beginning
description: CAIRO  Banners fluttering from the rooftop of Cairo Universitys faculty of mass communications denounce the dean as a Mubarak-era lackey. Fistfights between the deans student opponents and supporters erupt like summer squalls, with the din often emptying classrooms as students pour into the main lobby either to join the fray or watch.

title: Kaymers Struggles at Augusta Continue
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  Martin Kaymer, the worlds top-ranked player, has played seven rounds in the Masters and never shot lower than 71. In Thursdays first round, he set a new personal high with a six-over-par 78. His average Masters round score is now 74.3.

title: Keeping Ahead of Qaddafi
description: Wars are messy business, and the international effort to keep Col. Muammar el-Qaddafis forces from slaughtering Libyan rebels and civilians is proving no exception. In recent days, the colonel has thwarted NATO airstrikes by regrouping his forces into densely populated areas. That has left NATO with a seemingly impossible choice: leave some of the regimes most deadly weapons unmolested, or target them and risk possibly heavy civilian casualties.

title: As Breaking News Fades, Ratings Fall at CNN
description: In a repetition of a pattern that has become familiar for CNN, the surge of interest in breaking news that helped drive up its audiences has faded  and so have CNNs ratings.

title: A Horror at Every Turn
description: Cleve Foster, a former Army recruiter convicted of murder, was scheduled to be executed earlier this week in Huntsville, Tex., when the Supreme Court rightly granted a stay pending a review of his case.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: April 7, 2011

title: New Search Technology Is Enhanced With Videos
description: The line between cyberspace and the physical world is blurring with a new search technology being demonstrated by Autonomy, a British software publisher.

title: Moving to the City, but Clinging to Native Ways
description: Karen Cooke Phillip keeps the basement freezer of her new Anchorage house stocked with food to ward off homesickness.

title: Before Britains Royal Wedding, Rumors Fly but Lips Are Sealed
description: LONDON  A flurry of excitement broke out in the pages of The Daily Mail the other day when Carole and Pippa Middleton, the mother and sister of Prince Williams future bride, Kate, entered a store in broad daylight.

title: Latinos Rise in Numbers, Not Influence
description: Over the last decade, Floridas Hispanic population has exploded, especially in central Florida, where the number of Hispanic residents in Orange County jumped 84 percent. They are now 308,244 of 1.2 million residents, about one in four.

title: Gap Seeks to Freshen Itself as a Peoples Brand
description: REMEMBER when Gap advertising was entertaining and effective, when everyone talked about Gap campaigns like Khakis swing?

title: An Eye for Retailing
description: Behind the familiar look of retail chains is a great deal of deliberative design.

title: Blending of Cultures Visible in the Food Trucks
description: To see how radically demographics have changed in Orange County, Calif., just look at whats for lunch.

title: Protesters in Syria Plan Large March Near Capital
description: CAIRO  Thousands of Syrians in small towns near Damascus joined antigovernment protests on Thursday in what activists said were preparations for larger demonstrations Friday in Douma, the working-class suburb where at least 15 protesters were killed by security forces last Friday.

title: Judge Approves Sale of St. Vincents Campus to Developers
description: A plan to build a luxury housing development and an emergency medical center in Greenwich Village came a step closer to reality on Thursday as a federal bankruptcy judge approved the sale of the bankrupt St. Vincents Hospital Manhattan campus.

title: Government Shutdown Would Have Wide Ripples
description: Its not just an estimated 800,000 federal employees who would feel the financial pinch of a government shutdown.

title: Persian Gulf Coalition Joins in Seeking Ouster of Yemeni President
description: SANA, Yemen  An organization of oil-rich Persian Gulf states has joined the increasing number of international voices calling for a transfer of presidential powers in Yemen.

title: Jean Bartik, Software Pioneer, Dies at 86
description: Jean Jennings Bartik, one of the first computer programmers and a pioneering forerunner in a technology that came to be known as software, died on March 23 at a nursing home in Poughkeepsie, N.Y. She was 86.

title: Warning by Israeli on U.N. Nod to Palestinians
description: UNITED NATIONS  President Shimon Peres of Israel warned Thursday against potential attempts by the United Nations to impose a Palestinian state on Israel and said that the recent recanting of the harshest conclusions by the author of a United Nations report accusing Israel of war crimes was insufficient to undo the libels caused to Israels reputation.

title: A Niche in the Wreckage of Florida Real Estate
description: NORTH PORT, Fla.  One recent morning, Shannon Moore raced through a musty pink house  three bedrooms, two baths  that was advertised as having good bones and primed for renovation. As in many recently foreclosed homes in Florida, the appliances and air-conditioner were missing from this one, either taken by the previous residents or stolen.

title: Real Estate Investors on the Rebound
description: Investors in Florida are trying to find good deals among the glut of homes on the market.

title: Michigan Stifles No. 1 North Dakota
description: ST. PAUL  Midway through the second period of an N.C.A.A. Frozen Four semifinal Thursday night, North Dakota right wing Danny Kristo wheeled at the left of the net and fired a quick shot at Shawn Hunwick, the Michigan goalie. Hunwick made the save, something he did repeatedly this night, and the sophomore Kristo slammed his stick on the ice.

title: Businesses Stand to Gain Most in Rivalry of States
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  This city, sharing a name with one state but settled in another, has a long history of ugly border skirmishes dating back to the Civil War. And even today, the annual football showdown here between the University of Kansas and the University of Missouri is referred to as The Border War.

title: Confederates at the Gate
description: On April 8, 1861, the same day that President Lincoln notified South Carolinas governor that he intended to resupply Fort Sumter, ratcheting up the possibility of an armed Southern response, he also met with the governor of Pennsylvania, Andrew G. Curtin, at the White House. The president had more than Sumter on his mind: according to Curtins account, reported in the Times, Lincoln stated he had information of a design to attack the city of Washington, and urged the governor  a close Republican Party ally  to ready his states militia for a quick deployment to the Union capital.

title: Recognition to the Specks on the Map
description: A wayfaring stranger, wandering into tiny Nadine, N.M., in years past, would not have officially been anywhere, at least in the eyes of the United States census. With only a few hundred souls, it was counted, if at all, as an extension of Hobbs, the nearest real city of about 34,000 people just to the north.

title: Veterinarian Urges Foundations Overhaul
description: The veterinarian hired by the Thoroughbred Retirement Foundation to evaluate the health of its herd says if the rescue group is to survive it must greatly reduce the number of horses it cares for, increase its financial support to the farms where they live and work with smaller organizations to retrain the horses for a second career in equestrian competitions or so they can be adopted.

title: Prostitutes Disappearances Were Noticed Only When the First Bodies Were Found
description: To those who loved them, the four prostitutes were daughters, sisters, friends. To the person or persons who killed them and dumped their bodies in the desolate brush off Ocean Parkway on Long Island, they were disposable.

title: Its Not Really About Spending
description: If the federal government shuts down at midnight on Friday  which seems likely unless negotiations take a sudden turn toward rationality  it will not be because of disagreements over spending. It will be because Republicans are refusing to budge on these ideological demands:

title: India: Superbug Gene Found in Environment
description: Bacteria containing an antibiotic-resistant superbug gene have been found in 2 of 51 tap water samples in New Delhi and in dozens of puddles and pools that children could play in, according to a report published Thursday in the journal Lancet Infectious Diseases. A team from Cardiff University in Britain found the gene, NDM-1, in 11 different types of bacteria, including those that cause cholera and dysentery. Bacteria with NDM-1 have caused fatal infections in people hospitalized in India, Pakistan and Bangladesh and in a few foreigners who visited those countries for surgery, but this is the first time they have been found in the environment. Their presence in water has not caused any known outbreaks of untreatable disease, but experts fear it could, especially in the rainy season.

title: Rondos Rollercoaster Season
description: If Rajon Rondos performance over the course of the 2010-11 season was charted in linear fashion, the volatility in his play would be clear. Rondos stats, like many common stocks, have been on a bit of a roller-coaster. His compiled statistics, which spiked early, recently tanked. Fascinatingly, this nosedive appears to be affixed to a particular starting point.

title: Disney Plans Lavish Park in Shanghai
description: SHANGHAI  The Walt Disney Company placed a huge bet on Chinas shifting approach to Westernized entertainment on Friday as it broke ground here on a $4.4 billion theme park and resort  even if it is one without classic American features like a Main Street.

title: Friday: Cry Before Someone Snaps
description: FRIDAYS PUZZLE  Today we have a history lesson from Joe Krozel. At first, I had trouble making out the graphic in the black squares, but Mr. Krozel was kind enough to explain it to me. The graphic happens to be the year 1961, and it turns out its there for a very good reason.

title: A Glimpse of Stocking? Shocking!
description: Who needs a brass section when youve got Sutton Foster? As the nightclub evangelist Reno Sweeney in the zesty new revival of Anything Goes, which opened on Thursday night at the Stephen Sondheim Theater, Ms. Foster has the voice of a trumpet and a big, gleaming presence that floods the house. When she leads the show-stopping Blow, Gabriel, Blow, you figure that if no horn-tooting archangel appears, its only because hes afraid of the competition.

title: At Yale, Sharper Look at Treatment of Women
description: NEW HAVEN  It has taken on the predictability of an annual ritual, like parents weekend or commencement: the outburst of raunchy male behavior that has shaken the Yale University campus in each of the last few school years.

title: Surveillance Video Is Shown at Rape Trial of 2 Officers
description: They flashed across the gray screen for just a matter of seconds.

title: In Ivory Coast, Democrat to Dictator
description: Paris

title: Rangers Lose, Leaving Playoff Hopes in Other Teams Hands
description: No matter how the Rangers fared Thursday against the Atlanta Thrashers, they could not earn a little x next to their name in the N.H.L. standings for having clinched a playoff berth. But they could have skimmed much of the suspense from a punishing playoff push.

title: After 3 Months, Mayor Replaces Schools Leader
description: This article was reported by  Michael Barbaro, Sharon Otterman and  Javier C. Hernandez and written by Mr. Barbaro.

title: No Accord in Budget Talks as Policy Fights Hamper Deal
description: WASHINGTON  Another day of intense negotiations between the two parties failed to yield a budget deal on Thursday, leaving the federal government hours from a shutdown.

title: Workers Wonder Just How Long the Weekend Will Be
description: WASHINGTON  One federal worker had planned to take his family to Colonial Williamsburg this weekend. Someone decided that he was an essential worker, however, meaning that Sasha and Malia Obama might not get to roll a hoop and churn butter with their dad after all.

title: At Seasons End, a Special Award
description: Beyond all the player of the year awards handed out at the end of each college basketball season, the most inspirational (and least publicized) honor may be the Most Courageous Award given by the United States Basketball Writers Association. Rice forward Arsalan Kazemi is one of the 2011 recipients, accepting his award at the mens Final Four in Houston.

title: New York Seeks to End Abuse of State Parking Permits
description: Cuomo administration officials announced on Thursday that they would sharply reduce the number of police parking placards handed out each year in an effort to crack down on abuses by state officials.

title: Redistricting Battle Under Way, With Lobbyists and Lawyers
description: WASHINGTON  As a congressman from Buffalo, Brian Higgins is usually on the receiving end of entreaties from high-powered lobbyists. But with state lawmakers in Albany and nationwide preparing to redraw their electoral districts, Mr. Higgins has turned the tables, appointing his own lobbyist to try to save his district  and his job.

title: Friend of Obama Is Arrested in Prostitution Sting
description: A longtime friend and golfing partner of President Obamas, Robert Titcomb, was arrested on a charge of soliciting prostitution after being swept up in an undercover operation in downtown Honolulu on Monday night, police officials said. Mr. Titcomb, 49, is accused of approaching an officer who was posing as a prostitute.

title: Edward Bigelow, Dancer With the New York City Ballet, Dies at 93
description: Edward Bigelow, a longtime dancer and administrator at the New York City Ballet who originated many dramatic character roles including the Mouse King in George Balanchines Nutcracker, died on Monday in a car accident in Sharon, Conn. He was 93 and lived in West Cornwall, Conn.

title: Justice Surges to Lead After Clerk Reports Vote Error
description: CHICAGO  The tally of a close Wisconsin Supreme Court election, which had come to be a referendum on Republican leadership in the state, turned upside down on Thursday evening: the incumbent justice, viewed as a conservative, took a lead of more than 7,000 votes after a clerk in one Republican-leaning county announced she had initially failed to report some 14,000 votes.

title: On Radiolab, the Sound of Science
description: Jad Abumrad was talking about tension the tension between the certainty of science and mysteries that inspire wonder; between authenticity and artifice; between a sound that feels carefully constructed and one that feels anarchic and alive. You want to seduce people, he said. But you also want to disturb them. Abumrad, who is 37, is the co-host and producer of Radiolab, a public radio show that breaks from public radio sensibilities, not least in its striking sound. I put in a lot of jaggedy sounds, little plurps and things, strange staccato, percussive things  people dont like that so much, he said. Some people dont, anyway.

title: Sewage Flow Into a Tennessee River Is Stopped
description: Emergency workers on Wednesday contained a leak at a water treatment plant in Tennessee that had been spewing millions of gallons of largely untreated sewage into a river.

title: Rangers Hope Thrashers Again Play Spoiler
description: With little else to play for except pride, the Atlanta Thrashers relished silencing the fans at Madison Square Garden during a 3-0 victory against the Rangers on Thursday. This was the type of performance expected from a team officially eliminated from the playoff chase.

title: Alabama: Bacteria Found in Pharmacy Faucet
description: The Alabama Department of Public Health said Thursday that a contaminated intravenous nutritional supplement that was given to nine patients who died in hospitals last month was due to a bacterial contamination in a water faucet in the pharmacy where the supplement was produced. Dr. Donald E. Williamson, Alabamas state health officer, said at a news conference on Thursday that the bacteria, Serratia marcescens, had been found in a faucet at Meds IV Pharmacy in Birmingham, a compounding pharmacy that makes medications that do not come premixed. From the faucet, the bacteria was introduced to tap water used to clean a container in which the nutritional supplement, called Total Parenteral Nutrition, was mixed. The bacteria has been found in the container, a stirring instrument and the amino acid powder used to make the supplement.

title: Corrections
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Word of the Day | flit
description: flit \flit\ verb/noun

title: Schools New Emissary, From City Hall
description: At the news conference Thursday where Dennis M. Walcott was announced as the nominee to become New York City schools chancellor, he spoke about his luck, his personal history and his goals for the citys schools. Then, he turned to 16 elementary school students gathered in the room.

title: Deal for YES and DirecTV
description: The YES Network and DirecTV reached an agreement that will prevent any disruption in service. The deal was reached in time for the start of the Yankees-Red Sox series Friday.

title: Battles and Evacuations in Abidjan
description: A violent struggle for power in Ivory Coast leaves residents fearful and foreigners running for safety.

title: Village Doubts It Could Have Handled Terror Trial
description: OTISVILLE, N.Y.  To describe this small Orange County village as a one-stoplight town would be grossly inaccurate. There are no traffic lights here.

title: News Quiz | April 8, 2011
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper.
