title: In Europe, Is the VAT Refund Worth Your Time?
description: PLANNING to shop your way through Europe this summer? Youll pay a premium for that Herms scarf in Paris or those red stilettos in Milan, unless you apply for the value-added tax (VAT) refund.

title: Shining Strobe Lights on the Citys Dark Corners
The Gingrich State of Mind
description: With all the talk last week of a possible government shutdown and the ongoing chatter about which Republicans will decide to run for president in 2012, I was pleased to come across this Esquire profile from last summer of Newt Gingrich. What makes this piece compelling is the voice of Marianne Gingrich, Newts second wife (he left his first wife for her  going to the hospital where No. 1 was recovering from uterine cancer to bring her divorce terms). He has since left Marianne too  after an affair with his Congressional aide Callista Bisek, she became No. 3.

title: Smoked Salmon Any Way You Slice It
description: In common usage, the terms smoked salmon and lox are pretty much used interchangeably, which is how I use them when I wrote about my matzo brei variation on lox, eggs and onions. Both refer to salmon that is cured and tastes good on a bagel. In fact, the word lox is probably derived from the Yiddish and German words for salmon, lachs (or laks).

title: Job Openings on the Rise
description: Some very good news on the jobs front: The number of job openings rose at their fastest pace in almost seven years in February, according to a new report from the Labor Department.

description: The French conglomerate Schneider Electric would likely need to pay a high price for Tyco International, Morgan Stanley analysts speculated in a recent report.

title: Woman Tells of Boys Plea for Help After 4 Drownings
description: Meave Ryan saw the boy waving his arms as she braked to a stop behind a string of cars. The other cars went on through the intersection, but she rolled down the window. He was screaming for help, she said. He said, My mommy just drove the car in the water.

description: Earlier this week I questioned why OpenTable insisted on sending checks by snail mail to users who earned rewards points by dining out. It seems that Starbucks, too, uses the Postal Service to deliver reward coupons to loyal latte drinkers.

description: Recruiters of New York Citys best high school basketball players have long gone to the toughest corners of the five boroughs  housing projects and violent playgrounds, and households of desperation and inspiration both.

title: In Japan, Aftershocks Are Also Felt From Within
description: TOKYO  Aguri Suzuki, a 44-year-old real estate agent, says she sometimes thinks the ground is shaking even when it is not. When she sees a tree branch swaying in the wind, she worries there has been an earthquake.

description: Internet advertising revenue continues to rise, according to a report released Wednesday by the Interactive Advertising Bureau and PricewaterhouseCoopers.

title: Presidential Fund-Raising Kicks Off
description: Paul Volpe and Jeff Zeleny discuss fund-raising for the 2012 presidential election, which begins in earnest on Thursday when President Obama is expected to travel to Chicago for a series of events.

title: Asked and Answered | Zeina Durra
description: In Zeina Durras feature-length film debut, The Imperialists Are Still Alive! which opens in New York on Friday, the British director depicts the paranoid post-9/11 life of Arabs in New York City through the stories of a group of affluent but troubled Middle Eastern migrs. Durra, a 34-year-old Londoner who studied film at New York University, says her own cultural influences  shes of mixed Middle Eastern and Bosnian descent  inspired the films protagonist, Asya. Asya (played by the French actress lodie Bouchez) is a downtown artist who has lumped together her Palestinian, Bosnian, Jordanian, Lebanese and Parisian heritages into some familiar Manhattan mystique.

title: Video: The 2012 Money Primary Begins
Former FrontPoint Manager Charged With Insider Trading
description: John Marshall Mantel for The New York TimesJoseph F. Skowron leaving federal court in Manhattan on Wednesday.

title: The New Bunny, Artie and Bananas
description: BEN STILLERS first memory of the theater was tagging along with his mother, the actress Anne Meara, to rehearsals of John Guares dark comedy The House of Blue Leaves in 1971, the year it made its Off Broadway debut. Ms. Meara played the loud-mouthed Bunny Flingus, and Bunnys fake fur coat was the boys earliest cue that this grown-up thing called work could include imaginary worlds and garish get-ups (see Zoolander, Derek).

title: The Governors Official Fashion Statement
description: ALBANY  Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo is urging his staff members to accessorize  in the name of reforming the culture of state government, naturally.

title: Thoughtless or Careless
description: Are bullies amoral or are they simply cruel? That is to say, do they bully others because they dont know the difference between right and wrong, or simply because they dont care about other peoples feelings? Gianluca Gini, Tiziana Pozzoli and Marc Hauser studied this question for the Journal Personality and Individual Differences. They studied 719 children between the ages of 9 and 13 and found that those who engaged in bullying had advanced moral competence. They could make sophisticated distinctions between moral and immoral conduct. They scored low on measures of compassion, though. This reinforces a growing body of research that suggests knowing right from wrong is not necessarily connected to behaving rightly or wrongly. Moral lectures dont work well, but telling people stories designed to arouse compassion might.

title: The Dark Side of the Moon
description: Pop quiz: Which scenario would strike todays children as more implausible?

description: Corridors of newly-planted wildflowers designed to revive Britains bee population.Reporting on efforts to reverse Britains falling bee numbers, The Press Association revealed:

title: A Curmudgeons View of the Energy Challenge
description: One of the worlds great minds on issues of energy use, food production and the connection between them is a fellow named Vaclav Smil, of the University of Manitoba. Bill Gates reads him. He is No. 49 on Foreign Policy magazines list of the top 100 global thinkers. He is often a curmudgeon, but our editorial colleague Andrew Revkin recently pitted him against the environmental advocate Lester Brown on questions of future food supply, with Dr. Smil playing the optimist that time.

title: Struggling to Pick a College? Try a Pro-Con List
description: Ms. Dunham is the counseling department coordinator at Cherry Creek High in Denver, whose students are blogging their college admissions process in a series on The Choice.

title: Jackson and Cameron to Speed Up 3-D
description: Two of Hollywoods most progressive directors, James Cameron and Peter Jackson, are pushing forward with a new style of shooting that they say will make 3-D movies easier to watch. Film purists are likely to howl, and the majority of movie theaters dont have compatible projection equipment.

title: Bomber Strikes at Meeting of Afghan Elders
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A suicide bomber on foot detonated his explosives on Wednesday as tribal elders left a meeting in a remote mountain village in eastern Afghanistan, killing one of the most senior local figures and 11 other people, including 5 schoolboys.

title: Substance Abuse in Black and White
description: Anastasia Vogt Yuan studied substance abuse among blacks and whites. In the journal Sociological Spectrum, she reports that blacks have lower rates of drug use than whites during early adolescence, but this gap gets inverted as they age. That is to say, whites are more likely to age out of drug usethey stop as they get older. Blacks, perhaps because of work, economic and family conditions, age out less, so by middle age they are using drugs more than whites. This would seem to put a dent in the theory that blacks suffer higher rates of drug use because they are more likely to grow up in single parent homes. If that were true, youd see the effects in early adolescence. The evidence would seem to point to broader social influences.

title: Permira to Buy BakerCorp for $960 Million
description: Permira agreed on Wednesday to buy BakerCorp, which rents out pump, containment and filtration equipment to industrial customers, for $960 million.

title: Songs About Myself
description: This result isnt surprising or controversial, but its nice to have somebody rigorously confirm an impression many of us have formed. In an upcoming essay for the journal, Psychology of Aesthetics, Creativity and the Arts, Nathan DeWall and others studied pop music lyrics between 1980 and 2007. They found that over these years lyrics that refer to self-focus and antisocial behavior have increased whereas words related to other-focus, social interactions and positive emotions have decreased. Weve gone from Love, Love, Love to F.U.

title: The Basics of Autism
description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention estimates that one in 110 children in the United States has an autism spectrum disorder. There are no medical tests to diagnose autism. Therefore, it is critical that a child be given a developmental screening  as well as an screening for autism spectrum disorders  at specific ages during well-child doctor visits. Here are five things experts advise every parent should know about autism.

title: Audi Pulls the Wraps Off Its New Q3
description: The official introduction of Audis new Q3 compact S.U.V. will take place next week at the Shanghai Auto Show. But subscribing to a practice that seems to be the new industry standard, Audi jumped the gun on Wednesday and released photos and substantial details.

title: The 3 Biggest Tax Breaks  and What They Cost Us
description: If there is one big-ticket budget item on which Democrats and Republicans should be able to find common ground, its tax breaks. Each of the various bipartisan deficit panels has called for a big reduction, saying such breaks  exemptions, deductions, credits and other loopholes  are inefficient and unaffordable. All told, they cost the federal government about $1.2 trillion in lost revenue last year. As it happens, the budget deficit was $1.3 trillion.

title: Republicans Against Cost Control
description: Many people are noting this CNN poll, which shows an overwhelming sentiment that Gallup describes as dont mess with Medicare. What I find especially interesting isnt just the fact that Republicans share that sentiment; its the fact that they are far more likely than Democrats to oppose any effort to control costs.

title: Part 4: Answers to Readers Decision-Time Questions
description: All this week, Bruce Poch, a veteran of the admissions world who worked at Wesleyan and Connecticut College before serving, until recently, as dean of admissions at Pomona College in California, is answering questions submitted by readers of The Choice.

title: Chinese Chess Phenom, After a Stumble, Roars Back
description: As China has climbed the ranks of the worlds chess powers (reaching No. 3 in the latest rankings), several of its players have also risen among the worlds elite. Currently, Wang Yue is No. 14 and Wang Hao is No. 20. Bu Xiangzhi, No. 63, was No. 26 as recently as October 2008.

title: What to Ask About Autism
description: Confronting a new diagnosis can be frightening and, because research changes so often, confusing. Here are some questions you may not think to ask your doctor, along with notes on why theyre important.

title: Lapel Invader
description: During the recent New York fashion shows, the blogger Hanneli Mustaparta posted a snapshot of Andreea Diaconu wearing a panda bear brooch that looked like a relic from the Atari age. After numerous Google searches (no luck), inquisitive e-mails (no luck) and one (lucky) Facebook search, we found the maker of the pin: 19-year-old Taj Melendez in Brooklyn, New York. During art class in elementary school, we would do projects like these with perler beads, says Melendez, who, like Space Invader, the street artist with a similar aesthetic, seems to shy away from attention rather than seek it out. He made his first pin, a replica of the mens restroom icon, when he was 16. I just wanted to start something, I wanted to stand out. He sells his designs  bow ties, barrettes and an assortment of brooches like a thought bubble or a football  through his Web site ($55 to $75; go to bytaj.com). I want to keep them special  thats why I dont create too many too fast. When asked how Diaconu got her hands on that darling panda face, he shrugs with disbelief. I have no idea, he says. But I sure was happy.

title: Teeing Off for Japan
description: The crisis in Japan, this coming weekends Health and Wellness Issue of the magazine and the singer Anne Murray: it sounds like a setup for one of Johnny Carsons Karnak the Magnificent what-do-these-three-have-in-common? gags. But lets take it two at a time. Murray, the Canadian snowbird who had a boatload of hits in the 70s and 80s, is one of many EMI artists taking part in a charity auction to help victims of the earthquake/tsunami/nuclear devastation in Japan. David Bowie is offering 35 signed albums, Norah Jones a signed guitar. Whats Murrays contribution? Eighteen holes of golf with her at the Angus Glen Golf Club in Ontario.

title: Bar Ice With a Pedigree
description: Anyone who has patronized Dutch Kills, the cocktail bar in Long Island City, Queens, has probably noticed the showy supporting role ice plays in its drinks. Long frozen spears skewer highballs.

title: BP Scrambles to Salvage Rosneft Deal as a Deadline Nears
description: LONDON  BP struggled Wednesday to salvage its deal with the Russian oil company Rosneft before a deadline to complete the pact expired on Thursday.

title: Webber to the Kings Rescue?
description: Things are looking dark in Sacramento, even for the most die-hard fans who hope the Kings will not move to Anaheim. Sacramentos mayor and former N.B.A. player Kevin Johnson has likened the situation to a slow death.But could there be a last minute ray of hope, from an unexpected source? Former Kings All-Star Chris Webber, now an analyst for TNT, has indicated a willingness to invest in the team to keep it in Sacramento, according to the Sacramento Bee.

title: When the Subject Owns the Image
description: Andrea Morales was born in Lima, Peru, and raised in Miami. She studied journalism at the University of Florida before pursuing a masters degree at the Ohio University School of Visual Communication. In June, Ms. Morales will move to New York to intern in the photo department at The New York Times. Ms. Morales is the second of three summer photo interns to be featured on Turning Point.

title: Advice From a Sticky Web Site on How to Make Yours the Same
description: If you search the Internet for the word blackberry, the first result you are likely to find is the smartphone, not the fruit.

title: On Location
description: The rectangular-shaped home of Francesc Ortega and Mara Farriol appears to cling from the mountainside and has commanding views of the Monserrat mountains.

title: In Spain, a Home Nestles Into the Environment
description: VACARISSES, Spain  In fleeing urban life, Francesc Ortega and Mara Farriol took a leap of faith. They bought a mountain plot unmatched in its awesome views, but with a 45 degree slope, before checking if building a house there was even possible.

title: A.I.G. Hires Morgan Stanley Banker as Internal Deal Maker
description: The American International Group announced on Wednesday that it had hired Peter Juhas from Morgan Stanley as its head of strategic planning.

title: With Autism, One Size Doesnt Fit All
description: David G. Amaral is the director of research at the M.I.N.D. institute at the University of California, Davis, and the principal investigator of the Autism Phenome Project, an early-phase research study comparing children ages 2 to 3 1/2 who have autism with their peers. The goal is to distinguish different types of autism based on extensive medical exams, gene and blood tests, immune measures, M.R.I. brain scans and other biomedical and behavioral markers. The researchers have recruited just over 300 families for the study and are recruiting additional volunteers.

title: Have You Hired a Web Marketing Specialist?
description: In a small-business conversation weve just posted, Adriana Gardella asks Jay Bean, owner of a fast-growing Web marketing firm, what mistakes he sees small-business owners making in their marketing efforts. Mr. Bean, who has made his own mistakes as a small retailer, had this to say: One is that, because one-third of mobile searches have local intent, a small business that doesnt consider mobile will miss the boat. More generally, business owners spend more time building their businesses, and less on what they dont understand, like Internet marketing. Small businesses think they can do it alone, but they cant.

title: Lucy and the Economic Football
description: The National Journal:

title: Selected Studies: Autism
description: Government agencies, universities, physicians and corporations frequently enroll patients in studies designed to test the effectiveness of new drugs, procedures and medical devices. Participants may benefit by gaining access to experimental therapies, and they make an important contribution to scientific research. For more information, please visit ClinicalTrials.gov, a service of the National Institutes of Health.

title: Report Criticizes Banks for Handling of Mortgages
description: Banks did a poor job of handling the flood of foreclosures over the last several years, in some cases even moving ahead with evictions when they clearly should not have, according to a long-awaited report released Wednesday by federal regulators.

title: McKinley in Hawaii
description: I managed to live in Honolulu for four years in the 1990s without quite realizing that McKinley High School was named after THAT McKinley, the president who legally (or illegally, depending on your perspective) annexed (or in fact did not actually annex) Hawaii.

title: Obamas Speech on Reducing the Budget (Text)
description: Following is a text of President Obama's debt-reduction speech, delivered on Wednesday at George Washington University, as released by the White House:

title: Game 1s in Eastern Conference Playoffs Are Set
description: The Knicks seven-year playoff drought will officially come to an end Sunday at 7 p.m. when they open a first-round series against the Celtics at Boston Garden. The game will be televised by TNT, according to the limited schedule released by the N.B.A. Wednesday afternoon.

title: Obamas Debt Plan Sets Stage for Long Battle Over Spending
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama made the case Wednesday for slowing the rapid growth of the national debt while retaining core Democratic values, proposing a mix of long-term spending cuts, tax increases and changes to social welfare programs as his opening position in a fierce partisan budget battle over the nations fiscal challenges.

title: In Nova Scotia, a 19th-Century House on the Bay
description: Nova Scotias second-home market is concentrated on its South Shore.

title: House Hunting in ... Nova Scotia
description: A FOUR-BEDROOM HOUSE AND A SEPARATE COTTAGE ON THE SOUTH SHORE OF NOVA SCOTIA

title: A Generation of Autism, Coming of Age
description: As the explosion of children who were found to have autism in the 1990s begins to transition from the school to the adult system, experts caution about the coming wave.

title: Tender Bow Ties
description: Time has a way of turning matronly frumps into style icons. The richly illustrated Seeing Gertrude Stein (University of California Press, $45), paired with a show coming to the Contemporary Jewish Museum in San Francisco, amounts to a visual history of the writer and art patron. It collects many of the sculptures and paintings she sat for, including that Picasso, along with her bohemian fashion statements: the vests, the brooches, even a custom Balmain frock.

title: Did Bryant Use Gay Slur Toward Referee?
description: 2:48 p.m. | Updated Kobe Bryant, in response to reports that he used a gay slur toward referee Bennie Adams in Tuesday nights game against the Spurs, issued a statement Wednesday afternoon that was released by the Lakers:

title: Often-Sanctioned Trainer Denied Kentucky License
description: The trainer Rick Dutrow was denied a racing license in Kentucky on Wednesday and cannot start horses in the state for the rest of the year.

title: NCIS Boosts CBS on Tuesday
description: NCIS delivered the largest audience in prime time on Tuesday as the procedural drama lifted CBS to No. 1 for the night even as the network trailed slightly during the 9 and 10 p.m. time slots. According to Nielsens estimates, 19.2 million viewers tuned in at 8 p.m. for NCIS on CBS; during the 9 p.m. hour, that networks NCIS: Los Angeles (15.3 million) finished just slightly behind ABCs Dancing With the Stars results episode (15.5 million). At 10,Body of Proof (11.3 million) on ABC edged The Good Wife on CBS (10.9 million). ABC placed second for the night, lagging behind at 8 with the second season premiere of Jamie Olivers Food Revolution (5.3 million). NBC ranked third, averaging 7.2 million viewers for The Biggest Loser from 8 to 10, followed by Parenthood (5.1 million). Fox was a distant fourth among the networks with mostly reruns.

title: Fear the Bond Market
description: James Carville famously said that if reincarnated, hed like to come back as the bond market, since you can intimidate everybody.

title: Root Canal Republican
description: Republicans who advocate painful spending cuts.

title: Finding (and Funding) an Internship for Junior
description: Britains Deputy Prime Minister, Nick Clegg, began his political career decades ago with an internship at a Finnish bank. He nabbed the slot with the help of his father  and now he is arguing that such ins should be banned (or, at least, sharply curbed).

title: Educator Salutes Galleon Trial Defendant
description: 8:55 p.m. | Updated

title: The Budget Speech
description: Style: I liked the way Obama made a case for government at the beginning. I liked the way he accused Republicans of pessimism, of abandoning a hopeful vision of America. Good that he went after the Ryan plan  and good that he went after the cruelty of that plan. If you ask me, too many percentages. Oh, and whichever speechwriter came up with win the future should be sent to count yurts in Outer Mongolia.

title: Inside Obamas Half-Sisters Childrens Book
description: Barack Obama may be a polarizing figure on the grownup shelves at bookstores. But in the childrens books section, the president, first lady, the Obama girls and now, with the release of her first picture book, his half-sister, are greeted with near universal accolades and adoration. Of Thee I Sing, President Obamas own picture book contribution, has already spent 20 weeks on our best-seller list.

title: The Largest Tax Breaks for Individuals
description: The economist Eric Toder has pointed out that the largest corporate tax loopholes also happen to be among the most politically popular. They include the tax breaks for new machinery and for research and development. The policies dont seem like corporate giveaways  though, to some extent, they are  as much as they seem like efforts to create jobs.

title: Fed Report Notes That Economy Continues to Improve
description: Economic activity in the United States continued to improve over the last month, helped by the manufacturing and retail sectors, but the disaster in Japan and higher energy prices created new uncertainty about the outlook, according to a survey of the Federal Reserves 12 districts released on Wednesday.

title: Motorola Solutions and Huawei Settle Claims Over Intellectual Property
description: SHANGHAI  Motorola Solutions and the Chinese company Huawei Technologies said Wednesday that they had agreed to settle a pair of lawsuits over intellectual property.

title: Obama, Ryan, and the Shape of the Planet
description: Im already hearing some people saying, Why dont you subject Obama to the same kind of criticism you leveled at Ryan?

title: Would You Sign My Kindle?
description: SITTING at a table in a Barnes & Noble in St. Petersburg, Fla., T. J. Waters was signing copies of his book Hyperformance when a fan standing in line with the eBook version walked up and said, Its too bad you cant sign my Kindle.

title: Reader Idea | A Student-Driven Bullying Curriculum
description: Here is another in our Great Ideas From Readers series.

title: Putin Makes Russians Wonder Who Might Lead Them Next
description: MOSCOW  As Russia heads into a season of deepening political uncertainty, Prime Minister Vladimir V. Putin laid out his rationale on Wednesday for keeping the public, and the government, in the dark about who would be the countrys next president.

title: The 10 Things to Talk About This Weekend
description: 1. Senator Rand Paul explains the plot of the Ayn Rand novel Anthem to the Senate. Theres these people who want to dismantle Medicare and Social Security, see. ...

title: Wells Fargo Will Test Chip Cards for Travelers
description: Updated | April 14, 2011

title: Desolate and Stylized Urban Scenes
description: Our colleagues at City Room featured a blog post on Wednesday morning about Xavier Nuez, a Chicago-based art photographer whose stylized scenes of urban decrepitude are on display in Manhattan through Monday.

title: Light Headed
description: Baby-blonde hair may be all the rage, but its not for everyone. According to Marie Robinson, who counts Emma Stone, Naomi Watts and Michelle Williams among her pale-tressed clients, It works best on women who are at least halfway there to begin with, and they need touch-ups every four weeks. That said, its brightening effect on the skin is well worth the effort. Its rejuvenating, says Chelsey Pickthorn, the Orlo Salon colorist who coaxed the model Abbey Lee Kershaws locks to the perfect platinum. But you really need to assess the hairs condition before starting and then proceed slowly, with great care.

title: A Mannequin in Every Sense
description: LITTLE more than a year ago, during a small posthumous presentation of the collection Alexander McQueen had been designing in the days just before he killed himself, Polina Kasina, one of his favorite models, appeared in a form-fitting coat made of thousands of gold-painted duck feathers, worn over a full white skirt embroidered with gold threads. It was the final look of what would be Mr. McQueens final show.

title: Bill Clinton Recalls the Old Times Square
description: Leave it to Bill Clinton to steal the show  and somehow weave a tale of a steak and a prostitute into a news conference.

title: Milestones: John McCain
description: An interactive timeline of John McCains life and career.

title: Romney: Father and Son
description: George Romney had big ideas for his youngest son, Mitt.

title: Thompson the Investigator
description: While Fred D. Thompson is perhaps best known as an actor, it is his real-life role as an investigator of government wrongdoing that has become a central part of his political biography.

title: An Abbreviated Contest
description: The early stages of the 2000 Senate race in New York offered a lesson on the politics of psychological warfare.

title: Romney and the 2002 Olympic Games
description: Mitt Romney walked onto the Olympic stage in 1999 a rich businessman still smarting from losing his first bid for public office. He walked off, three years later, a star-polished candidate.

title: Producer, Writer, Star and One Funny Mama
description: ITS 3 p.m. on a weekday, and Tina Fey is leaving her office in Long Island City, Queens, to pick up her daughter from preschool on the Upper East Side. You can come along, she tells a visitor, but youll have to ride in the car seat.

title: Comparing Republican and Obama Budget Plans
description: A comparison the competing budget plans.

title: Road to November: The West
description: As The Timess cross-country political road trip continues, a look back at stops in the West, from electoral safe havens to swing states.

title: Road to November: The Journey Ends
description: The Timess cross-country political road trip comes to an end on the East Coast.

title: Canvassing for Obama in McCains Nevada Base
description: Elko, Nev., a stop on the Road to November, is a small, red town in a purple state where Obama volunteers are aggressively seeking out undecided voters.

title: Road to November: The Heartland
description: The Timess cross-country trip continued through the middle of the United States.

title: Road to November: San Francisco
description: San Francisco, at the fringe of the nations consciousness.

title: New York Landmarks Panel Wants Changes in Plan for Former Bank
description: The New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission has sent the owner of the former Manufacturers Hanover Trust building back to the drawing board yet again to revise its renovation plans for the interior of the building on Fifth Avenue at 43rd Street. The interior was designated a landmark in February; the exterior has had that status since 1997.

title: Anything Goes Extends Into 2012
description: Broadways revival of Anything Goes wont be going anywhere any time soon. On Wednesday, Roundabout Theater Company announced that its production of that Cole Porter musical, starring Sutton Foster as the evangelizing nightclub singer Reno Sweeney and Joel Grey as the milquetoast gangster Moonface Martin, will extend its run by about six months. The revival, directed and choreographed by Kathleen Marshall, is now planned to play at the Stephen Sondheim Theater through January 8; it was originally scheduled to close after July 31. (Thats roughly 184 more performances of cruise-ship based musical farce, so lets hope everyone packed some additional swim trunks.) Reviewing this production of Anything Goes for The New York Times, Ben Brantley wrote that it exudes the effervescence of a freshly poured gin fizz, adding that when Ms. Foster turns her toothy, triumphant smile on the audience theres no doubt that shes made many converts.

title: The Price of Perception
description: RECENTLY, I joined friends at a lunch table where a lively discussion of college tuition was in progress. The question at hand was a chestnut: why does college cost so much, and why does the cost grow so alarmingly year after year? I interrupted my lunch mates. They  and most of the public  misconstrue the issue. They are really asking why the price of tuition is so high.

title: Top 10 List: Where the Jobs Are
description: Looming worker shortage. Thats not a phrase one expects to hear at a time of high unemployment. But when experts look at the Bureau of Labor Statistics list of the fastest-growing occupations, thats what they see: more than a million new jobs on the horizon by 2018, and a worker pool that may not be trained to fill them.

title: TimesCast | April 13, 2011
description: Egyptian police detain former President Hosni Mubarak and his two sons; NATO, Arab and African ministers met with Libya's rebels in Qatar; and rival military factions clash in Yemen.

title: Syrian Women Demand Release of Detainees
description: Updated | Thursday | 9:35 a.m. Hundreds of women and children from the Syrian village of Bayda, where large numbers of men were reportedly detained on Tuesday, marched to Syrias main coastal highway on Wednesday, calling for the release of their husbands, fathers and sons, human rights activists told Reuters.

title: Q. and A. With Tina Fey
description: Whats the opposite of blerg? Whatever it is, Tina Fey has been enjoying it recently.

title: Pawlenty Criticizes Budget Agreement
description: 4:39 p.m. | Updated The fissures inside the Republican Party, particularly among Congressional leaders and prospective presidential candidates, are growing more pronounced as the budget debate intensifies in Washington.

title: Ground Level: Colorado
description: Defying labels, many voters opt to cross party lines.

title: Ground Level: Northeast
description: Some states have found new relevance in this year's campaign schedule.

title: Ground Level: Missouri
description: For a century, voters in Missouri have proven to be a nearly perfect gauge of the nation's thinking on would-be presidents.

title: Ground Level: The South
description: Scenes from a region that Democrats need to win in November.

title: Signs of Exuberance at the Auto Show
description: Automakers are showing new models at a show that seems to have recovered some of its former glitz.

title: Notable Models at the 2010 New York Auto Show
description: As the auto industry regroups, manufacturers prepared to showcase their newest offerings to consumers at the show in New York.

title: Dynegy Hires Restructuring Advisers
description: Dynegy said on Wednesday that it had hired Lazard and the law firm White & Case as advisers to help reorganize the beleaguered energy companys debt.

title: Tale of a Fateful Trip
description: FASHION can be a form of subterfuge, cloaking unseemly realities under a layer of sequins and paint. Or it can be a refuge, an adaptive coloration. For Philip Monaghan it has been both, and a springboard, as well, for self-invention.

title: View From a Pension Fund
description: Jim Leech, president and chief executive of the Ontario Teachers Pension Plan, provides insight on CNBC on managing a pension fund, quantitative easing and the common Canadian view on the United States economy.

title: A Host of New Shows From Scripps Networks
description: The cable channels owned by Scripps Networks Interactive plan to flood the zone for the 2011-12 season, adding a skein of additional series as well as bringing back numerous favorites of viewers and advertisers.

title: Paul Pfeiffer's 'Caryatid'
description: A preview clip from "Caryatid," 2003. Courtesy of Paula Cooper Gallery, New York.

title: Sandra Lee Gets Professional Political Help
description: Sandra Lee, the Food Network television personality and best-selling author, is turning to a veteran of politics and state government to help her navigate her newest role: first lady of New York.

title: Vows of Change at Moodys, but Flaws Remain the Same
description: In the aftermath of the financial crisis, nobody has gone to prison and there havent been any serious structural changes in the financial system. But at least everyone involved feels bad about it and has vowed to change, right?

title: Photo Replay: April 13
description: A view of the day in sports, including swimming in Italy, weight lifting in Russia and outfielder Josh Hamiltons new look  his right arm in a sling.

title: Special Edition to Mark 45th Anniversary of Camaro
description: In its first commercial, a fiery and molten Chevrolet Camaro emerged from a volcano. Still hot some 45 years later, an anniversary iteration will be built this summer.

title: Pictures of the Day: Libya and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Libya, Iraq, Italy and Egypt.

title: Pictures of the Day: Libya and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Libya, Iraq, Italy and Egypt.

title: Artist Elevates Stanley Cup in Artwork
description: Uniquely among team sports, the Stanley Cup is greater than the players and teams who strive for it. Now that the playoffs are under way, the question arises again: Who will lift hockeys holy grail?

title: TimesCast | Mubarak and Sons Detained
description: April 13, 2011 - David D. Kirkpatrick reports from Cairo on former President Hosni Mubarak and his two sons being detained by police.

title: TimesCast | Clashes in Yemen
description: April 13, 2011 - Laura Kasinof reports on rival military factions clashing in Yemen

title: Libyas Revolution
description: Graffiti have been the elemental memes of political speech, from the walls of Pompeii to the New York subways to the Berlin Wall, in all the oppressed countries of this world. So it is all the more surprising that the epithet hurled by the Libyan freedom fighters to their former leader, and which graces the outer walls of the Benghazi Katiba in the photograph by Franco Pagetti that opens Robert F. Worths article, reads el-Qaddafi walad al-Yahudiya, or Qaddafi, born Jewish. In other words, Qaddafi the non-Muslim, the unclean. For a country that aspires to be democratic, old habits certainly die hard. It is a useful indication of the care to be taken in assuming that the so-called Arab Spring is a time of revolutionary social renewal.

title: Montreux Jazz Festival Announces Lineup
description: The Montreux Jazz Festival has lined up Seal, Santana and Sting for its 45th annual concert in July, organizers announced Tuesday, two days earlier than planned after leaks of the lineup appeared online, Reuters reported. They will join Susan Tedeschi, B.B. King, George Benson, Diana Krall and Dr. John for the musical gathering in Switzerland.

title: The Accidental Abolitionist
description: Adam Goodhearts article (The Shrug That Made History) did a wonderful job of explaining the significance of little-known Fort Monroe to the outcome of the Civil War. I hope that despite current economic problems, Congress will see a Fort Monroe National Park as an opportunity to memorialize and celebrate the most resonant theme of our history, the desire for a more perfect union.

title: Strikeout
description: The most interesting connection among the pitching rotations in Nate Silvers Vorping Their Way Into the Pantheon is that none of the teams won the World Series. In fact, only one of the teams even made it to the World Series. While starting pitching is obviously very important, the other 21 members of the team largely determine the eventual winner.

title: NYSE Euronext Weighs Special Dividend to Win Over Investors
description: 5:15 p.m. | Updated

title: Follow the Krill: A New Theory on Penguins Decline
description: Just what is ailing the Southern Ocean penguins?

title: Study Finds Drop in Deadly V.A. Hospital Infections
description: ATLANTA  An aggressive four-year effort to reduce the spread of deadly bacterial infections at veterans hospitals is showing impressive results and may have broad implications at medical centers across the country, according to the first comprehensive assessment of the program, which was released Wednesday afternoon.

title: Bar Crawling From Boutique to Boutique
description: THE peaty aroma of Scotch wafts past as a tall, slim man sips from a heavy rocks glass in the semi-secluded fitting area at the Hugo Boss store in downtown Manhattan.

title: Joel Klein Responds
description: Last Friday, not long after my cover story in the magazine was posted online, I heard from Joel Klein, the former New York City schools chancellor whose ambitious education reforms were, at least indirectly, the subject of the article. (It was an in-depth profile of M.S. 223, a public middle school in the South Bronx.)

title: Judge Rules for Counsel, Saying Baby Comes First
description: The birth of a child is a magical time, an occasion for joy, hope and, in at least one federal court, a good reason to postpone a trial over the objections of the plaintiffs counsel.

title: Countries Agree to Try to Transfer Some of Qaddafis Assets to Libyan Rebels
description: DOHA, Qatar  NATO, Arab and African ministers agreed Wednesday to work urgently with the Libyan rebel leadership to set up a mechanism by which some frozen assets belonging to Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi and his family might be transferred to the rebel cause.

title: Reaction to Obama Deficit Reduction Speech Swift  and Partisan
description: Republicans quickly declared President Obamas Wednesday speech on the deficit to be an inadequate response to the nations fiscal challenges and said they would press ahead with their own plans for spending cuts and an overhaul of Medicare and Medicaid.

title: Downstairs Neighbor Accused of Killing Bronx Woman, 70
description: In the Bronx apartment house where she lived for nearly half a century, Ethel Parish was a mainstay, a woman whose good will was often cloaked by a slightly overbearing concern for conditions in her building.

title: NATO Leaders Meet With Rebels
description: NATO, Arab and African ministers met with Libyas rebels on Wednesday in a show of support for insurgents who are seeking to overthrow Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi.

title: Beauty Spots
description: Vitamin E and aa berries, two-well known antioxidants, have been cosmetics ingredients for years. Now its resveratrols turn. Some entrepreneurs are hoping that the chemical, found in the skin of grapes and in red wine  and considered a possible factor behind the so-called French Paradox (high-fat diet, relatively little heart disease)  can work through the skin as well as the digestive system.

title: Bonds Guilty of Obstruction of Justice
description: 5:38 p.m. | Updated: Barry Bonds, the former outfielder who hit more home runs than anyone else in baseball history, was convicted Wednesday of single count of obstruction of justice, but a federal jury here could not reach a verdict on the question of whether Bonds had lied about never knowingly using steroids during his career.

title: Homes for $930,000
description: In Berkeley, Calif., a house with views of the San Francisco Bay; a duplex in a converted church in Newport, R.I.; and an oceanside cottage on Hawaiis Big Island.

title: Panel Unanimously Recommends Waiver for Walcott
description: A state-appointed panel of educators unanimously recommended on Wednesday that Dennis M. Walcott be allowed to become the next chancellor of the New York City school system, ruling that his background in education and public life compensated for his lack of formal training for the position.

title: Moving From the Bridal Salon to the Red Carpet
description: LAST January, the Glee actress Lea Michele attended the Grammy Awards in a Romona Keveza navy one-shoulder frock with a fluttery feather-chiffon skirt. She couldnt remember who designed the dress but offered a saucy excuse to the host Ryan Seacrest.

title: CBPP Weighs In
description: Bob Greenstein of the Center on Budget and Policy Priorities  the single best source for serious budget analysis  weighs in. He finds the Obama plan still too weighted to spending cuts and with not enough revenue increases  and I will abide by his judgment:

title: Scene City: Gwyneth Paltrow Celebrates Her Cookbook
description: The actress and singer, turned can-do celebrity chef, hosted a dinner party to celebrate her first cookbook.

title: The Buzz
description: A preview of the must-attend parties, talked-about openings and fashionable nightspots for the week ahead.

title: She Acts. She Sings. She Cooks?
description: ITS one thing to cook for your television fans. Its quite another to cook for 60 of your closest friends, many of them stars themselves.

title: Researchers Give the iPad Display Some Depth
description: When Apple added a front-facing camera to the new iPad, the company gave developers access to it with the hope that they would use it in new and innovative photo apps, or possibly even games.

title: N.B.A. Fines Kobe Bryant $100,000 for Directing Gay Slur at Referee
description: The N.B.A. has fined Kobe Bryant of the Los Angeles Lakers $100,000 for directing an anti-gay slur at a referee during Tuesdays victory over the San Antonio Spurs. Bryant directed the slur at the official Bennie Adams, who had just leveled Bryant with a technical foul.

title: James Taylor and Friends at Carnegie Hall
description: The composer and singer performed at a gala celebrating the 120th anniversary of Carnegie Hall.

title: A Slave-Era Legacy Infuses a Brazilian Style With Fighting Moves
description: For better or worse, DanceBrazil has become something of a perennial at the Joyce Theater. The company, which opened a two-week season on Tuesday night, specializes in capoeira, the Brazilian form believed to have been started by slaves as a type of self-defense. Since it was prohibited, the movement form was disguised as dance.

title: Bonds Guilty of Obstruction, but Not of Perjury
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Barry Bonds, the former outfielder who hit more home runs than anyone else in Major League Baseball history, was convicted Wednesday of a single count of obstruction of justice, but a federal jury could not decide on whether Bonds lied about using performance-enhancing drugs.

title: Dancing Under the Stars at Lincoln Center Begins in June
description: Get out those dancing shoes. Lincoln Center has just announced the lineup for Midsummer Night Swing, its annual salsa, swing, disco, tango, Gypsy jazz and folk dancing festival that takes place under the stars. This year a new dance floor has been installed at the band shell in Damrosch Park on West 62nd Street.

title: The Delivery: Eccentric. The Attitude: Carefree.
description: Nearly 24 years have passed since I first saw the pop-soul singer Lonette McKee perform a cabaret act at the now-defunct Ballroom in Chelsea and had the kind of epiphany that a nightclub critic rarely experiences. Here was a performer with a stylistic fluidity that encompassed jazz, pop-soul and standards and a rangy voice with an emotional catch that brought you up short. At the time she seemed the most likely successor to Lena Horne.

title: Muscularity and Grace in Sounds of Romance
description: The pianist Jon Nakamatsu plays with the calm assurance that comes of having both a solid technique and a gentle, introspective, interpretive spirit. On past encounters, that combination has made him sound unduly reserved. But at the Metropolitan Museum of Art on Saturday evening, Mr. Nakamatsu, who won the Van Cliburn International Piano Competition in 1997, played works that demand both a graceful, singing quality and assertive muscularity, and he delivered as fully in the virtuosic passages as in the lyrical ones.

title: How to Fix (or Kill) Web Data About You
description: As more of our social lives, shopping sprees and dating misadventures take place online, we leave behind, purposely or not, a growing supply of personal information.

title: What You Get for ... $930,000
description: BERKELEY, CALIF.

title: From a School: A Letter in Living Color
description: Birch Lane Elementary School in Davis, Calif., took issue with an article about picture books, and set out on a monthlong campaign to promote and read them. Read their scroll to the editor.

title: Staging the Politics of Abortion
description: NEWARK, Del.  When the playwright Theresa Rebeck was writing for the ABC drama NYPD Blue in the 1990s, she proposed a story line in which a main female character considers an abortion  and then has one, a rare outcome on American television. But the idea was rejected as toxic for the character, she said. Ms. Rebeck later pitched an abortion-themed project to Lifetime, then known by the tag line Television for Women, but that cable channel passed, too.

title: Writer in Residence
description: James Patterson has had his name on the cover of eight books on the hardcover fiction best-seller list over the past year.

title: An Idle Star With Time for Trouble
description: Margarine and Jayne Mansfield were lesser substitutes that nonetheless filled a void  during World War II butter was rationed, and by the late 1950s and early 60s Marilyn Monroe was often unavailable.

title: Discord Among the Best of Married Friends
description: In Michael Frayns Benefactors the ties that bind also strangle.

title: Choosing Between Leading Partners Suit or Your Own
description: You pick up A-9-5-4-3-2 of spades and 8-4 of hearts. Your lefthand opponent opens one club, which is either natural or a balanced hand with 12 to 14 points; your partner overcalls one heart; and the responder on your right jumps to three no-trump. What do you do, lead the heart eight or try a surprise attack with the spade four?

title: ONeill Theater Center Picks Eight Plays
description: Out of the nearly 1,000 plays vying to be developed by the Eugene ONeill Theater Center in Waterford, Conn., eight have been chosen to undergo the expert development process during the centers National Playwrights Conference in July. The winners, to be formally announced on Thursday, will take audiences from a movie set in Jordan, where a veteran relives the trauma of war, to a sleep-away camp in Maine, where the Nadelmans visit their hard-to-handle son. The plays, which will be performed at the conference, are: The Nether, by Jennifer Haley; The Happiest Song Plays Last, by Quiara Alegra Hudes; Good Goods, by Christina Anderson; An Incident by Anna Ziegler; Acquainted With the Night, by Keith Reddin; Tell Us of the Night by Keith Huff; The Troublemaker Project by Dan LeFranc; and How We Got On, Idris Goodwin. The ONeill, which won the 2010 Tony Award for Regional Theater, has been a springboard for new works and artists to full productions on Broadway, Off Broadway and at major regional theaters.

title: Adele Back on Top
description: Adele continues her run on the pop charts this week, returning to the No. 1 spot and displacing Britney Spears in the process, and becoming the first artist this year to rack up album sales of 1 million. Her 21 (XL/Columbia) sold 88,000 copies in the United States, according to Nielsen SoundScan, climbing two spots to reach No. 1 on the Billboard album chart for the fourth time in its seven weeks of release. The album has sold a total of 1.03 million copies. (The album with the second biggest sales of the year so far is another rootsy, critically respected British import: Mumford & Sons Sigh No More, on the Glassnote label, which has sold 645,000 copies in the United States and lands this week at No. 8.) Ms. Spearss Femme Fatale (Jive) falls to No. 2 in its second week, with 75,000 sales, a 73 percent drop from its opening week. Radioheads King of Limbs (Ticker Tape) climbed three spots to No. 3 in its second week of wide release, with 67,000 sales. The rap/rock band Hollywood Undead is close behind with 66,000 sales of its new album, American Tragedy (A&M/Octone). On Billboards Digital Songs chart, the top three songs from last week hold steady: Katy Perrys E. T. remains No. 1 for a fifth week, selling 323,000 copies, while the Black Eyed Peas hold at No. 2 with Just Cant Get Enough and Rihanna stays at No. 3 with S&M.

title: To Get Easter and Passover Celebrations Right, Use an App
description: For many Jews and Christians, the next two weeks bring opportunities to share meals and practice traditions whose elements never escape memory.

title: The Obituary Writer Has the Upper Hand
description: As of Wednesday morning, it cost a total of 3 cents to buy used copies of all three of Timothy Schafferts previous novels from Amazon.com: The Phantom Limbs of the Rollow Sisters (2002), The Singing and Dancing Daughters of God (2005) and Devils in the Sugar Shop (2007). Yet each of these books is a quirky little gem, particularly the first one. Life is not fair.

title: Excerpt: 'The Paul Reiser Show'
description: The comic stars as a version of himself in this new NBC comedy.

title: Obama's Deficit-Reduction Speech
description: President Obama countered Republican budget plans on Wednesday with what he said was a more balanced approach.

title: For Kors, the Glow Doesnt Fade
description: IF 80 percent of success is showing up, to quote poor Woody Allen yet again, then maybe the other 20 percent is sticking around? Consider the designer Michael Kors, who recently commemorated 30 consistent if not generally spine-tingling years in the fashion industry with a disco-inflected runway show, a party at Bemelmans Bar well stocked with celebrities, and the opening of a gleaming new duplex flagship on Madison Avenue.

title: One Big List
description: How the best sellers would rank if fiction and nonfiction titles were combined on a single list.

title: Shopping Snapshots for April 14
description: Four questions for Billy Reid; Project Alabama, high-concept, high-priced label has become a mid-priced, wearable collection; and more items.

title: Tech Talk Podcast: Browser Security
description: With malware, phishing schemes and other threats on the rise, many banks have been prodding customers to download security software. Bettina Edelstein speaks with Mickey Boodaei, chief executive of Trusteer, the company that makes the free software called Trusteer Rapport. The software is designed to protect you from malicious activity, like key-logging, by safeguarding your browser. It works in the background, Mr. Boodaei said, and can also be used at other sites where you might enter a credit card number or other sensitive information.

title: A Dance of Death
description: In the ghost town of Nuevo Laredo, an assassin, a New Age drug lord and La Santa Muerte (St. Death) deal in the day-to-day business of Death, Faith and Rehab. Such is the succinct yet rather all-encompassing plot description in the news release for Nuevo Laredo, a production at Dixon Place by Gabriella Barnstone and El Gato Teatro. Given this summary, you could reasonably expect theatrical extremes, whether sublime or disastrous.

title: Spotlight on San Francisco, and the New
description: Meet the Composer has always been devoted to making new music user-friendly by commissioning works and having the composers on hand to explain them to audiences. Now the organization is reconfiguring itself, and it has come up with a twist: instead of merely using its Web site to promote performances, it is staging a small festival to promote its Web site, or a section of it.

title: A Funny Girl Strives to Survive
description: Its to the credit of the actress Kimberly Faye Greenberg and the writer-director-arranger Chip Deffaa  with help from the passing decades  that the solo show One Night With Fanny Brice ducks the formidably long shadow of Barbra Streisand and Funny Girl, the 1964 Broadway musical about Brice, the vaudevillian, Ziegfeld performer, comedian and radio star. (The screen Funny Girl generated a sequel, Funny Lady, and now a 2012 Broadway revival is afoot.)

title: A Film Angers an Emirate Festival
description: In retrospect, perhaps the curators of the Sharjah Biennial, the huge contemporary art event now under way in the Persian Gulf region, should have thought twice before inviting the participation of an Iranian-American filmmaker whose biggest hit to date  a quasi-documentary about himself was called "I Am a Sex Addict" and whose film before that followed along aimlessly while he tripped on hallucinogenic mushrooms.

title: Hes Only Just Begun to Fight
description: LOS ANGELES

title: Italian Justice Legislation Could End Berlusconi Trials
description: ROME  The lower house of Italys Parliament on Wednesday approved a measure intended to speed up Italys notoriously slow justice system, bringing the country into line with European standards but possibly ending several trials pending against Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi.

title: The Czech President Pockets a Pen
description: While Vaclav Klaus, the Czech president, is not as well-known globally as his predecessor, Vaclav Havel, the dissident playwright who led Czechoslovakias Velvet Revolution, in the past three days, nearly 5 million people have watched video of one of Mr. Klauss recent news conferences on YouTube.

title: Israeli Foreign Minister Faces Indictment on Corruption Charges
description: JERUSALEM  Israels attorney general on Wednesday announced his intention to indict the foreign minister, Avigdor Lieberman, on corruption charges, but said he would allow Mr. Lieberman a hearing to contest an indictment before issuing a formal charge sheet.

title: PC Sales Slump Because of Quake and Tablets
description: Japans earthquake and subsequent tsunami contributed to the first decline in personal computer shipments since the end of the recent recession, according to two reports released on Wednesday.

title: Celebrity Roast
description: Lamb traditionally appears on both Easter and Passover tables, though the latter most often in the form of a single symbolic shank bone. (In some Passover traditions, roast lamb itself cannot be eaten.) In my extensive experience, that shank is roasted to death and inedible; its symbolic, I know, but imagine how much Jews of my generation might have learned about cooking had it been properly braised! In my fewer but occasional Easter dinners, those with lamb  usually leg  were somewhat better, but as we all know religious or even quasi-religious meals are rarely occasions of culinary wizardry.

title: 800 Civilians Killed This Year in Southern Sudan, U.N. Says
description: KAMPALA, Uganda  More than 800 civilians have died since January in fragmenting violence in southern Sudan, the United Nations said Wednesday, less than three months before the vast, impoverished, battle-scarred region becomes its own nation.

title: As Generics Near, Makers Tweak Erectile Drugs
description: Facing generic competition for its little blue pill, Pfizer recently started selling a chewable form of Viagra in Mexico. It is called Viagra Jet, and Pfizer says it may also market it to other nations in the developing world, if not the United States.

title: Warblers Have Ways to Resist Impostor Eggs
description: The cuckoo finchs habit of laying its eggs in other birds nests provokes an arms race. The cuckoo finch finds better ways to mimic the host birds eggs, and the host bird responds with new methods of distinguishing the cuckoo finchs eggs from its own.

title: Treatment at a Carefree Hospital
description: In one of the seemingly endless dreamlike images in Eponas Labyrinth at Here Arts Center, a frantic woman in a hospital chases the silhouette of a part of the male anatomy that is usually hidden. She swats at it with a broom, but the pesky thing floats away across the stage.

title: Collectors May (or May Not) Have Chance to Buy Bertone Cars
Yankees Shuffle Bullpen
description: The primary consequence of Luis Ayala going on the disabled list with an injured muscle in his back could be an expanded role in the bullpen forBartolo Colon. Used only to back up Phil Hughes through the first two weeks, Colon will now be an option to pitch in shorter spurts  one or two innings  now that a true long man, Hector Noesi, has been promoted from Class AAA Scranton/Wilkes Barre to take Ayalas roster spot.

title: Yanks Use Hamilton Injury as Teaching Moment
description: Curtis Granderson had yet to watch the entire play that resulted in a broken right arm for Josh Hamilton of Texas. He had only seen footage of Hamiltons headfirst slide into home plate.

title: A Single European EV Charging Plug? Not Now.
description: As electric cars become more common, theyre still arguing in Europe about what kind of 230-volt charging plugs theyll use  and it doesnt appear that a single standard will be adopted in the near future. In the United States, that issue has long been resolved with a universal five-pin design, known as J1772.

title: Shopping for Coin Banks With Brad Zizmor and Dag Folger
description: The principals of a+i architecture in Manhattan shopped for coin banks, in forms familiar (pig-shaped) and far more subtle.

title: Views of, and From, Olana
description: Preserving the Hudson River School painter Frederic E. Churchs home also means preserving its sweeping views of surrounding landscape.

title: A Personal Shopper, in Far-Flung Places
description: For those lacking the time or resources to embark on an international shopping expedition with an interior designer, One Kings Lane, the Web retailer, has an alternative: the online container sale. Every month or so, Susan Feldman, a founder of the company, will team up with a different designer to handpick furniture and accessories in a far-flung location, filling up a shipping container and offering those finds for sale. We can go places not everybody has access to, Ms. Feldman said, where we think there are great and unique products.

title: Stools and Tables for the Modern Stone Age
description: Proving that stone furniture neednt be clunky, the Kreoo collection from Decormarmi, an Italian company, looks remarkably light and sensuously sculptural. In our market, you often see stone things that are functionally good, but aesthetically, the scale isnt quite right or the little details arent there, said Mark Whitfield, director of product management at Charles Luck Stone Center, which is selling the line in the United States. Decormarmi has been able to get it right.

title: Sales on Pots and Pans, and Museum Pieces
description: A selection of All-Clad stainless-steel pots and pans is deeply discounted during the cookware sale at Broadway Panhandler, through Sunday (a 3.5-quart saucepan with lid, below, originally $180, is $100; a 12-inch fry pan with lid, originally $190, is $90); 65 East Eighth Street (Broadway); (212) 966-3434; broadwaypanhandler.com.

title: Inside Marwencol
description: To the Editor:

title: A Lot of Pomp for the Circumstance: A High-Tech Toilet by Kohler
description: If youre the sort who must have the sleekest, slickest high-tech toy before anyone else  especially when the price tag makes others gasp  Kohlers $6,390 Numi toilet (above), which is being introduced this month, is for you. Its features include not merely a bidet, environmentally correct dual flush, deodorizer and dryer, but also a foot-warmer and speakers that allow you to play a preprogrammed song. (Its relaxing music, we were assured by the companys president, David Kohler, which is good, because imagine what would happen if it made you want to get up and dance.) The user can also listen to a built-in FM radio or play her own music over the speakers.

title: Heirloom Gardening
description: To the Editor:

title: Piggy Banks
description: BRAD ZIZMOR and Dag Folger are the principals of a+i architecture, a Manhattan firm specializing in office and retail design. In the 16 years since they started their firm, their roster of clients has grown to include quite a few financial institutions.

title: Carpentry for Children
description: To the Editor:

title: Edward Barber and Jay Osgerby on Seeking the Void and Then Filling It
description: Edward Barber and Jay Osgerby met when they were architecture students at the Royal College of Art in London, and founded their firm, Barber Osgerby, shortly after graduation, in 1996. Since then, they have quietly taken the design world by storm, winning numerous awards and creating products for the likes of Cappellini, Flos, Vitra, Established & Sons, Sony and even Coca-Cola, which commissioned them to design a new bottle.

title: Looking Out for the View at Olana, Frederic Churchs Hudson Home
description: HUDSON, N.Y.

title: John M. Johansens Plastic Tent House
description: A house in Stanfordville, N.Y., by the modernist architect becomes a Manhattan couples weekend home.

title: Modular Light Fixtures That Go On and On
description: Endless, the latest fixture from the Brooklyn lighting company Roll & Hill, lives up to its name. Made from modular components, it can be ordered in any length, and configured as a straight or snaking line  potentially one that runs clear across a room. Its really a way to define space with light, said Jason Miller, the companys chief executive, who designed the piece.

title: In the Shadow of What If
description: I GREW up in Buchanan, N.Y., a tiny, mostly working-class village in northern Westchester County, on the eastern shores of the Hudson, tucked into a crook where the river bends. My parents were public school teachers, and we lived in a split-level wood house near Lake Meahagh (pronounced MEE-haw), a manmade pond where my sister and I laced up our figure skates each winter and carved broad figure eights into its big, imperfect surface. Buchanan is a modest community (the village itself comprises less than two square miles); when people ask where Im from, I usually say Peekskill or Croton, the two closest midsize towns. For the most part, Buchanan is known only to itself.

title: The Serial Sleepover Artist
description: THE fitness fanatic in Columbus Circle flaked. So did the performance-artist couple in Greenpoint who said they practiced at-home nudity. Yet Kenya Robinsons odyssey as a serial house guest has been smooth enough so far, and by and large her hosts  friends, colleagues and total strangers  have been happy to share their toothpaste with her.

title: A Country Home, by a Modernist at Play
description: Stanfordville, N.Y.

title: New C.I.A. Drone Attack Draws Rebuke From Pakistan
description: WASHINGTON  C.I.A. drones fired two missiles at militants in Pakistans tribal areas on Wednesday, two days after Pakistans spy chief threatened to curtail the drone strikes and demanded more information about the Central Intelligence Agencys operations there.

title: Two Financial Crises Compared: The Savings and Loan Debacle and the Mortgage Mess
description: A comparison of prosecutions related to the savings and loan crisis and the current financial crisis.

title: Microsoft Demonstrates Windows Phone Updates
description: Microsoft unveiled plans for the next version of its Windows Phone platform on Wednesday at MIX, the companys annual developer conference in Las Vegas.

title: Sleep No More
description: Photos from the interactive theater piece from the British company Punchdrunk.

title: Flyers Goaltender Bobrovsky Lets Actions Do His Talking
description: VOORHEES, N.J.  An enormous black-and-white aerial photo of the Philadelphia Flyers most recent Stanley Cup parade hangs outside the double doors leading into the dressing room at their suburban practice center. It takes a sharp eye to notice the date on the photo: 1975.

title: Pulling Out All the Stops to Push an Antigay Bill
description: KAMPALA, Uganda  They entered through Parliaments gates, an eclectic group. Their leader, the Rev. Martin Ssempa, wore sunglasses and long black robes embroidered with matching red crosses and two campaign buttons. One said, Debate Our Bill Now! and the other, simply, No to Sodomy.

title: Anatomy of a Scene: 'War Horse'
description: The actor Seth Numrich talks about performing with life-sized puppets in the play "War Horse" at Lincoln Center Theater. (Video courtesy of the production.)

title: Naming Culprits in the Financial Crisis
description: A voluminous report on the financial crisis by the United States Senate  citing internal documents and private communications of bank executives, regulators, credit ratings agencies and investors  describes business practices that were rife with conflicts during the mortgage mania and reckless activities that were ignored inside the banks and among their federal regulators.

title: Study Measures Ad Industrys Impact on State Economies
description: THAT there are mad men in New York, the home of Madison Avenue, goes without saying. But who knew there were 2,216 mad men  and women  in South Dakota, 11,009 in Alabama, 1,165 in Vermont and even 1,391 in Alaska?

title: Mets Young Has Biceps Tendinitis
description: Chris Young had been looking forward to the opportunity to pitch Friday, on Jackie Robinson Day, because Young wrote his dissertation at Princeton on Robinson and his role in breaking down cultural barriers.

title: Standoff in Sacramento as Brown and G.O.P. Lock Horns Over Taxes
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Gov. Jerry Brown, seeking authorization to ask California voters to extend expiring taxes to avoid more draconian budget cuts, is fighting what increasingly appears to be an intractable battle.

title: A Scroll to the Editor: We Love to Read!
description: We recently received, in a tube sent by postal mail, something new in our experience: a 15-foot-long scroll to the editor. Weve received all kinds of mail in the past: books, manuscripts, CDs, even a hostile brick to the editor. Perhaps editors in ancient times received scrolls all the time  but not us.

title: New Translation of Mass
description: To the Editor:

title: No Links Found Between Bodies on L.I. and in South Jersey
description: The skeletal remains of eight bodies found off an oceanfront roadway on Long Island, including those of four prostitutes, bear no obvious connection to the bodies of four prostitutes found near Atlantic City in 2006, officials said Wednesday.

title: H.I.V. Kidney Transplants
description: To the Editor:

title: Strongman Out, Ivory Coast Is Reviving
description: ABIDJAN, Ivory Coast  Fresh produce appeared on market stalls. Women carried sacks of grain on their heads. Children skipped rope in the street. Men sipped coffee in outdoor cafes.

title: Wall Street and the Financial Crisis: Anatomy of a Financial Collapse
description: A report from the U.S. Senate Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations two-year, bipartisan investigation into the origins of the 2008 financial crisis.

title: Gerald A. Lawson, a Pioneer in Video Games, Dies at 70
description: Gerald A. Lawson, a largely self-taught engineer who became a pioneer in electronic video entertainment, creating the first home video game system with interchangeable game cartridges, died on Saturday in Mountain View, Calif. He was 70 and lived in Santa Clara, Calif.

title: Defining a Dictionary
description: To the Editor:

title: Oversight of Aircraft Repairs
description: To the Editor:

title: The Lasting Imprint of the Civil War
description: To the Editor:

title: My Civil War Centennial
description: I had a great Civil War Centennial. I was eight years old in 1961, and my parents took our family on trips to Gettysburg and Antietam and Manassas. I had blue and gray toy soldiers, and Civil War trading cards, and I watched Johnny Shiloh and Johnny Yuma. From this, a life-long interest was born.

title: An Eye That Brides Rely On
description: A clotheshorse ever since he could toddle, Mark Ingram ultimately selected an item of clothing he will never wear himself  the wedding gown  as the focal point of his business, the Mark Ingram Bridal Atelier, in Midtown. Mr. Ingram, 52, opened his couture bridal shop in 2002 after accumulating 20 years of experience in the clothing industry. He lives in Hamilton Heights.

title: F.A.A. Adding Controllers to Night Shifts
description: Twenty-seven airport towers will be staffed with a second employee on the overnight shift as the Federal Aviation Administration struggles to deal with a recurring problem of controllers sleeping on the job.

title: New Grievances Broaden Syrias Protest Movement
description: Syrias growing protest movement broadened on Wednesday as Aleppo, one of Syrias largest cities, had its first demonstrations against the government of President Bashar al-Assad, and a group of women from the coastal village of Bayda, where hundreds were detained this week, marched to demand the release of their husbands and sons.

title: Detention of Immigrants in New York City
description: To the Editor:

title: Mississippi Grays
description: On March 28, 1961 a six-mile, two-hour parade wended its way through Jackson, Miss.  the largest public event in state history  to mark the centennial of Mississippis secession and the beginning of the Civil War. Tens of thousands of white Mississippians lined the route, greeting the festooned marchers with rebel yells of Yiiiii Hoooaaah! Women from the Mississippi Delta region, dressed in their Old South finery, rode on a float and sipped mint juleps as they toasted sending their men off to war. The South that day, noted the Jackson Clarion-Ledger, rose again, in all its Confederate splendor.

title: Bloggingheads: Don't Cut Now
description: Matthew Yglesias, left, of the Center for American Progress and Reihan Salam of Economics 21 debate the right time to cut the deficit.

title: President Obama, Reinvigorated
description: The man America elected president has re-emerged.

title: ESPN Issues New Rules for Announcers
description: ESPN announced a set of endorsement guidelines for its on-air announcers Wednesday that would have probably prohibited a deal made this year between Erin Andrews, one of its best-known reporters, and Reebok, and another one between Scott Van Pelt and Titleist.

title: At a Mafia Murder Trial, a Lesson in Mob Jargon
description: With a clamor of jailyard voices echoing in the background, Joseph C. Massino asked his former crime family subordinate, Vincent Basciano, if he had used two men to clip Randy.

title: Restoring Sendais Airport
description: On Wednesday, the airport in Sendai, Japan, reopened to commercial flights for the first time since the earthquake and tsunami struck on March 11.

title: Pentagon Says It Has Kept Up Some Strikes on Libya
description: WASHINGTON  Pentagon officials disclosed Wednesday that American warplanes had continued to strike targets in Libya even after the Obama administration said the United States was stepping back from offensive missions and letting NATO take the lead.

title: This Army Unit Was Bogus, Prosecutors Charge
description: LOS ANGELES  To the Chinese immigrants he recruited, Yupeng Deng was known as Supreme Commander. He offered them United States Army uniforms, conducted training exercises on Sundays, led marches in municipal parades and promised a path toward American citizenship.

title: Behind the Abortion War
description: Part of the price of keeping the government operating this week is another debate over the financing of Planned Parenthood. Whoopee.

title: Bryant Fined $100,000 by N.B.A. for Gay Slur
description: Hours after the Los Angeles Lakers star Kobe Bryant directed an obscene antigay slur at a referee who had just whistled him for a technical foul, N.B.A. Commissioner David Stern fined him $100,000 on Wednesday and, in a statement, described Bryants remarks as offensive and inexcusable.

title: A BlackBerry Tablet, but Where Are the Apps?
description: Listen, Ill be straight with you. I realize that tablets are crazy hot right now, that 2011 is the Year of the iPad Clone and that every company and its brother is rushing one to market. But Im sorry. Im not going to review every one of the 85 tablets that will arrive this year; its only April, and Ive already got Tablet Fatigue. Im not going to review the Electrolux tablet, the Polaroid tablet, the Sunoco tablet, the Kelloggs tablet. ...

title: Diller Scofidio + Renfro to Design Art Building at Stanford
description: The architecture firm Diller Scofidio + Renfro, which seems to get every big commission these days, has been selected for yet another one. Stanford University has chosen the firm to design its new home for the art and art history department, the university is to announce Thursday.

title: Cairos Roundabout Revolution
description: Berkeley, Calif.

title: Bondss Denial, Baseballs Problem
description: Barry Bonds had virtually no peers in his chosen sport, but in the court of law he had 12 of them. On Wednesday, those peers convicted Bonds of one count of obstruction of justice, which will stay with Bonds forever.

title: In Budgets Fine Print, Real and Illusory Cuts
description: WASHINGTON  Few financial problems have generated more public attention in the last few years than mortgage fraud, one of the triggers for the nations housing collapse. But even government officials seeking to combat a front-burner issue like that one are feeling the sting of the budget deal struck last Friday to avert a federal shutdown.

title: Iraqi Youths Political Rise Is Stunted by Elites
description: BAGHDAD  Inspired by the democratic uprisings around the Arab world to push for change, young lawmakers in Parliament are running up against an ossified political elite still dominated by the exiles who followed American tanks into Iraq to establish a fragile, violence-scarred democracy.

title: For Bonds Jurors, a Narrow Common Ground
description: SAN FRANCISCO  After weeks of hearing from 25 government witnesses  who often offered dense, scientific testimony  the jurors in the Barry Bonds trial finally looked relaxed Wednesday. They took a long lunch and some of them chatted and laughed together in the cafeteria of the Phillip Burton Federal Courthouse, which has been their second home for the last month.

title: A Setback for Arizona-Style Immigration Laws
description: The United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit has upheld a trial judges ruling blocking the most egregious parts of Arizonas infamous immigration law. The three-judge panel said that Arizona intruded onto federal responsibility by requiring that police officers check the immigration status of anyone they have reasonable suspicion of being in the state without authorization, demanding that immigrants carry papers and making it a crime for illegal immigrants to work or look for work.

title: Commission Seeks Safeguards at Open-Water Races
description: A five-member commission headed by Dick Pound, the former International Olympic Committee vice president, released a report Wednesday offering proposals to make open-water swimming competitions safer after the death last October of the American Fran Crippen during a race in the United Arab Emirates.

title: The Reality of Women at War
description: A Congressional study commission has recommended an end to the Pentagons ban on women serving in ground combat  a policy that years of warfare in Iraq and Afghanistan have shown to be impractical. Female soldiers have become involved in de facto combat situations, suffering death and battle wounds. At the same time, their careers are crimped as leadership promotions flowed more to men with combat experience, according to the study.

title: Surrender
description: Charleston Harbor, S.C., April 14, 1861

title: The Timid Need Not Apply
description: I finally scored a job. Youll never guess where, my friend Peter announced, his mouth curling in smug anticipation.

title: Tainting Justice With Politics
description: The furiously contested election of a Wisconsin Supreme Court justice shows, once again, how politics and money can debase the law.

title: At Carnegie Gala, Cameos by a Canine and a Clinton
description: Poodles, despite their airs, know little of pomp and circumstance. That might account for why Valentina, a little white dog, left a puddle on one of the three red carpets lolling out of Carnegie Hall into the rain on 57th Street on Tuesday night before James Taylors gala concert celebrating the 120-year-old hall. No matter; there was a brigade of attendants with vacuum cleaners who swooped in among the uncouth canine, and guests like Bette Midler, Michael Douglas and Steve Martin, to clean up footprints and other little messes.

title: Corrections
description: FOREIGN

title: Lottery Numbers
description: April 13, 2011

title: China Policy Main Topic for the G-20
description: WASHINGTON  The United States and its allies, frustrated in their efforts to pressure China directly to change its economic policies, are seeking to enlist other developing nations in an international campaign that China may find more palatable.

title: Densely Populated, but No Shortage of Grisly Dumping Sites
description: In June 1991, a fisherman found a barrel in Pelham Bay Park in the Bronx. Seven months later, a police officer saw two men leaving the parks woods. He asked them what they were doing, and they told him they had gone into the woods to bury a dog.

title: Budget Details Stir Republican Dissent Ahead of House Vote
