description: avenge \-venj\ verb

title: Battle for Libya
description: Rebels and pro-Qaddafi forces clashed in Ajdabiya and Misurata.

title: LocalResponse Taps the Social Web to Help Businesses Draw Customers
description: Where are you? What are you doing? What are you eating? What are you looking at?

title: Foreign Land, Familiar Words
description: In the weeks after the oil spill, Tuan Nguyen visited 15 towns around the Gulf Coast to seek out Vietnamese fishermen whose lack of English made their sudden loss of livelihood even more daunting. By some estimates, as many as one-fourth to one-third of Louisianas 12,400 licensed commercial fishermen immigrated from Vietnam.

title: Oil Rolled in, and Tables at Two Places Emptied Out
description: Al Sawyer would rather be frying oysters than wading through the avalanche of paperwork that followed the oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico.

title: Stages of Alzheimers Disease

title: Tracking Flow of Oil on His Own
description: Before the oil spill began 50 miles off the Gulf Coast, Paul Orr, who works in Louisiana with a conservation group called the Lower Mississippi Riverkeepers, focused mainly on issues like battling discharges from sewage treatment plants in Baton Rouge.

title: Answering a Call, Slowly
description: The night the BP well blew, Michael R. Bromwich was in St. Croix in the United States Virgin Islands minding his own business, which in this case was monitoring compliance with a consent decree between the Department of Justice and the islands police force, which had a history of poor training and complaints about excessive use of force.

title: A Year Spent Wrestling With Paperwork, Not Nets
description: It has been a year of sitting inside, of dry paperwork, a year in which accounting displaced fishing as the cornerstone of the gulf economy. This is no sort of work for a man like Alton Verdin.

title: Stemming a Disaster Helps Bring in More Work
description: For Pat Campbell, life since the Deepwater Horizon disaster has gotten both busier and slower.

title: Opportunity Beckons Up North
description: Ronald Brown, an offshore oil rig worker from Magee, Miss., got the call from Diamond Offshore at the end of September. Along with other roustabouts and roughnecks who worked the companys Ocean Monarch, one of 33 rigs idled by a moratorium imposed on deep-water drilling in the gulf after the BP oil spill, he was being laid off.

title: News Quiz | April 19, 2011
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper.

description: FRONT PAGE

title: Test Yourself | English, April 19, 2011
description: Test your vocabulary skills with todays question, from the article 2011 Pulitzer Prize Winners Announced.

title: Questions About Three Cups of Tea
description: WHO is Greg Mortenson?

title: What Personal Achievements Make You Proud?
description: On Monday, Geoffrey Mutai of Kenya won the 115th Boston Marathon  and in so doing, ran the fastest marathon ever. Meanwhile, Desiree Davila set a course record for American female runners. What do you think it takes for runners to excel at this grueling, 26.2-mile event? How much preparation do you think it takes? What about sacrifice? What in your own life  athletically or otherwise  have you worked hard to achieve?

title: Wal-Mart Buys Social Media Firm Kosmix
description: Wal-Mart Stores, the worlds largest retailer,  has agreed  to buy Kosmix, a social media start-up focused on e-commerce, for an undisclosed sum, as valuations for social media companies like Groupon soar.

title: Seagate to Buy Samsungs Disk-Drive Unit
description: 7:28 p.m. | Updated

title: Grete Waitz, Marathon Champion, Dies at 57
description: Grete Waitz, the Norwegian schoolteacher who won more New York City Marathons  nine  than anyone else, and whose humility and athleticism made her a singularly graceful champion and a role model for young runners, especially women, died Tuesday in Oslo. She was 57.

title: Fantasy Focus: Buy Lowest
description: The buy-low, sell-high mantra is one of the most overused in fantasy sports. No one in any league worth playing in will deal you Carl Crawford, Kevin Youkilis or Carlos Gonzalez at a discount just because of two bad weeks. In order to get an actual bargain, then, you need to aim at players whose market values have declined since draft day for good reason and about whom even you are worried. While buying low usually isnt possible, buying lowest typically is.

title: In Hong Kong, Mens Ready-to-Wear
description: While its simple enough to find a mens tailor in Hong Kong that is cheap, its a more daunting task to find one that offers a sense of style. JA Daye, however, brings a creative eye for colors and details to the tailoring experience.

title: The Early Word: Ante Up
description: Todays Times

title: Human Capital Follows the Thermometer
description: Edward L. Glaeser is an economics professor at Harvard and the author of Triumph of the City.

title: Faced With Recalls, Rental Companies Sometimes Decide to Wait
description: Several major rental car companies have told the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration that in some cases they continue to rent vehicles that have been recalled if they believe the problem is not serious.

title: Syria Steps Up Its Crackdown While Promising Reform
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The Syrian government tried to placate protesters with declarations of sweeping reform on Tuesday while also issuing harsh threats of reprisals if demonstrations did not come to an end, as one of the Arab worlds most repressive countries struggled to blunt the most serious challenge to the 40-year rule of the Assad family.

title: All My Stories
description: I hadnt really watched All My Children on a daily basis since 2004, when Bianca Montgomery, Erica Kanes lesbian daughter, finally discovered that Miranda, the baby she thought had died in an accident, was actually Bess, the baby her best friend, Babe, was passing off as her own. Around the same period, I also stopped watching One Life to Live regularly, following the heart transplant that Victoria Lord Riley Burke Riley Buchanan Buchanan Carpenter Davidson received thanks to the untimely death of the love of her life and sixth husband, Ben, who lay comatose in a hospital bed for months after being accidentally shot in the head during an attempt to save Viki from a kidnapper. Still, I was taken aback by last weeks news that after more than 40 years of showing them five days a week, 52 weeks a year, ABC was axing both shows, one by September and the other by January 2012, leaving just The Young and the Restless, The Bold and the Beautiful, Days of Our Lives and General Hospital to carry on the daytime-serial legacy.

description: Q.

title: On the Records | The Candidate, the Treasurer and the Gynecologist
description: A newly surfaced election filing speaks volumes about the closeness of the relationship between State Senator Carl Kruger and a co-defendant in the political corruption case that prosecutors are pursuing in federal court in Manhattan.

title: Managing the Business Side of the Business
description: Last year at my aunts 80th birthday gathering, I talked business with one of my cousins, Phil Ochoa. Phil and his wife, Sharyn, started a company, Federal Defense Industries, out of the garage of their Southern California home. Ten years later, they are the family success story, with eight-figure revenue, and they have traded way up and out of their office with the Genie door opener.

title: This Spring Break, Its Party vs. Party
description: House members are home for spring break, and Democrats are determined to make sure that the recess is no day at the beach for the Republicans.

title: Water Pumping Begins at Japan Nuclear Reactor
description: TOKYO  The difficult task of pumping highly radioactive water out of the basement of a turbine building at a damaged Japanese nuclear power plant began Tuesday, but officials cautioned that the work would be slow and difficult.

description: Todays word, in association with the reliable Oxford English Dictionary, is

title: Not-So-Secret History
description: At their most functional, co-op meetings are a chance for shareholders to greet their new neighbors and hear about the financial well-being of the buildings corporation. At their least functional, theyre an opportunity for the petty, soapbox style airing of grievances, from the tenants who like to complain about the size of others welcome mats. Oftentimes, what should last no more than 30 minutes drags on for two hours or more.

title: Taxes and the American Future
description: Kevin Drum and Jonathan Cohn both respond to my column on taxes by making a straightforward case for higher middle class tax rates. To my suggestion that taking tax revenue to 23 percent of G.D.P. and beyond would be unprecedented, Drum responds:

description: On Tuesday, The Lede is following protests in Syria, where the security forces fired on demonstrators occupying the central square of the city of Homs in the early hours of the morning.

title: Goldman Sachs Tops Expectations as Revenues Fall
description: Goldman Sachs on Tuesday reported first-quarter net income of $2.74 billion, down 21 percent from the period a year earlier, as the investment bank took a big one-time hit to pay back the billionaire investor Warren E. Buffett.

title: Alzheimers, Redefined
description: The Times reports this morning that for the first time in 27 years, Alzheimers disease is being redefined in new medical guidelines reflecting mounting evidence that the disease ravages the brain years before symptoms of dementia appear.

title: When Rationalization Masquerades as Reason
description: Its awfully hard for human beings to step outside of their predispositions and gut reactions, which may be why its so hard to have a rational discussion about the findings of science, which is all about sidelining such distorting biases.

title: Face Time | Josie Maran
description: Tina Turnbow is a professional makeup artist who is known for lending her celebrity clients editorial polish.

title: Morning Buzz | Murder, Mob and Meatballs at Trial
description: Tuesdays April showers will perhaps yield a bounty of May flowers. Regardless of the weather, Violet, the red-tailed hawk at New York University, will be working hard to keep her eggs warm, which we hope will hatch this week.

title: Trial in China Tests Limits of Legal System Reform
description: BEIJING  In a case that has galvanized lawyers across China and provided a window into how the next generation of leaders may view the countrys fragile legal system, a defense lawyer went on trial Tuesday charged with fabricating testimony in favor of his client.

title: Tuesday Reading: Medicare Consumer Site Gets a Makeover
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.

title: The Dude Records: Jeff Bridges Plans Solo Album
description: When the Dude sought recreation in The Big Lebowski, hed bowl, drive around, enjoy the occasional acid flashback and unwind to some Creedence Clearwater Revival. Now its C.C.R.s turn to unwind to the Dude. Jeff Bridges, the Big Lebowski star who played a country singer so well in Crazy Heart he won an Academy Award for it, will record a solo album for the Blue Note Records division of EMI, the label said on Tuesday. The album, which does not yet have a title (can we humbly suggest Careful, Man, Theres A Beverage Here?) will be recorded with the producer T-Bone Burnett, who first met Mr. Bridges on the set of Heavens Gate, and selected music for the Big Lebowski soundtrack and co-wrote songs for Crazy Heart, including the Oscar-nominated track The Weary Kind. Blue Note Records said in a statement that Mr. Bridges will contribute several of his own compositions and perform songs by Stephen Bruton and John Goodwin, Greg Brown, Bo Ramsey, Tom Waits, and others. Though we wouldnt hold out much hope for the Dudes Creedence cassettes, Mr. Bridgess album is planned for a late summer release.

title: He Worked for Obama. Can He Beat Him?
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  Three months before President Obama nominated Jon M. Huntsman Jr. as ambassador to China, Mr. Huntsman arrived here to introduce himself to three dozen influential Republicans and talk politics with them over dinner at the Palmetto Club.

title: Iron Mountain Reaches Truce With Elliott
description: Iron Mountain reached a settlement with a dissident shareholder, Elliott Management, on Tuesday, agreeing to give the activist hedge fund a seat on its board and committing to $2.2 billion worth of share repurchases and dividends.

title: Treasury Takes On Wall Street Lobbyists
description: The Obama administration is fighting back against Wall Street lobbyists and Republican lawmakers, who are trying to delay and dismantle new financial regulations.

title: Britain Will Send Military Advisers to Libya, Hoping to Tip Balance for Rebel Forces
description: LONDON  Britains decision to send experienced military officers to Libya, to advise rebels fighting forces loyal to Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, marks the latest development in the international communitys search for a means to end a bloody military stalemate that has killed hundreds in the contested cities of Misurata and Ajdabiya and left the rebels in only tenuous control of a few major coastal cities.

title: What Were Reading
description: A collection of links by the reporters and editors of the Dining section.Bloomberg: Bluefin tuna, sea bass, hake all face regional extinction in the Mediterranean, says an international conservation group.  Sam Sifton

title: Is Obama Messing With Texas?
description: President Obamas political advisers often talk about how population shifts in the country could create new electoral battlegrounds, pointing specifically to Arizona, Georgia and Texas.

title: Street Vendor Awards Add a Category for Heroism
description: There would seem to be a shoo-in or two for this.

title: Soul-Searching at a Defiantly Affordable Co-op
description: Amid Chelseas glittering landscape of galleries and buildings by Frank Gehry and Jean Nouvel sprawls a stalwart from an era long past: the Penn South co-op, a stretch of brick apartment buildings vaguely evocative of the Soviet bloc.

title: Venerable Art Dealer Is Enmeshed in Lawsuits
description: PARIS  On a mild day in January, French police investigators poured into the regal Right Bank building of an art research center called the Wildenstein Institute and began sifting through a substantial trove of artworks there.

title: Geithner Responds to Debt Warning
description: Treasury Secretary Timothy F. Geithner parses comments in a report issued by Standard & Poors, which called for a ratings cut for the United States over concerns about sovereign debt. Mr. Geithner disagreed with the finding, saying that there was no negative outlook for the economy. In a video interview on CNBC, he sought to assuage concerns about the possibility of a political impasse over current federal restrictions on debt levels, which S.&P. said could lead to defaults.

title: Israeli Luminaries Press for a Palestinian State
description: JERUSALEM  Dozens of Israels most honored intellectuals and artists have signed a declaration endorsing a Palestinian state on the basis of the 1967 borders and asserting that an end to Israels occupation will liberate the two peoples and open the way to a lasting peace.

title: Poor Season for Sunshine Is Great One for Spores
description: SEATTLE  There are many ways to measure the relentless precipitation and enduring gloom that have cloaked the Pacific Northwest the past few months.

title: Now Serving | The Crme Citron Rapide
description: Spring, the Chicago-born chef Daniel Roses restaurant in Pariss First Arrondissement, has made the French give America another look. Manic, wildly improvisational and not at all precious, the 33-year-old Rose himself is a large part of the attraction thanks to a massive open kitchen. One of his favorite desserts on the seven-course prix fixe menu is the oft-reappearing crme au citron. When assembled with a touch of whipped cream and, says Rose, a sprinkle of whatever cookies we made that ended up broken, it makes for a perfectly deconstructed lemon tart.

title: Reuters Brings In New Leadership
description: Thomson Reuters, which is trying to move beyond its roots as a news service, announced several strategic changes on Tuesday that will establish a new leadership structure as it seeks to broaden its reach among general news consumers.

title: Pull Up a Throne and Lets Talk
description: Over the past few days I have received hundreds of e-mailsand reviewedcountless tweets taking issue with my review of the fantasy series Game of Thrones, which began Sunday night on HBO. When I say taking issue, I am speaking euphemistically. Most respondents were horrified or furious or both. (I am enraged and quite frankly disappointed in your unfair review of Game of Thrones, wrote one reader.)

title: Worshipers Sing While in Custody
description: Members of a Christian church, called Shouwang, prayed and sang hymns while in the custody of the police in Beijing.

title: Remembering Grete Waitz
description: When Grete Waitz won her first New York City Marathon, in 1978, she was a complete unknown. She had never run a marathon. She was not listed in the race program. To those who saw her in the first 20 miles of the race, she was just a woman wearing Bib No. 1173. But at the 20-mile mark, Waitz took the lead, and the public-address announcer at the finish line had to admit that he didnt know who she was.

title: In Manhattan, Bentley Shows Off Its Icebreaker
description: What inspired Bentley Motors to take a Continental Supersports convertible to the frozen latitudes of the Bay of Bothnia, roughly 2.5 miles off the coast of Finland? Bentley would tell you it was done ostensibly to establish a new speed record on ice, at which Juha Kankkunen, the Finnish rally champion driver, succeeded, taking the 631-horsepower vehicle up to 205.48 m.p.h.

title: Red Bulls Foreign Legion
description: In last Saturdays 3-0 win against visiting San Jose in M.L.S., the 11 starters for the Red Bulls had 11 different nationalities (with thanks to my colleague Chris Tatti for pointing this out):

So if it mattered, we should have seen a jump in interest rates on April 18, the day of the announcement. Um, heres the 10-year bond rate:

title: Motorcyclist Fatalities Continue Decline
description: Motorcyclist deaths in the United States fell by at least 2 percent in 2010, the second year of decline, according to a new study.

title: Extra Credit?
description: One thing I see here and there  on blogs, in comments, etc.  is the claim that inflation is defined not by the rise in prices but by the expansion of money and credit, with prices just as a symptom.

description: To the Editor:

title: A Ramblin Man Makes His Way Off the Island
description: He stood out among the usual joggers and dog walkers yesterday in Riverside Park: a real, honest-to-goodness ramblin man striding uptown with his big pack hitched to his back, a bedroll and tarp lashed to it and a metal pan hanging from it.

title: The Lazarus Effect
description: The miraculous effect of antiretroviral drugs on Africans suffering from AIDS.

title: Window Shopping
description: The best place to get your fashion fix this season is not on Madison Avenue but at a museum near you. From London to New York, Yohji to Yves, the 1930s to 2011, these exhibitions spotlight solo designers and give new meaning to the words just looking.

title: Banks Make You Work for Their Fee Lists
description: When it comes to comparing bank fees, shopping around isnt as easy as it should be.

title: Sadrists Present Anti-American Message in Photo Exhibition
description: BAGHDAD  Unlike any other Iraqi public figure, Moktada al-Sadr has mastered the art of manipulating images and iconography in service of a political message.

title: Yemen Police and Protesters Clash as Deal Is Sought to End Political Crisis
description: SANA, Yemen  At least one protester died in clashes with security forces and plainclothes government supporters here in the capital on Tuesday. Security forces also fired on a demonstration in the central city of Taiz, killing one protester and wounding two others, according to witnesses and a doctor at the demonstrations field hospital.

title: The Lives Sports Change Indelibly
description: Basketball as a way to rise above the reservation. Surfing as a way to get off the island (in this case, Papua New Guinea). Cricket as a way to transcend third-world stereotypes. Reaching for a foul ball as a way to ruin your life.

title: End of the Rainbow Producers Aim for Broadway
description: The last time Judy Garland was on Broadway, it was August 1967 and she was back at the Palace Theater performing some of her greatest standards: The Trolley Song, The Man That Got Away, and, of course, Over the Rainbow. Over the 20 months that followed, Garland moved to London, had a five-week nightclub stand, married Mickey Deans and struggled with the pill addiction that would lead to her fatal drug overdose in June 1969.

title: Goldman Shares Drop; Some Banks Follow
description: Goldman Sachss first-quarter profit may have beaten analysts estimates, but it didnt impress investors.

title: Day One Highlights From the Shanghai Auto Show
description: In its 14th year, the Shanghai auto show is just a toddler by international auto show standards. Yet this week, as it bumps up against the New York auto show  the first was held in 1900  the relative upstart is flashing some heavy metal.

title: Excerpt: 'Sister Act'
description: Patina Miller and members of the cast of the new Broadway musical sing the number "Raise Your Voice." (Video courtesy of the production.)

title: Texas Wildfires Rage on With No End in Sight
description: Firefighters in Texas on Tuesday continued to battle raging wildfires that were consuming more than a million acres and showing few signs of abating.

title: Metropolitan Opera to Make Japan Trip
description: The Metropolitan Opera, after saying its tour this June to Japan was in jeopardy because of safety concerns, announced on Tuesday that it would go ahead with the trip. Peter Gelb, the Mets general manager, said in a message to the company that its decision was based on a recent advisory from the State Department that health and safety risks outside of a 50-mile radius around the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear plant are low and do not pose significant risks. The State Department had previously urged United States citizens to defer travel to Japan.

title: Dancing With the Stars Dominates Ratings for ABC
description: A 90-minute edition of Dancing With the Stars dominated the ratings on Monday as 19.6 million viewers tuned in to ABC from 8 to 9:30 p.m., according to Nielsens estimates. ABC easily led the night over all despite a diminished audience after the dancing competition for its sitcom Cougar Town at 9:30 (8.5 million). CBSs Hawaii Five-0 led at 10 p.m., drawing 10.9 million viewers and outperforming ABCs 20/20 special (7.6 million). CBS ranked second, earning modest ratings for its comedy lineup from 8 to 10, including How I Met Your Mother (6.4 million), Mad Love (5.6 million) and Mike & Molly (9.7 million), while a repeat of Two and a Half Men attracted 7.3 million viewers at 9. Fox was third with House at 8 (8.6 million) and The Chicago Code at 9 (6.4 million). NBC struggled in fourth place with Chuck (4.2 million) and The Event (3.7 million) followed by the recently rebooted version of Law & Order: Los Angeles (4.9 million).

title: Rich People Still Dont Realize Theyre Rich
description: Theres a movement afoot to mail every taxpayer a taxpayer receipt, a breakdown of how the government spends its money. The goal is to educate people about where their taxes go, since Americans are famously unaware about such matters.

title: Demi Lovato Leaves Sonny With a Chance
description: The Disney Channel star Demi Lovato is leaving her popular television show, Sonny With a Chance, the channel confirmed Tuesday.

title: Reading My Father
description: One

title: Recalling Childhood as a Styron
description: When Alexandra Styron, the youngest of the novelist William Styrons four children, was growing up, she writes in her new memoir, there was one inviolate rule in the house: Dont ask Daddy about his work.

title: U.S. Seeks to Shut Down Fake News Sites That Promote Berry Pills
description: The Federal Trade Commission says it willcrack down on fake news Web sites that are used to advertise aa berry weight loss pills and supplements.

title: T-Mobile Adds Free Calling Through Facebook
description: T-Mobile has 33 million customers in the United States. On Tuesday, the wireless carrier hopes to increase its reach 15-fold with a new application, Bobsled, which lets people call each other free through Facebook.

title: Q&A: Exploring Amsterdams Sights, and Beyond
description: My husband and I are going to the Netherlands for 10 days in May. Were renting an apartment in Amsterdam, which we found on airbnb.com. We would love to take day trips from there, and would consider an overnight trip to somewhere amazing. We are in our mid-30s, into art history and love to ride bikes. Do you have any suggestions?

title: Grete Waitz: 1953-2011
description: Waitz was a nine-time winner of the New York City Marathon who inspired runners around the world.

title: Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Marion Cotillard Are Cast in The Dark Knight Rises
description: The cast of The Dark Knight Rises, Christopher Nolans third and final entry in his series of Batman movies, is looking increasingly like the cast of his 2010 summer blockbuster Inception, with Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Marion Cotillard now officially on board for that superhero film. Warner Brothers Pictures said on Tuesday that Mr. Gordon-Levitt, who played one of Leonardo DiCaprios dream-invading accomplices in Inception, will play John Blake, a Gotham City beat cop, in The Dark Knight Rises; Ms. Cotillard, who played Mr. DiCaprios enigmatic wife in Inception, has been cast as Miranda Tate, a board member at Wayne Enterprises who is allied with Bruce Wayne. Tom Hardy, another member of the Inception gang, was previously announced to play the villain Bane, and Michael Caine, who had a brief role in that film (or did he? No, wait, he did) has played the butler Alfred in all of Mr. Nolans Bat-films.

title: Worthwhile Canadian Web Site
description: You could get lost for a while in the National Film Board of Canada Web site. It hosts an amazing array of movies, documentaries, animation and experimental film projects, all free for the watching. There is Leonard Maltins animation favorites, a 1976 Oscar-nominated documentary on the life and death of Malcolm Lowry or this interactive film, nominated for two Webby Awards, on returning to a small town 30 years later.

title: Video Surfaces Online Showcasing Different iOS Interface
description: A video appeared online Tuesday that shows never-before-seen features of the Apple iPhone iOS. The video was created by Tinhte.vn, a Vietnamese technology blog.

title: Ann Coulter Follows Up Guilty With Demonic
description: The conservative columnist and author Ann Coulter has vowed to take on the liberal mob in her new book, Demonic, whose publication was announced on Tuesday. The book is scheduled for release on June 7 by Crown Forum, part of Random House. The publisher says Ms. Coulter will address topics including the Democratic Partys coddling of violent mobs, the false history of civil rights given by the media and the truth about the original Tea Party. Ms. Coulters last book, Guilty, spent nine weeks on The New York Times best-seller list. According to Nielsen BookScan, which tracks roughly 75 percent of retail sales, it sold 121,000 copies in hardcover and 16,000 in paperback. Crown Forums authors include former Senator Fred Thompson, Joe Scarborough and George F. Will.

title: Changing Room Rage
description: A dubious affliction of shopped-out women.Three-quarters of women suffer from changing room ragewhen they are shopping, Sky News revealed:

title: Temp Workers in Germany Dismay Unions
description: FRANKFURT  Peter Hintermeier, a 60-year-old pipe fitter, is one of the people who have made Germany competitive again, but he is not too happy about it.

title: Mug Shot Is Released of Inmate Hevesi
description: The states Department of Correctional Services released a mug shot of former Comptroller Alan G. Hevesi on Tuesday. Once a champion of good governance practices, Mr. Hevesi was sentenced last week to one to four years in prison for his role in a corruption scheme involving New York States nearly $141 billion pension fund.

title: Buffett and Sokol Sued Over Trading in Lubrizol Shares
description: A shareholder of Berkshire Hathaway has sued Warren E. Buffett and his former top lieutenant, David L. Sokol, accusing the two of misconduct related to Mr. Sokols stock trading.

title: Critics' Picks: 'South Park'
description: A. O. Scott discusses the satire of the 1999 animated film "South Park: Bigger, Longer, Uncut."

title: Look Beyond the Box Score for Joel Anthonys Value
description: We know the traditional box score fails to wholly describe every players on-court impact, but few players are held in such unfairly low esteem because of it than Miamis Joel Anthony. On Monday, Anthony finished with four points on 1-of-3 shooting and six rebounds, though he did also have three blocked shots in his 27 minutes. Even with three blocks, thats an underwhelming line, and Anthonys typical lack of points and boards is part of the reason why hes often incorrectly grouped with Miamis less-than-productive supporting cast.

title: Just Looking | LAmour Fou
description: If the equivalent of an Academy Award were offered for best performance as a muse to artists, Marie-Thrse Walter would surely have won one. She was 17 years old in 1927, when she met a strangely charismatic, short man with mesmerizing eyes, sporting a handsome red-and-black striped tie, on the sidewalk outside the Galeries Lafayette department store in Paris, where shed gone to buy a Peter Pan collar and cuffs. You have an interesting face, he told her. Id like to do your portrait. The name Picasso meant nothing to her, but she kept the appointment they made at his studio the next day, igniting a passion that would change the course of his art.

title: Snoop Dogg vs. Joe Camel
description: Two weeks ago, I questioned Nickelodeons judgment for involving Snoop Dogg at its Kids Choice Awards, saying that Snoop is an adult-themed artist who has no place mingling with young children.

title: Thor Doesnt Drive. However
description: The comedian Jimmy Durante used to say, in mock exasperation, Everybodys trying to get into the act! When it comes to marketers involvement in promoting summer movies, that certainly seems true.

title: Sports at Tribeca
description: A look at the documentaries in the Tribeca/ESPN Sports Film series.

title: On Our Radar: Power Shortages Loom in China
description: Provinces in central and southwestern China may face their worst electricity shortages in years this summer due to intensifying coal shortages and drought, state officials warn. Fuel supplies are dwindling due to steadily rising prices and transportation problems, while meager rainfall during March has left hydroelectric facilities generating significantly below peak capacity. A major copper producing region is already suffering regular power shortages, hampering production. [Reuters]

title: Labor Puts Executive Pay in the Spotlight
description: The A.F.L.-C.I.O. has long been happy to treat executive compensation as a punching bag, and a Web site it put online Tuesday lands a few new punches.

title: Union Battle Rages at a Central Park Restaurant
description: From its perch on the lake, the Boathouse restaurant in Central Park has long been a favorite for wedding receptions, big-money benefits and twilight dinners for guests who like to watch the rowboats heading back to the shore at sunset. But workers at the Boathouse say it is anything but a pleasant place to work.

title: Spring at the Manzanares Ranch in New Mexico
description: On the ranch and on the plate, beef cattle are elbowing out sheep by a little more each year. How one family of lamb ranchers is coping.

title: Twitter Hit with New Spam Apps Overnight
description: A series of third-party apps began filtering through Twitter overnight that intentionally sent spam messages from users accounts without their knowledge.

title: Cuba Lays Foundation for a New Leader
description: HAVANA  Cuba on Tuesday made the most significant change to its leadership since the 1959 revolution, naming someone other than the Castro brothers for the first time to fill the second-highest position in the Communist Party and possibly setting the stage for their eventual successor.

title: Past Holds Clue to Goldstones Shift on the Gaza War
description: JERUSALEM  Two decades ago, Richard Goldstone, a Jewish South African judge, played a vital role in reconciling his countrys white minority government and rising black majority movement by leading a fact-finding mission into black violence that offered a Solomonic conclusion.

title: SoBro and ProCro NoJoke to Assemblyman
description: Updated, 3:46 p.m. | Its one of the oldest tricks in real estate: pretend that a property is in a more desirable neighborhood and demand more rent or a higher sale price. In other words, advertise that an apartment is in, say, Prospect Heights rather than Crown Heights.

title: Extensions for Sleep No More, Born Bad and Benefactors
description: Three new productions in New York have announced weeks-long extensions. Sleep No More, an interactive theater piece by the British company Punchdrunk that is performed throughout three renovated warehouses on West 27th Street, has extended through June 25. Ben Brantley called the piece, in which audience members wear masks while exploring some 100 rooms and environments, a voyeurs delight, with all the creepy, shameful pleasures that entails. Two well-reviewed Off Broadway shows have been extended through May 7: the Keen Companys revival of Michael Frayns drama Benefactors, at the Clurman Theater, and Soho Reps production of Debbie Tucker Greens play Born Bad.

title: TimesCast | April 19, 2011
description: Syria's government vacillates between crackdown and suggestions of compromise, a formula that destroyed the leadership in Tunisia and Egypt; two generals vie for control of Libyas rebel force.

title: In Va., Obama Pitches Debt-Reduction Plan
description: 4:32 p.m. | Updated ANNANDALE, Va.  President Obama on Tuesday made the first of what are likely to be many road-trips to pitch his case for a more balanced debt-reduction plan than House Republicans have passed, one that includes tax increases for the wealthy, cuts the military and preserves Medicare and Medicaid.

title: Blackboard Says It Has Received Takeover Offers
description: Blackboard, an online educational software company, said on Tuesday that it had hired Barclays Capital in response to receiving unsolicited, nonbinding proposals to acquire the company.

title: Waitz and Lebow, a Friendship for the Ages
description: Grete Waitzs accomplishments go on and on. She won the New York City Marathon nine times, the London Marathon twice, the world cross-country championship five times and the first world championship in the marathon. She ran four world bests in the marathon and two world records at 3,000 meters. And there was more.

title: Saabs PhoeniX Concept Makes Manhattan Landfall
description: If Saab had as much working capital as Jason Castriota has design ideas, the Swedish automaker would not have had to halt production earlier this month.

title: Lambing Season at a New Mexico Ranch
description: As ranchers in Los Ojos prepare for Easter, they also prepare for the births of 1,100 lambs, both Navajo-Churros and the Rambouillet breed.

title: All About Your Unused Rewards Points
description: Pop quiz time.

title: Stocks, Flows, and Pimco (Wonkish)
description: Ive been getting questions about what happens when the Fed wraps up QE2  related especially to Bill Grosss public view that interest rates will shoot up. This is related to the question of the extent to which QE2 has kept interest rates low. So a quick exposition of my theoretical position, which also happens to be more or less standard economics.

title: Reviewing Graffit
And for You, Mr. Dal?
description: THERE is something old-fashioned about Graffit, a new Spanish-modernist restaurant on the Upper West Side, something conventional despite the loud bar up front, its tall stools, yelpy music and graffiti-covered walls.

title: Pictures of the Day: Libya and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Libya, Ivory Coast, Turkey and Britain.

title: Administration Wants Tighter Painkiller Rules
description: The Obama administration said on Tuesday that it would seek legislation requiring doctors to undergo training before being permitted to prescribe powerful painkillers like OxyContin, the most aggressive step taken by federal officials to control both the use and abuse of the drugs.

title: Spinal Tap With Track Marks
description: The aging rocker has become a cuddly cliche in our culture, thanks to This Is Spinal Tap, The Osbournes and documentaries like Anvil! The Story of Anvil. You know: doddering long-haired ex-rocker half-mumbles while stumbling around adorably. And hes a potent character, this headbanger-gone-to-seed, embodying as he does some easily digestible lessons about chasing your dreams, living every day to the fullest and the often delusional yet somehow admirable pursuit of rock nroll glory at all costs.

title: Conceding the Principle (Wonkish)
description: Dave Altig at the Atlanta Fed is a circumspect blogger  as he must be, given his position. He generally understates his points, and gives the benefit of the doubt to those who dont deserve it; again, thats the nature of his position, so its perfectly OK.

title: Really, New York Has Had Snowier Winters
description: Admit it. Secretly, you were hoping you could build one last snowman, werent you?

description: Photographs from Libya, Ivory Coast, Turkey and Britain.

title: Premium Video-on-Demand Service to Begin Thursday
description: DirecTV says that on Thursday it will begin pumping into living rooms movies that have been in theaters for only about two months. The new service, which has been expected, has drawn harsh opposition from multiplex chains.

title: Capitals Arnott Has Had a Big Impact in a Short Time
description: ARLINGTON, Va.  As the Washington Capitals ponder how to win their first-round tug of war with the Rangers, their game plan depends heavily on a 36-year-old veteran center who joined the team less than two months ago: Jason Arnott.

title: Changing Your Account's E-Mail Address
description: Learn how to change the e-mail address associated with your New York Times digital subscription.

title: Is Capitalism Losing Popularity?
description: Even as Paul Ryan trumpets his free-market populism and the need for cuts to government spending as the only way to help the average American, The Economist reports that, at least according to a poll from the Canadian firm GlobeScan,capitalism as an ideology is actually on the wane. And not just in France (as you might have predicted) where only 6 percent strongly support the free market, but almost everywhere in the world except China, Brazil and Germany (the latter remains less than keen on bailing out its southern neighbors).

title: Milestones: The Life of Obama's Mother
description: A timeline of Stanley Ann Dunhams personal life and career.

title: Toyota Plans to Reduce Production for 6 Weeks
description: DETROIT  Toyota Motor said on Tuesday that it would cut production at its North American plants by 75 percent in the next six weeks to conserve its limited supply of parts made in Japan.

title: Heres to the Ladies Who Lurch
description: Note to Tony Glazer: This was a cute idea. A group of affluent, white-wine-drinking Westchester County book-club women whose leader sells them to television as a reality show. But almost everything about Reading Under the Influence: The Real Westchester Womens Book Club is not cute.

title: New Gang of Six to Take on Deficit
description: Another Gang of Six?

title: At the Met, a Soprano Ascendant

title: Hamas Captures Suspect in Italians Killing; 2 Others Dead

title: I.B.M. Exceeds Earnings Estimates and Raises Its Profit Forecast
description: I.B.M. has become a model of predictably solid financial performance, reporting a modest increase in revenue but a greater increase in profit.

title: Intels Quarterly Profits Are Lifted by Sales of Chips for High-End Servers
description: Despite facing one challenge after another in the first quarter, Intel posted strong profits on higher sales across its product line. The results surprised many investors, as well as Intel executives, who had projected a far bleaker quarter after a product recall, consolidation after two acquisitions and the effects of the Japanese earthquake on production.

description: SAN FRANCISCO  Carol A. Bartz, Yahoos chief executive, still has work ahead to lift her company out of its slump.

description: Thanks to whoever sent me this. Would that I could play in Muammar el-Qaddafis closet. Sadly, The Timess editorial policy prohibits me from taking this trip.

description: The 133rd White House Easter Egg Roll on Monday will emphasize health and fitness with a little help from the singer Willow Smith and the sprinter Tyson Gay.

description: The businessman and adventure tycoon Richard Branson is taking heat for his plan to bring 30 Madagascar ring-tailed lemurs to his own private island in the British Virgin Islands.

description: Britain will send experienced military officers to Libya to advise rebels fighting forces loyal to Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, its government said Tuesday.

description: The New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission approved controversial changes on Monday to the interior of the former Manufacturers Hanover Trust building on Fifth Avenue at 43rd Street. Preservationists had objected to revisions of the 1954 buildings interior, which was designated a landmark in February.

description: The charity named for the rapper Kanye West that was intended to reduce high school dropout rates has closed mysteriously.

title: As British Help Libyan Rebels, Aid Goes to a Divided Force
description: BENGHAZI, Libya  As NATO struggles to break a deepening stalemate in Libya, the British announced on Tuesday that they were sending military advisers to help build up a rebel army that has stumbled against the superior forces of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi.

title: A Relationship Forged Through Running, Family and Life
description: We called each other best friends, a friendship forged through running, writing and just being two women of about the same age. For nearly 30 years, and through co-authoring three books, scores of speeches, articles and conversing about sports, marriage and, yes, even death  I knew a Grete few people did. And through her, I learned what it truly takes to have achieved the greatness she did. In addition to her athletic gifts, she was the most focused, disciplined and humble person I have ever known.

title: Henry VIII Didnt Write This Royal Wedding Menu

title: Caring for Wounded Protesters in Sana
description: Doctors at a makeshift field clinic in the capital care for protesters injured during clashes with police.

title: The $410 Corkscrew

Wine lovers take them for granted, except when nobody can find one. Call a Boy Scout! Hes sure to be prepared with a handy multifunction pocket knife that includes one.

title: Where to Find a Very British Breakfast
description: APRIL 29 will dawn early for American fans of English royalty who would not think of watching the wedding of Kate Middleton and Prince William on TiVo. With most coverage beginning at 4 a.m., it will soon be breakfast time.

title: Distillers Take a New Approach to Canadian Whiskies
description: PHILIP WARD, a noted Manhattan mixologist, was blunt when asked recently whether he had any thoughts about Canadian whisky. Sure, I have thoughts, he said in a deadpan reply. I think about all the other whiskeys Id like to drink before Id drink a Canadian whisky.

title: When Digging for Ramps Goes Too Deep
description: FOR Ashton Berdine, a ramble in the woods to dig for the pungent tender-leaved wild leeks known as ramps has been a springtime ritual since he was a teenager. Even today, at 45, as the first buds appear on trees, he takes his family into the woods near his home in Elkins, W.Va., to dig a few ramps to cook with fajitas.

title: Dining Calendar
description: All About Eggs

title: Vinegar From Frances Far East
description: Imagine a vinegar that suggests sherry but will not darken your endive salad or fillet of halibut. There you have Vin Jaune vinegar. Its made from an unusual white wine of the Jura region in eastern France with a dry, sherrylike allure. The honey-colored vinegar made from this wine is at once nutty and spicy, with a hint of musky richness. A vinaigrette or barnaise will profit from its flavor, as will a last-minute pan sauce for chicken or fish.

description: April 19, 2011 - Amid protests, Syria's government vacillates between crackdown and compromise.

title: The Genius Who Built Central Park
description: You hope that whatever your lifes work is, it will outlast you, but for the huge majority of people, it wont. The swell job you did as an account manager or hairstylist might have earned you kudos from the boss or tips from customers, but no ones going to be savoring it generations from now.

title: Plane With Michelle Obama Aborts Landing
description: WASHINGTON  An Air Force passenger jet carrying Michelle Obama to Andrews Air Force Base early Monday evening had to abort its landing and circle the field because it was following too closely on the tail of a giant military cargo plane arriving ahead of it, the Federal Aviation Administration said on Tuesday.

description: Harry Campbell

title: For Brearley Titles, Everything but Your Majesty?
description: Brearley, the private all-girls powerhouse school on the Upper East Side of Manhattan, boasts some big-name alumnae. Caroline Kennedy went there. So did Jill Clayburgh, Kyra Sedgwick, Anne and Katie Roiphe and Jessica Tuchman Mathews, president of the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace.

title: Should You Worry About a U.S. Default?
description: Standard & Poors, the ratings agency, lowered its outlook for the United States to negative on Monday, a warning that the countrys top-notch, triple-A credit rating may be lowered. Credit ratings are supposed to give crucial insight into a debtors likelihood of default, so a lot of investors and pundits made a big deal about this announcement.

title: Stoudemire Not Forgotten, DAntoni Says
description: BOSTON  Amare Stoudemire was a devastating force for nine minutes of the fourth quarter Sunday night, and an apparent afterthought in the final three minutes. The Knicks offense veered elsewhere, the Celtics won the game and a meme was born: that Stoudemires teammates had neglected him.

description: The Department of Defense has identified 1,527 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans this week:

Manning, the Army intelligence analyst accused of leaking classified government documents to the Web site WikiLeaks, will be moved from near-solitary confinement at the Marine brig in Quantico, Va., to another prison under conditions that may be less restrictive.

description: The Wisconsin board that oversees elections said Tuesday that it found no major discrepancies in one countys final tally in a close State Supreme Court election this month.

description: Community Health Systems moved on Tuesday to dismiss a lawsuit filed against it by Tenet Healthcare, in which Tenet accused Community Health of overbilling Medicare.

title: South Africa Exults Abroad but Frets at Home
description: JOHANNESBURG  South Africa has been savoring its new membership in the club of emerging powers now known as BRICS, with that satisfying S in the acronym recently added to prove it belongs with the far more populous nations of Brazil, Russia, India and China. Last week, President Jacob Zuma attended his nations first BRICS meeting, in China, and boasted in a speech of South Africas increasingly important position in the international arena.

title: On Journey, Young Tunisians Need Only a Final Destination
description: VENTIMIGLIA, Italy  In the American Bar, across the square from the train station here, they have had enough. The Tunisians are everywhere, the waitress said. Its been like this for a month. They sleep in the station and on the streets, and weve lost a lot of customers.

title: Justices Skeptical on Role of Courts in Setting Emissions Standards
description: WASHINGTON  A lawsuit by six states and New York City to force major power companies to reduce greenhouse gas emissions was met with seemingly unanimous skepticism from the justices on Tuesday during arguments at the Supreme Court.

title: Sarasota Police Seek Clues After Tourists Are Killed
description: MIAMI  In a Florida double murder that has consumed the press in England, two British college graduates vacationing in Sarasota were shot dead in the citys roughest neighborhood Saturday after an evening of drinks at a local bar.

title: Networks That Stood by N.H.L. Secure Deal
description: Six years ago, the N.H.L. was emerging from a season-long lockout and looked like a bit like a TV orphan. It was spurned by ESPN as a sport that was losing its value and its zest.

description: Eric E. Schmidts new job as executive chairman of Google came with a very nice raise.

title: Lockout Permitting, N.F.L. Has a Schedule

title: Republicans Sharpening Online Tools for 2012
description: As part of President Obamas plan to rebuild the grass-roots movement that propelled him to the White House, he took to YouTube this week to urge his 19.3 million Facebook friends to join him, and invite others, for a town-hall-style chat on Facebook Wednesday with Mark Zuckerberg, the social media sites chief executive, at his side.

title: NRG Abandons Project for 2 Reactors in Texas
description: The company planning the largest nuclear project in the United States, two giant reactors in South Texas, announced on Tuesday that it was giving up and writing off its investment of $331 million after uncertainties created by the accident in Japan.

title: For Derek Jacobi, Now Is the Time for a Certain Role
description: LONDON

title: The Great Sumter Rally in Union Square
description: April 20, 1861

title: Rodriguez Pushes Return Back Another Day
description: TORONTO  Alex Rodriguez hit in the batting cages. He threw long toss. He played catch and fielded ground balls at third base. He did everything Tuesday except find a place in the starting lineup against the Toronto Blue Jays, saying he needed another day to rest his sore right oblique muscle.

title: Dangerous Arts
description: THE great Turbine Hall at Londons Tate Modern, a former power station, is a notoriously difficult space for an artist to fill with authority. Its immensity can dwarf the imaginations of all but a select tribe of modern artists who understand the mysteries of scale, of how to say something interesting when you also have to say something really big. Louise Bourgeoiss giant spider once stood menacingly in this hall; Anish Kapoors Marsyas, a huge, hollow trumpet-like shape made of a stretched substance that hinted at flayed skin, triumphed over it majestically.

title: Sharp Edge to Words in Rangers Hard-Hitting Series
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  The playoff series between the Rangers and the Washington Capitals has been close and contentious, so it was not too surprising that the coaches were sniping at each other on the eve of Wednesdays pivotal Game 4.

title: As a Star Elevates His Game, His Teammates Continue to Fall
description: Boston

title: Checkout Coupon Company Joins Boom in Online Discount Offers
description: A COMPANY long known for providing shoppers with coupons at store checkouts is joining the popular, crowded category of online coupons.

title: Mixed Feelings for Blagojevich Retrial, None of Them Happy
description: CHICAGO  Rod R. Blagojevich, the governor turned prisoner turned reality television star turned radio talk show host, is scheduled to get a new trial starting as early as Wednesday, eight months after proceedings ended with a jury divided on most of the corruption counts against him.

title: Goldmans Sluggish Growth Raises Concern on Wall St.
description: Goldman Sachs gave investors a peek at the new normal on Wall Street  and many are worried.

title: Police Union Fights Back Against an Inquiry, Calling Ticket-Fixing a Courtesy
description: As scores of police officers, supervisors and union officials are investigated for fixing tickets in the Bronx, the Sergeants Benevolent Association  the powerful union for the Police Departments 12,000 front-line supervisors  has started a campaign arguing that the practice, while widespread, is one of courtesy, not corruption.

title: A Rational Budget for the Pentagon
description: In their budget-cutting zeal, Republicans are demanding harsh sacrifices from the countrys most vulnerable citizens. At the same, they are determined to leave one of the biggest areas of wasteful government spending untouched: the Pentagon budget.

title: Trade Deal With Panama Clears Hurdle Over Taxes
description: WASHINGTON  The White House announced on Tuesday that Panama had satisfied a final condition for a free-trade pact with the United States, smoothing the way for President Obama to seek Congressional approval for three trade agreements inherited from the Bush administration and now central to his own job-creation agenda.

title: A Shrewd Bet in Galleon Case
U.S. Engineers Cite Lengthy Cleanup in Japan
description: Veterans of the Three Mile Island cleanup said that a much larger task faced the Japanese engineers who are trying contain and secure the damaged Fukushima Daiichi reactors. And Three Mile Island took 14 years.

title: Good Advice From S.& P.
description: Anything the credit rating agencies say has to be taken with a block of salt. In the run-up to the financial crisis, they were enablers of excess, happily slapping AAA ratings on the toxic assets of their Wall Street customers. The same happened with Enron and other debacles.

title: Making Campuses Safer
description: Federal statistics suggest that as many as 1 in 5 women will be victims of sexual assault during their college years. Far too many women who report their attackers are then victimized by complaint systems that are difficult to navigate and disciplinary proceedings that are stacked against them. The Education Departments civil rights office has issued new guidelines for schools with the aim of making campuses safer.

title: Sam Fulds Value to the Rays Goes Beyond Numbers
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  Samuel Babson Fuld was 10 pounds at birth, so chunky that the nurse in the delivery room told his parents, Ken Fuld and Amanda Merrill, that their son would grow up to be a football player. They called him Sumo Sam.

title: Obama Panel to Curb Medicare Finds Foes in Both Parties
description: WASHINGTON  Democrats and Republicans are joining to oppose one of the most important features of President Obamas new deficit reduction plan, a powerful independent board that could make sweeping cuts in the growth of Medicare spending.

title: Away From the New York Auto Show, Brands Bask in Their Own Spotlights
description: A spreading trend at auto shows  as inescapable as Rebecca Blacks Friday tween video, and possibly as insidious  is the off-site event.

title: Gov. Brewer Shows Some Moxie
description: A ray of sunshine emanating from a most unlikely source briefly penetrated the gloom of Arizonas right-wing politics on Monday.

title: Cuomo Helps Groups Mobilize for Gay Marriage Bill
description: Gay rights groups, which suffered the stinging defeat of a same-sex marriage bill in New York State in 2009, will publicly mount a new campaign for the legislation starting this week, relying on the popular Democratic governor, Andrew M. Cuomo, to overcome Republican resistance and their own history of poor coordination.

title: The Legend of Sam Fuld
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  Sam Fuld collected four hits for the Tampa Bay Rays on Monday, becoming the first player this season with two four-hit games. The first was at Fenway Park, on April 11, when he came a single short of the cycle by doubling in his last at-bat.

title: Many Mediterranean Fish Species Threatened With Extinction, Report Says
description: PARIS  Mediterranean fish, including bluefin tuna, sea bass and hake, are in danger of extinction from overfishing, marine habitat degradation and pollution, according to a report on Tuesday from the International Union for Conservation of Nature.

title: Revis Lobbies to Sign Moss and Edwards
description: Jets cornerback Darrelle Revis said he would welcome the petulant wide receiver Randy Moss to the Jets, despite Reviss previous assessment of Moss as a slouch. But Revis, speaking from a Range Rover event in Manhattan, also lobbied for the Jets to sign one of their own free agents, receiver Braylon Edwards. We need to keep Braylon, Revis said. Hes made a lot of plays since hes been here.

title: Belarus: Currency to Be Traded
description: Belarus announced Tuesday that it would allow its flagging currency to trade freely between banks, all but ensuring a devaluation of the ruble in an effort to ease an increasingly dire economic situation. The exchange rate had previously been fixed. Economists have said that the move would help jump-start the economy by lowering prices on exports, slowing the outflow of dollars and euros. But the decision will probably cause inflation to spike, further undermining confidence in Belaruss authoritarian president, Aleksandr G. Lukashenko. Soviet-style economic policies have depleted Belaruss foreign currency reserves, and people have been waiting in long lines to exchange rubles for increasingly scarce dollars and euros. The sense of crisis was compounded last week by a bombing at a subway station in the capital, Minsk, that killed 13 people.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: April 19, 2011

title: Chile: Evidence on Priest Seized
description: The police in Santiago have raided the home and offices of a lawyer representing a Roman Catholic priest found guilty by the Vatican of sexually molesting boys. The authorities seized documents related to the church case for a criminal investigation, a police spokeswoman, Lorena Quiroz, confirmed Tuesday. A judge ordered the raid after Juan Pablo Bulnes, the lawyer for the priest, the Rev. Fernando Karadima, above, refused to turn over documents. Mr. Bulnes on Tuesday called the action an abuse of his right to lawyer-client confidentiality. He said Chiles bar association has asked the Supreme Court to overturn the seizure. An appeals court voted last month to reopen a criminal case into charges of sexual abuse after the Vatican found Father Karadima guilty of abusing minors. The Vatican ordered the priest to retire to a life of prayer and penitence. He has appealed the Vaticans decision.

title: Italy: Nuclear Plants On Hold
description: Less than three years after embracing nuclear power, the government proposed a measure that would indefinitely delay plans to develop a nuclear energy strategy, including the building of plants. Italy had already announced a one-year moratorium on site selection and the construction of plants, but an amendment presented Tuesday in the Senate would scrap all the rules governing their construction. The Senate was to vote Wednesday on the measure.

title: Solar on the Water
description: PETALUMA, Calif.  Solar panels have sprouted on countless rooftops, carports and fields in Northern California. Now, several start-up companies see potential for solar panels that float on water.

title: Sudan: 350 Buildings Burned
description: Large parts of el-Feid, a town in Sudans Nuba Mountains, have been burned to the ground, satellite images from a research organization, the Satellite Sentinel Project, show. More than 350 structures were set on fire a week ago, the organization said Tuesday, noting that, according to a local politician, at least 20 people were killed in the attack. It said that many of the structures appeared to be traditional homes and that the attackers identities had not been determined. An election for governor is scheduled for next month in the State of South Kordofan, where el-Feid is located. The region has traditionally been aligned with the South, which voted in January to separate from the North. According to a 2005 peace agreement, the region is supposed to decide its own destiny by July.

title: Immigration Is Lead Topic as Leaders Are Gathered
description: President Obama told a gathering of business, labor, religious and political leaders at the White House on Tuesday that he remains committed to an overhaul of the nations immigration laws and wants to try again in the coming months to push Congress to pass a bill.

title: Prescription Drug Abuse in Appalachia
description: A generation of young people in Appalachia, who were raised by their grandparents because their parents were addicts, are now becoming prescription drug addicts themselves.

title: No Accord on Mekong Dam
description: Representatives from the four countries that share the lower reaches of the Mekong River said Tuesday that they failed to reach agreement on plans for a controversial dam in Laos. At a meeting in Vientiane, the Laotian capital, officials from Laos, Thailand, Cambodia and Vietnam postponed a decision on the Xayaburi dam, which would be the first across the Mekong south of the Chinese border. The dam is the first in a series of large-scale hydroelectric projects on the Mekong that the cash-strapped Laotian government is pursuing in order to sell electricity to other countries. Cambodia and Thailand recommended further studies of the dams environmental impact, and Vietnam, which fears deleterious effects to the Mekong Delta, called for a moratorium on dams across the Mekong. The governments did not say when they would meet to decide the issue.

title: The General in His Study
description: The writing is blurred and the paper nearly translucent, but the scene it portrays is vivid. In a recently discovered letter, Mary Custis Lee, the eldest daughter of Robert E. Lee, describes how her father wrestled with the decision to resign his commission in the United States Army and side with the South. The letter, found in a folder of fragments at the Virginia Historical Society, was written in 1871 to Charles Marshall, Lees former aide-tocamp, as he prepared to write a biography of the great general.

title: Manhattans Tech Start-Ups Settle in the Flatiron District and Chelsea
description: New York Citys technology sector has sometimes been called Silicon Alley, in deference to its Western big brother, which sprawls across the San Francisco Bay Area. Now, a decade after the dot-com crash stopped the rapid growth of the citys booming Internet sector, a high-tech corridor has developed in the Flatiron district and neighboring Chelsea.

title: Stripped of Dignity
description: WASHINGTON

title: Move on New Jersey Health Plan May Cost Towns but Help Power Broker
description: In the last three years, hundreds of cities, towns and school districts in New Jersey have saved tens of millions of dollars on health insurance by dumping their private carriers and switching to a little-known benefits program run by the state.

title: Madoff Investors Lawsuit Blaming the S.E.C. for Losses Is Dismissed by a Federal Judge
description: Two of Bernard L. Madoffs investors on Tuesday lost their bid to bring a $2.5 million suit against the Securities and Exchange Commission, blaming the agency for failing to detect and end the Ponzi scheme.

description: New York City is refusing to settle lawsuits brought by the five men whose convictions in the Central Park jogger case were overturned after they spent years in prison.

description: Allan Blakeney, the health minister of the Canadian province of Saskatchewan who helped start North Americas first tax-financed universal health care system in 1962, and was later the provinces premier, died Saturday at his home in Saskatoon. He was 85.

description: It is as much a college sport as football or beer pong. Whether poking soggy carrots or theorizing about the provenance of mystery meat, undergraduates have always loved to complain about their campus cafeterias.

But after decades of decline it has made a name for itself for a different reason: it is home to some of the highest rates of prescription drug overdoses in the state, and growing numbers of younger victims.

And yet as wielded by Kathleen Turners Sister Jamison Connelly in High, the sensation-stuffed drama by Matthew Lombardo that opened Tuesday night at the Booth Theater, the withering retort ultimately achieves better results than more soothing approaches.

description: Mark Bittman talks with actor and "Oceana" author Ted Danson about fish and the world's oceans.

description: A year after the BP oil spill, endangered sea turtles still wash up dead on Gulf of Mexico shores in large numbers. A federal investigation suggests that the culprit is likely not oil.

description: SANTA MONICA, Calif.  For hours on Tuesday, lawyers argued about Charlie Sheen and his lawsuit against Warner Brothers and the television producer Chuck Lorre before Judge Allan J. Goodman in Los Angeles County Superior Courthere.

title: Historic City at Odds With Its Popularity as Cruise Port
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  A plan to open a new cruise ship terminal next year has ignited a debate over the future of this historic city. Supporters of the project, including Mayor Joseph P. Riley Jr., say it will help open up an underused stretch of waterfront to public and private development. Opponents, among them preservation groups, downtown homeowners and real estate agents, counter that a huge influx of new visitors would overwhelm the citys cultivated charm and hurt home values.

title: Whats Worse Than an Oil Spill?
description: A year ago, the Deepwater Horizon drilling rig exploded, gushing nearly five million barrels of oil into the Gulf of Mexico before it was finally capped three months later. It was by most accounts a disaster. But when it comes to wrecking our oceans, the accidental BP spill was small compared with the damage we do with intent and ignorance.

He liked its atmosphere and the visiting clubhouse, and the feeling he got when he emerged from the dugout and gazed through the roof and saw the open sky.

But its a question that has intrigued and vexed scientists and coaches for some time, and it has implications for how young athletes should be trained.

According to The China New Vehicles Program: Challenges and Opportunities, prepared by PRTM, a management consulting firm, Chinas soaring consumption of imported oil could stifle the countrys economy, while emissions from petroleum-powered vehicles could choke its cities with air pollution.

title: Obamas Young Mother Abroad
description: The photograph showed the son, but my eye gravitated toward the mother. That first glimpse was surprising  the stout, pale-skinned woman in sturdy sandals, standing squarely a half-step ahead of the lithe, darker-skinned figure to her left. His elastic-band body bespoke discipline, even asceticism. Her form was well padded, territory ceded long ago to the pleasures of appetite and the forces of anatomical destiny. He had the studied casualness of a catalog model, in khakis, at home in the viewfinder. She met the camera head-on, dressed in hand-loomed textile dyed indigo, a silver earring half-hidden in the cascading curtain of her dark hair. She carried her chin a few degrees higher than most. His right hand rested on her shoulder, lightly. The photograph, taken on a Manhattan rooftop in August 1987 and e-mailed to me 20 years later, was a revelation and a puzzle. The man was Barack Obama at 26, the community organizer from Chicago on a visit to New York. The woman was Stanley Ann Dunham, his mother. It was impossible not to be struck by the similarities, and the dissimilarities, between them. It was impossible not to question the stereotype to which she had been expediently reduced: the white woman from Kansas.

title: Under Rome, a Trip Back to Imperial Times
description: As a rule, digging beneath the surface of modern Rome turns up ancient buildings. Excavations conducted in 2007, just steps from the traffic hub of Piazza Venezia, revealed two Imperial era villas embellished with mosaics, polychrome wall veneers, fountains and frescoes. Dating back to the second and third centuries, these opulent dwellings were abandoned in late antiquity, filled with landfill, and unknowingly used as foundations for the 16th-century Palazzo Valentini, now seat of the Province of Romes offices.

title: Who Made Coralines Sweater?
description: Im currently learning how to knit, but Im still at the stage where offering to make someone anything is more a threat than a favor. After looking around online this weekend for tutorials and patterns, I stumbled across a video about Althea Crome and was amazed at the amount of detail that goes into her miniature creations. The most recognizable pieces in her collection are the starred sweater and mittens that the title character wears in the 2009 animated film Coraline, from the animation studio Laika. With the amount of digital effects that go into contemporary movie making, it never crossed my mind that those objects would have been handknit. In an online interview, Crome says:

description: Im letting Dot Earth lie silent today to recall the lives of the 11 workers who died on the Deepwater Horizon drilling rig in the Gulf of Mexico one year ago. There is much to say about the full price of our existing energy menu, but also the steep price paid by the 2 billion or so people who live in parts of the world that lack any reasonable energy choices. There is much to say about mistakes of the past, culpability for the Deepwater calamity and energy imperatives for the future. But that can wait a bit.

There are several dozen long interviews with big names and behind-the-scenes names. Lots of great information. The I know, I know verse of Bill Witherss Aint No Sunshine was just a placeholder until Booker T and other guys in the studio told him to keep it. And Alex Call clears up the mystery of 867-5309. Boys of Summer, by the way, was a collaboration between Mike Campbell, who is the longtime guitarist with Tom Petty, and Don Henley.

title: Q. & A.: Filmmakers Path From Rwanda to Tribeca

The film, which has its world premiere on April 21, blends fantasy and reality in its portrayal of the aftermath of the genocide in Rwanda as seen through the eyes of a novice director struggling to make a film called The Cycle of the Cockroach. Mr. Ruhorahoza, 28, spoke recently to Arts Beat about the inspiration for the movie and its title, how Flaubert and Norman Mailer piqued his interest in storytelling, and why he chose filmmaking over practicing law. These are excerpts from that conversation.

title: River to River Festival Announces Lineup
description: Downtown mainstays including Philip Glass, Laurie Anderson, Patti Smith, Rufus Wainwright and Sean Lennon, and  straight from the Battle of Agincourt  Henry V will all be part of the 10th River to River Festival, the annual celebration of arts in lower Manhattan, its organizers said on Wednesday. The festival of free events, which runs from June 19 through July 16, will begin with the Bang on a Can Marathon at the World Financial Center Winter Garden, with performances by Mr. Glass, top, with the Bang on a Can All-Stars. The Castle Clinton National Monument in Battery Park will host concerts featuring Vijay Iyer (on June 23); Ms. Anderson, above, with Bill Laswell (June 30); and Ms. Smith (July 14). Rockefeller Park will be the setting of a June 22 tribute to the Bottom Line, featuring Rosanne Cash, Dar Williams and Marshall Crenshaw. Mr. Wainwright and soloists from the New York City Opera will perform excerpts from his opera Prima Donna at the World Financial Center Winter Garden on June 28. Mr. Lennons band the Ghost of a Saber Tooth Tiger will perform at the Seaport on June 24. And New York Classical Theater will present a two-castle production of Shakespeares Henry V at Castle Clinton in Battery Park and Castle William on Governors Island (with free ferry service between the locations). A complete schedule and other information can be found at the festivals Web site, rivertorivernyc.com.

title: First We Eat | Hitting the Hay
description: We are not just eating a steak, or an omelet, when our fork lands, tines down, into our food. We, as conscious consumers, are eating all of the resources it took to raise that cow and transport those eggs from farm to fork. So, as trends go, it is somewhat encouraging, if not a bit beguiling, to see such a rudimentary ingredient as hay (yes, plain old barnyard hay) begin to appear on menus around the country, as well as Europe. We have effectively cut out the middleman (the ruminant cow) and gone straight to the pasture.

title: Race and the Future of Entitlements
description: In a somewhat peculiar rejoinder to my column this week, Salons Joan Walsh accuses me of racial paranoia for suggesting thatasking an increasingly non-white working-age population to fund an ever-more-expensive entitlement system for a much whiter older generation might not be the most stable political equilibrium in the world. But then she goes on to basically agree with my premise:

title: Toasts for Royals, Spiked With Scorn
description: Its remarkable how much malice is woven into the lacy specials and flowery tributes that are taking over the screen in the last days before the wedding of Prince William and Kate Middleton.

title: A Jewel Case for Mercedes-Benz
description: Mercedes-Benz had plenty to show off on the eve of New Yorks annual auto show: the sinuous new Concept A-Class hatchback, for one, and a five-level, glass-walled dealership that highlights a nationwide upgrade of about 300 Mercedes stores, paid for largely with a $1.4 billion vote of investment confidence from its dealers.

title: Choosing the Best Credit Card
description: YOU bought the plane tickets, booked the hotel and rented the car. But have you packed the right credit card?

title: CIT Gets Restriction on Bank Lifted
description: Shares of CIT surged in trading on Wednesday after the company said that regulators had lifted a cease and desist order on its bank.

title: Afghanistan Outlines Plan for Scandal-Plagued Bank
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The Afghan government announced Wednesday that the scandal-plagued Kabul Bank, the nations largest private financial institution, whose shareholders had ties to high-ranking politicians, would be split in two as part of a drastic overhaul to save it from failure, stabilize the countrys financial system and reassure foreign lenders and donors.
