description: A New Jersey Transit worker who was fired after burning pages of a Koran during a demonstration in Lower Manhattan on Sept. 11 last year has been reinstated, reimbursed for lost wages and benefits, and awarded $25,000 in compensation for the pain and suffering caused by his dismissal.

title: Hazel Dickens, Folk Singer, Dies at 75
description: Hazel Dickens, a clarion-voiced advocate for coal miners and working people and a pioneer among women in bluegrass music, died on Friday in Washington. She was 75.

title: Dangerous Games
description: The debt limit is supposed to make Congress think twice before passing tax cuts or spending increases that add to the national debt. Instead, lawmakers routinely support policies without paying for them  like the Bush-era tax cuts and two wars  and then posture and protest when their decisions require raising the debt limit.

title: Saturday: Inclined to Strike Out
description: SATURDAYS PUZZLE  Fun, fun, fun.

title: For 2 Days, an Opportunity to Dismiss Minor Offenses
description: They came for spitting, loitering and littering. They came for noise violations and for consuming alcohol in public. Blake Bullard, 18, came on a cold and gray afternoon of his high school spring break for disorderly conduct.

title: Shielding the Privacies of Life
description: The Supreme Court has never heard a case challenging the governments authority to search a computer. It is time, after a panel of the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit opened the way last month to vast government intrusion. It ruled that, without good reason to suspect evidence of a crime, border agents could seize a laptop and open a dragnet search of files, e-mails and Web sites visited.

title: Vincenzo La Scola, Italian Tenor, Dies at 53
description: Vincenzo La Scola, an Italian tenor known internationally as both an opera singer and a crossover artist, died on April 15 in Turkey, where he was giving a master class. He was 53.

title: Acquittal in Conflict With Officer
description: A retired New York City police officer was acquitted on Friday of charges that he punched a female officer in a station house in Harlem last year during a confrontation over the polices decision to detain his son.

title: Democrats and Gun Control
description: Months after Al Gores defeat in 2000, Terry McAuliffe, then the Democratic Party chief, urged Democrats to steer clear of gun control, warning of the devastating impact on elections wrought by the gun lobbys monied campaign attacks. Far too many Democratic politicians have since followed that cynical doctrine. The gun lobbys power has only grown while 30,000 Americans die each year by gun violence.

title: Senator Ensign May Go, but the Questions Remain
description: Senator John Ensign abruptly announced his resignation on Thursday night, hoping to head-off a public airing of the ethics investigation into sordid misdeeds that destroyed his political future.

title: Rained Out Again, the Yankees Know Theyll Pay the Price
description: BALTIMORE  Derek Jeter kept checking his cellphone for the nights forecast. Curtis Granderson asked reporters for weather updates. A. J. Burnett climbed the steps leading to the Yankees clubhouse and said with a shrug, Still raining.

title: Of Donald, Dunces and Dogma
description: I told myself that I wouldnt be dragged into Donald Trumps birther cesspool, yet here I am.

title: Cup Got Crushed by a Tire? Real Madrid Gets a Spare
description: Real Madrid put its most recent trophy on display Friday in its museum at the Santiago Bernabeu stadium. No, not the one that was crushed under the wheels of the team bus during the celebrations for its Copa del Rey victory over Barcelona.

title: Celtics Light Up the Garden
description: The dream, as conceived by Amare Stoudemire last summer and reimagined at midseason by Carmelo Anthony, at last came into vivid focus Friday night at Madison Square Garden, where the Knicks were eager and the fans were primed.

title: Tenet Healthcare Rejects a Higher Takeover Bid
description: Tenet Healthcare said on Friday that its board had rejected a revised $3.3 billion takeover offer from Community Health Systems. Community revised its offer on Monday, saying that it would convert its bid of $5 cash and $1 in stock to an all-cash offer of $6 a share. The original unsolicited offer, announced in December, represented a premium of 40 percent to Tenets stock price at the time. The revised proposal, Tenet said on Friday, still grossly undervalues the company. In a letter to Wayne T. Smith, the chief executive of Community, Trevor Fetter, the chief executive of Tenet, said that the bid undervalued Tenet and that he had concerns about disclosure and regulatory compliance. Community said it was disappointed by Tenets rejection but was ready to engage in constructive discussions to move this transaction forward.

title: A Turn to the Right and a Second Look Is What the Mets Need
description: Ike Davis and the Mets benefited Friday night from two changes. One happened more than a year ago, when the Mets reconfigured Citi Fields center-field fence to make it easier to hit home runs to that area. The other happened in the bottom of the seventh inning, when Diamondbacks Manager Kirk Gibson replaced his left-handed starting pitcher, Joe Saunders, with the right-hander Esmerling Vasquez.

title: Unwitting Burglary Accomplice Could Be You
description: It happens in apartments all the time: BUZZ!

title: Clocking In After Sundown
description: Workers make it through the night shift using different tricks and tactics.

title: Builders of New Homes Seeing No Sign of Recovery
description: RICHMOND, Ill.  In this distant Chicago suburb, a builder has finally found a way to persuade people to buy a new house: he throws in a car.

title: A Profession in Transition
description: American medicine is steadily shifting away from small, privately owned clinics and becoming an industry dominated by larger groups of doctors in salaried jobs.

title: Resignation Has Nevada Sorting Out the Fallout
description: LAS VEGAS  Even before Senator John Ensign announced last month that he would not seek re-election, Representative Dean Heller was working feverishly to make sure he was seen as the inevitable Republican nominee.

title: The World This Week
description: Bitter divisions remain after the Nigerian elections; the fight over the 2012 budget in the United States continues.

title: With Rondo at Point, Celtics Show Knicks What They Lack
description: Just as reality intruded on Butler last month in Houston, it descended on the undermanned Knicks on Friday night at Madison Square Garden, neatly camouflaged in the 6-foot-1, 170-pound point guard persona of Rajon Rondo.

title: An Interview With ElBaradei
description: The Op-Ed columnist Roger Cohen speaks with Mohamed ElBaradei, the Nobel laureate and opposition leader, about democracy in Egypt.

title: Jubilation in Egypt
description: The Op-Ed columnist Roger Cohen on the challenges ahead in forming a new government.

title: Knicks-Celtics: Game 3 Highlights
description: The Celtics routed the Knicks behind the strong play of four of their starters and took a 3-0 lead in the series.

title: Lakers Back in Control Against Hornets
description: NEW ORLEANS  The Los Angeles Lakers regained their homecourt advantage Friday night with a 100-86 victory against the Hornets in Game 3 of their first-round playoff series, but they hardly looked like the well-oiled machine that has rolled to the past three N.B.A. Finals.

title: BBC, Under Criticism, Struggles to Tighten Its Belt
description: LONDON

title: The Weekend Word: Hide and Seek
description: Todays Times

title: N.F.L. Draft: Adam Froman, Fourth-Ranked Quarterback
description: Matt Waldman is the author of The Rookie Scouting Portfolio, an 859-page testament to his obsession with film analysis. This series counts down his top five draft prospects at quarterback, running back, wide receiver and tight end.

title: Syrian Forces Open Fire at Protesters Funerals
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Syrian security forces fired their weapons into crowds of mourners in at least three towns on Saturday as tens of thousands of people buried protesters who were killed a day earlier in the worst bloodshed since the uprising began last month. Human rights activists and witnesses said at least 11 people were killed on Saturday.

title: Beer Drinking and What It Says About Chinas Economy
description: 04/25/11 | Updated to correct figures on beer consumption in China and the Czech Republic.

title: In Ominous Sculpture, the Tap, Tap of a Pending Emergency
description: A couple of months ago I attended an art opening at the Marina Gallery in Cold Spring, N.Y., the little river town that counts as our urban center. While milling with the crowd, my ears became attuned to a regular tap. I found the source, a work of art consisting of a hammer banging metronome-style on the framed words, Break Glass in Case of Emergency.

title: Redefining the Sexes in Unequal Terms
description: The good news is that the International Olympic Committee and the International Association of Athletics Federations, the governing body for track and field, have worked hard to come up with a new policy to deal with athletes whose sex development is unusual.

title: Jackson Leaves a Legacy of Big Talk and Bigger Horses
description: Jess Jackson looked like the longshoreman he once was. He was a big man with white hair and a sonorous voice. Wine was his primary business  he was the founder of Kendall Jackson Winery. Thoroughbreds were his passion, however, a lifelong one first sparked watching the great Seabiscuit run when he was a boy in Depression-era San Francisco.

title: The Weeks Business News in Pictures
description: Photographs of news and features in business.

title: Recognizing a More Important Meaning of Being There
description: Elizabeth Grace Lewis, the newborn daughter of the Texas Rangers right-hander Colby Lewis, has a unique distinction in baseball history. She is the first baby whose father was placed on the paternity leave list to witness her birth.

title: Libyan Forces Withdraw From a Besieged City, and the Rebels Wonder Why
description: BENGHAZI, Libya  In a sudden shift after nearly two months of heavy siege, government forces withdrew from the western city of Misurata on Saturday.

title: Rookie Aiming High
description: Baseball is a sport rich in statistics, and consumed by debate over the meaning of virtually each and every one of those numbers.

title: Laugh Lines
description: CONAN OBRIEN

title: Mommys Helper, in Red and White, and in the Courtroom, Too
description: Its come down to this in the battle to win over beleaguered, stressed-out moms: Rival vintners are fighting over the use of the word Mommy on their wine labels, Reuters reports.

title: Back Then: 2005
description: Grete Waitz, who won the New York Marathon nine times, died last week of cancer at 57. Harvey Araton of The Times spoke to her in 2005, the year she disclosed the diagnosis.

title: Prime Number
description: 585: The estimated number, in the thousands, of people in China who this year will have more than 10 million renminbi  or about $1.5 million  in investable assets, according to a study by the consulting firm Bain & Company. That number is twice what it was in 2008. Most of those individuals are first-generation entrepreneurs, according to Bain. The fastest growth has been among those worth more than $15 million. Justin Yifu Lin, the World Banks chief economist, last year named growing income disparity as one of Chinas biggest economic problems.

title: Tornadoes Tear Through St. Louis, Shutting Down the Airport
description: ST. LOUIS  Several tornadoes ripped through this area Friday evening, and one of them touched down right by Lambert-St. Louis International Airport, blowing out windows, panicking airline passengers and filling once-orderly terminals with flying glass and ferocious winds.

title: Fighting Words
description: The United States Fish and Wildlife Service is facing an avalanche of lawsuits and petitions from environmental groups to add new animals and plants to the endangered species list.

title: Vermont Exercising Option to Balance the Budget
description: MONTPELIER, Vt.  Technically, Vermont could play fast and loose in this season of fevered budget-chopping: it happens to be the only state with no budget-balancing requirement.

title: The Humanity of the Long-Distance Runner
description: Grete Waitz, the most private of individuals, ended up excelling in the most public of sports, marathon racing. She ran past millions of cheering, hand-extending New Yorkers on the way to breaking the finish line tape in Central Park nine times. Moments later, she faced the swarming news media.

title: In Jacksons Finale, Lakers Parting Gift Challenges His Skills
description: NEW ORLEANS  Life has come full circle for Phil Jackson, who seized on basketball as a youngster to escape the rhythms and rigors of the church life ordained by his parents, who were Pentecostal ministers.

title: A Group of Conflict Photographers Runs Out of Luck
description: It was the photographer Joao Silva, lying in a hospital bed in Washington, his legs blown off in Afghanistan, who confirmed that my close friend was dead.

title: Variety: A Run-On Acrostic
description: SECOND SUNDAY PUZZLE  Todays acrostic by Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon is about just one of the unique qualities of a language I wont name for fear of giving too much away. The book itself is a wonderful trip into the culture behind this language, and the authors immersion into both while living abroad.

title: An N.B.A. Rival Offers a Message of Hope for Knicks Fans
description: Encouragement often comes from the most unexpected sources. On Friday, Grant Hill, the Phoenix Suns forward, delivered a message to the Knicks and their fans: Do not be dismayed.

title: A Royal Wedding, a Tarnished Crown
description: LONDON  Outwardly, at least, this weeks royal pageant will bear a strong resemblance to the last of the great royal weddings, when Prince Charles married Lady Diana Spencer in 1981. Now, as then, a tall, slim young man in a crisply tailored military uniform will wed a bride so striking she has launched 10,000 magazine covers, offering to Britain and the world the promise of a monarchy alluringly renewed.

title: Shanghai Truckers Protest Ebbs With Concessions Won on Fees
description: BEIJING  A three-day protest by truck drivers that disrupted Shanghais sprawling port appeared to ebb on Saturday after the local government promised to cut some transport fees and abolish others, meeting some of the drivers demands.

title: Scenes From the Madoff Masquerade
description: This article was adapted from The Wizard of Lies: Bernie Madoff and the Death of Trust, by Diana B. Henriques, a reporter for The New York Times. The book, to be published on Tuesday by Times Books, analyzes Mr. Madoffs rise and fall.

title: Mail Bombs Are Prelude to a Soccer Showdown
description: LONDON  In Scotland, they call it the Old Firm rivalry  more than 100 years of fierce encounters between Glasgows top soccer clubs, Rangers and Celtic, who have made almost a closed shop of their pursuitfor supremacy in the Scottish game.

title: Tribeca Q&A: Lee Hirsch
description: Lee Hirsch, the director of Bully, discussed his film about the issue of bullying in schools during last years Tribeca Film Festival.

title: For Longtime Fans of the Knicks, a Garden View Is Clouded by Green
description: Long before he claimed what most would consider a prize courtside season ticket for Knicks games at Madison Square Garden  one with a direct view of the back of Woody Allens head  Lewis Dorf was spoiled with the best seat in the house.

title: India Finds Corruption in Fast-Growing Aviation Industry
description: NEW DELHI  More than a dozen commercial pilots in India have been stripped of their licenses and a top airline safety official has been suspended after a government investigation uncovered widespread fraud and corruption in the booming aviation industry.

title: A Crack in Wall Streets Defenses
description: TWO individual investors just scored a remarkable win against Citigroup.

title: Its Showtime, So Take That Deep Breath
description: This interview with  Caryl M. Stern, president and chief executive of the U.S. Fund for Unicef, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: Do It Yourself, or With the Help of Tinkerers Everywhere
description: HANDS-ON kits offer great ways to learn about science and engineering. But the joys of making a small robot or a crystal radio set have long eluded those who cant get past Step 2 in the instruction manual.

title: Letting Others Lead in Libya
description: WASHINGTON  When the battle for Libya seemed to be slipping into stalemate last week, the British, French and Italians sent military advisers, a phrase that to much of the world suggests the first step on the slippery slope to ground forces.

title: World Bank Faults Itself for East Timors Struggles
description: WASHINGTON  A frank evaluation by the World Banks internal auditors of a decade of efforts to help East Timor underscores the challenges facing international organizations trying to assist struggling nations.

title: Why the King James Bible Endures
description: The King James Bible, which was first published 400 years ago next month, may be the single best thing ever accomplished by a committee. The Bible was the work of 54 scholars and clergymen who met over seven years in six nine-man subcommittees, called companies. In a preface to the new Bible, Miles Smith, one of the translators and a man so impatient that he once walked out of a boring sermon and went to the pub, wrote that anything new inevitably endured many a storm of gainsaying, or opposition. So there must have been disputes  shouting; table pounding; high-ruffed, black-gowned clergymen folding their arms and stomping out of the room  but there is no record of them. And the finished text shows none of the PowerPoint insipidness we associate with committee-speak or with later group translations like the 1961 New English Bible, which T.S. Eliot said did not even rise to dignified mediocrity. Far from bland, the King James Bible is one of the great masterpieces of English prose.

title: Warren Buffett, Delegator in Chief
description: He picked the chorus line but didnt attempt to dance.

title: Off the Menu: Gravy
description: The idea behind Gravy, which has had some dinners for friends of the restaurant and is opening Saturday, is to bring Southern touches to New York food. For Michael Vignola, the executive chef who worked at Michael Jordans The Steakhouse NYC, the culinary definition of the South goes beyond hush puppies and gumbo. There are all the African, Spanish and French influences and all the ingredients involved, he said. The a la carte menu has Louisiana crawfish gumbo fritters, oysters with chayote mignonette, scallops with honey grits, and cornflake-crusted chicken stuffed with andouille and cheddar. For a more New York approach there are also red snapper served like sashimi, black-eyed pea hummus, Long Island duck with green tomato relish and blackened king crab legs.

title: When Theres No Such Thing as Too Much Information
description: INFORMATION overload is a headache for individuals and a huge challenge for businesses. Companies are swimming, if not drowning, in wave after wave of data  from increasingly sophisticated computer tracking of shipments, sales, suppliers and customers, as well as e-mail, Web traffic and social-network comments. These Internet-era technologies, by one estimate, are doubling the quantity of business data every 1.2 years.

title: Show Us the Data. (Its Ours, After All.)
description: NO one knows what I like better than I do.

title: Beyond the Surge in Corporate Profits
description: EARNINGS season got under way last week, and at first glance it seemed as if nothing had changed.

title: Teams That Score First in Playoff Games Are Tough to Beat
description: The most eye-catching theme in the first round of the N.H.L. playoffs has been the comebacks staged on three consecutive nights by the Sharks (from four goals down to beat the Kings), the Capitals (from three goals down to shock the Rangers) and the Bruins (from three goals down to defeat the Canadiens).

title: From a Crisis, Opportunity
description: I GREW up in Savannah, Ga. When I was 10, I entered an essay contest on why I loved the city. It was a promotion for the opening of its convention center. I won for the elementary school category and appeared at the opening. Diahann Carroll was also part of the celebration. Istill remember havingbutterflies in my stomach.

title: My Finest Hour as an Investor
description: To the Editor:

title: Another Trait for C.E.O.S.
description: To the Editor:

title: Leaving Tent Camps, Haitians Live in Limbo
description: Most of the former camp dwellers are scattered in improvised dwellings or living in precarious housing.

title: Behind the Rising Cost of Food
description: The plate has always been a great fortifier. Soup to heal, stew to comfort, escape delivered in a good piece of chocolate.

title: 30 Seconds With Mike Schmidt
description: Mike Schmidt, a three-time National League most valuable player, is remembered primarily as a slugger. In 18 seasons with the Philadelphia Phillies, he hit 548 home runs and led the league in home runs eight times. But he also had a keen sense of plate discipline (.380 career on-base percentage) and was a stellar third baseman (10 Gold Gloves).

title: The Shifting Definition of Worker Loyalty
description: IS loyalty in the workplace dead?

title: Tribeca Video Interview: Lee Hirsch
description: Following five families over the course of a school year, the documentary The Bully Project tackles the issue of bullying and how it affects students, their families, the schools and society at large. The director Lee Hirsch filmed in Georgia, Mississippi and Oklahoma, and was given access to shoot in two schools in Sioux City, Iowa. In this video, he discusses his ideas behind The Bully Project, what the process was like filming moments of bullying as they were happening and what he hopes the film will achieve.

title: A Customer Whos Always Satisfied
description: WHO is Lucas Fayne?

title: In an Afghan Village, Living in Fear of Both Sides
description: TOWDABAY KALAY, Afghanistan  The American soldiers knew little about this farming village in the rugged foothills of Paktika Province in eastern Afghanistan, but they were told the Taliban moved through regularly.

title: Maybe Just Drunk Enough to Remember
description: Drunken recollections, especially in rape trials, rarely play well to jurors. In a society that can be quick to turn a skeptical eye toward women who say they were raped  she was scantily dressed, shes promiscuous, shes just angry at him  prosecutors of sex crimes say one of their biggest obstacles in the courtroom is alcohol.

title: Brnnhildes Trials Beyond Wagners Dreams
description: Two scenes in the Metropolitan Operas highly anticipated new production of Wagners Walkre, which opened on Friday night, showcased what is both captivating and exasperating about Robert Lepages production, the second installment in his staging of the complete Ring cycle.

title: Two Schools in Afghanistan, One Complicated Situation
description: The schoolhouse at the end of the world is a simple affair. Made of concrete and painted gray, it bears the white star of the Central Asia Institute, the nonprofit group co-founded by Greg Mortenson. The group says it has built more than 170 schools in Pakistan and Afghanistan.

title: On Pity for the Rich
description: Matt Yglesias has a good question, but I dont think that I agree with his answer.

title: Social Media Accounts of Protests in Syria
description: As my colleague Anthony Shadid reports, the uprising in Syria continued on Saturday, as the security forces attacked crowds of mourners in at least three towns, during funerals for protesters killed a day earlier.

title: Rebels Take Control in Misurata
description: Troops captured in Misurata, Libya, said Saturday that they had been ordered to retreat from the city, in what appeared to be a significant setback for Col. Muammar el-Qaddafis forces.

title: Who Debased the Dollar?
description: Barry Ritholtz makes an obvious but strangely unnoticed point: right now we have all these people hysterical about the debasement of the dollar, but where were they when the real devaluation was taking place?

title: Stoudemire Is Doubtful for Game 4
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  At full strength, Amare Stoudemire could salvage the Knicks playoff run, or at least delay their elimination. But he is nowhere near full strength. And it may not be worth risking his health to delay what appears inevitable.

title: President of Yemen Offers to Leave, With Conditions
description: CAIRO  Yemens embattled president, Ali Abdullah Saleh, said Saturday that he accepted a proposal by Arab mediators that would shift power to his deputy 30 days from the signing of a formal agreement and grant him and his family, who occupy key positions in Yemens security apparatus, immunity from prosecution.

title: Afghan Police Seek to Stop Illicit Trade in Uniforms
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The police on Saturday ratcheted up enforcement on stores and tailor shops that illegally make and sell military and police uniforms after a string of attacks by insurgents dressed as Afghan service members that have cast suspicion on the countrys security forces.

title: Majestic Views, Ancient Culture and a Profit Fight
description: GRAND CANYON WEST, Ariz.  Think of a Caribbean glass-bottomed boat hung out over the edge of the Grand Canyon and you have the idea behind the Skywalk, a modern, vertigo-inducing moneymaker that is drawing hundreds of thousands of people annually onto the Hualapai Indians reservation to stare down beneath their feet at the distant canyon floor.

title: Hold the Halo
description: WASHINGTON

title: Reports of 2 Tibetans Killed by Chinese Officers
description: BEIJING  A Tibet advocacy group based outside China said in a report released Friday that two Tibetans were killed Thursday night by Chinese paramilitary officers who were raiding a monastery in Sichuan Province to detain rebellious monks.

title: What About American Girls Sold on the Streets?
description: When we hear about human trafficking in India or Cambodia, our hearts melt. The victim has sometimes been kidnapped and imprisoned, even caged, in a way that conjures our images of slavery.

title: For Many Chinese, New Wealth and a Fresh Face
description: BEIJING  Even in a blue-striped hospital bathrobe, her face wiped clean of makeup and marked with purple lines by her surgeon, the young woman who called herself Devil embodied an image of beauty widely admired in China: large, luminous eyes, a delicate nose and softly sculpted cheekbones.

title: A Real Choice on Medicare
description: We know it is not how most people want to spend their time, but Americans need to give a close reading to the Democrats and Republicans plans for Medicare reform. There are stark differences that will profoundly affect all of our lives  and clear political choices to come.

title: Union Proud
description: It seemed like all of New York turned out for the April 20, rally in support of the Union. The event, which appropriately took place at Union Square, prompted diarist George Templeton Strong to suggest that [f]ew assemblages have excelled it in numbers and unanimity. Men, women and children carried flags or wore cockades, the Stars and Stripes hung from buildings and impromptu renderings of The Star-Spangled Banner echoed through the streets. The city, observed Strong, seems to have gone suddenly wild and crazy.

title: With Coolest Job Ever Ending, Astronauts Seek Next Frontier
description: What happens when you have the right stuff at the wrong time?

title: The Bipartisan March to Fiscal Madness
description: Greenwich, Conn.

title: Violet Cowden, Wartime Plane Pilot, Is Dead at 94
description: The problem was simple, but would have disastrous consequences if left unsolved. The United States had entered World War II, and military aircraft were barreling off the assembly lines. But with many military pilots deployed overseas, or soon to be, there was no way to transport the planes from the factories to the airfields where they were urgently needed.

title: Human Trafficking in the United States
description: My Sunday column looks at human trafficking  but in America. This is a subject Ive written about a good deal in Cambodia, India, Pakistan and elsewhere abroad, and theres sometimes a tendency to think that the problem just exists overseas, or just among foreign women smuggled in the the U.S. Its true that the worst places in the world for forced prostitution maybe Pakistan, India, Bangladesh, Nepal, Cambodia, Burma, and so on. But we also have significant problems in the United States  particularly among home-grown young teenagers  and we dont have the credibility to address the problems abroad unless we clean up our act at home.

title: A Slogan, Not a Plan
description: REPUBLICANS have an effective slogan for their health care agenda: repeal and replace. The problem is, they can agree only on the first half; agreeing on what to put in place of last years health care law is the hard part. Even Representative Paul Ryans bold budget proposal avoids the issue.

title: Quick Help for the Gulf
description: The agreement announced Thursday under which BP will make a $1 billion down payment on its obligation to restore the Gulf of Mexico to good health is such welcome news that it seems almost churlish to offer caveats. But caveats there are.

title: Pastor Is Accused of Helping to Kidnap Girl at Center of Lesbian Custody Fight
description: Federal authorities last week arrested and charged a Tennessee pastor with aiding in the international parental kidnapping of a girl who has been missing since late 2009 and is at the center of a lengthy custody battle between her two mothers  a onetime lesbian couple who were in a civil union.

title: Jesus Christ Rock Star
description: East Lansing, Mich.

title: What the Season Returns
description: Ive just opened up the hive of bees that died over the winter. For several years, Ive left all the honey for them in hopes of making a hard season easier to bear. In a winter as cold as this past one, its possible for bees to cluster so tightly, trying to keep warm, that theyre unable to move to their stores of honey a few inches away.

title: Rebels Gain Ground in Misurata
description: Map of areas taken by rebels around Misurata.

title: Be Love Farm
description: Caf Gratitude, a small California chain of raw food and vegan cafes and restaurants, gets much of its organic live food menu items from Be Love Farm near Vacaville. Matthew and Terces Engelhart, who own the restaurants and the farm, reside on the 21-acre property, nurturing abundant produce for their expanding franchise.

title: Sunday: Use It or Lose It
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  Caleb Madison is one of the Young Turks of crossword construction, but dont think for a second that his head is swelled. Just because he was one of the youngest people to have a crossword puzzle published in The New York Times for a very long time doesnt mean that he doesnt give back. One of his pet projects is teaching a class in crossword construction at the Jewish Association of Services for the Aged called, appropriately, Get A Clue!

title: Exiles Shaping Worlds Image of Syria Revolt
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  On the bloodiest day of Syrias uprising, Rami Nakhles fingers drifted over the keyboard in a room silent but for the news bulletins of Al Jazeera, yet filled with the commotion on his computer screen.

title: Rangers Exit Fits Their Story Line: Grit but Few Goals
description: WASHINGTON  Brian Boyle sat quietly in his stall at Verizon Center, moments after the Rangers were eliminated from the playoffs by the Washington Capitals, trying to express the way he felt.

title: A System for Courts to Redress Wrongs
description: To the Editor:

title: Rationing Health Care
description: To the Editor:

title: Museums: Back to Basics
description: To the Editor:

title: Pat-Downs at the Airport
description: To the Editor:

title: Fast Train to Nowhere
description: Stanford, Calif.

title: Poor Janes Almanac
description: Cambridge, Mass.

title: Plan for Treasure Island Clears Hurdle, but Serious Issues Remain
description: Fantastic plans for Treasure Island, all worthy of its name, have come and gone since the Navy announced its departure in the mid-1990s.

title: Picking on the Competition
description: IT was Pulitzer Prize Day at The New York Times on Monday. Hundreds had gathered in the third-floor newsroom and around the atrium balcony one floor above. Spouses, parents and children of the winners were there, the mood festive, almost like graduation day. Im told this is how it goes every year when The Times assembles to receive its annual laurels.

title: Hopefully, All This Rubbish Can Stop
description: Celtic and Rangers will renew their ancient rivalry Sunday in Glasgow, days after the revelation that package bombs had been sent to several prominent Celtic supporters and the Celtic manager, Neil Lennon. John F. Burns of the Times checks in with Lennon, who has called the mail bombs a tipping point, and with Ranger Manager Walter Smith, who says the Old Firms bitter environment has become too toxic to enjoy. Read the full article, and come back here to comment.

title: Survivors of Priest Abuse Make Proposal to Church
description: At a quiet church in the Sunset district of San Francisco last weekend, about 15 sexual abuse survivors gathered for what they said they thought would be a climactic meeting with the three bishops of the Roman Catholic Churchs Archdiocese of San Francisco.

title: From Poland, Satellite TV Tries to Pierce the Belarus Media Muzzle
description: WARSAW  It is called Belsat TV, and it is the first and only independent satellite television channel for Belarus, broadcasting news and current affairs as well as cultural and childrens programs like The Adventures of Uszatek the Bear.

title: N.F.L. Draft: N.F.C. Team-by-Team Needs
description: The Timess Judy Battista is breaking down each teams weaknesses heading into Thursdays N.F.L. draft. Read Part 1 on A.F.C. team-by-team needs here.

title: N.F.L. Draft: A.F.C. Team-by-Team Needs
description: Quarterback is the highlight of the draft because youve got so many teams that would have filled quarterback needs in the off-season, Casserly said. Now that they dont have it, do they become more aggressive trading up? I dont see the conviction by people with these quarterbacks.

title: Warren Buffett, the Delegator in Chief
description: He picked the chorus line but didnt attempt to dance.

title: The Promise of Rapture for the High-Tech Elite
description: Elizabeth Lesly Stevens writes a column for The Bay Citizen.

title: Early Questions for Both White Sox and Cubs
description: Dan McGrath writes a column for the Chicago News Cooperative.

title: In Emanuels Team, a Mirror of the Man
description: David Greising writes a column for the Chicago News Cooperative.

title: Cuts Are Threatening Job-Training Efforts
description: Financial struggles forced Brenda Williams to close the small soul food restaurant she had owned on the South Side for six years. Aside from a one-month stint on a construction site, she hasnt been able to find work in the four years since.

title: Max Mathews, Pioneer in Making Computer Music, Dies at 84
description: Max Mathews, often called the father of computer music, died on Thursday in San Francisco. He was 84.

title: In a Rain of 3-Pointers, the Celtics Come Together
description: Near the end of Bostons practice Saturday, Paul Pierce lobbed a shot from halfcourt. The ball snapped through the net. Lets get out of here, Pierce said before checking with a cameraman to make sure the moment had been filmed.

title: Peter Lieberson, Composer Inspired by Buddhism, Dies at 64
description: Peter Lieberson, a searching, inventive American composer whose works were often inspired by his Tibetan Buddhist practice, died on Saturday morning in Tel Aviv, where he had gone for medical treatment. He was 64 and lived in Santa Fe, N.M.

title: Escaping Violence via the Drill Team, but Not Completely
description: As his team pulled into Dayton, Ohio, at 4 a.m. one day in early April, the head coach of the South Shore Drill Team was confident that his sleepy squad of 15 teenagers from some of Chicagos toughest neighborhoods had a shot at glory for the first time in nearly 20 years.

title: Iranian Leader Asserts Power Over President
description: TEHRAN  Irans supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, said Saturday that he remained ready to intervene in the countrys political affairs if the nations interests were being neglected, continuing a rare public flexing of his power days after a disagreement with President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad flared into the open.

title: Bloggingheads: Growing Pains in Gas Country
description: 8:21 p.m. | Updated The producers of Bloggingheads.TV invited me to join Abrahm Lustgarten of ProPublica in a discussion of the drilling boom aimed at the vast deposits of natural gas identified in deep shale layers and other deposits around North America and, increasingly, the world. Lustgarten is a lead reporter and writer in ProPublicas ongoing Buried Secrets project on environmental problems related to the gas boom.

title: In New Yorks Schools Chief, a Knack for Quiet Conciliation
description: This article was reported by David M. Halbfinger, Javier C. Hernandez and  Fernanda Santos and written by Mr. Halbfinger.

title: Stoudemire Voices Doubts on Playing in Game 4
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  The question was about the present, but Amare Stoudemire turned toward the future, and the promise of another spring.

title: Finding That Eight Years Is Too Long to Stay Away
description: When this years United States Championship tournament began in St. Louis on April 15, there was a notable absence and an interesting return.

title: The Battle for Abilene on the Senate Map
description: Ross Ramsey, the managing editor at The Texas Tribune, writes a column for the Tribune.

title: In Baltimore, Cano Hits Second to Almost None
description: BALTIMORE  When it was relayed to Robinson Cano on Saturday that he had the second-highest average at Camden Yards since the ballpark opened in 1992, curiosity overcame him. Wondering who surpassed him, Cano correctly guessed the answer  Ichiro Suzuki of Seattle  and then brushed off his success here.

title: For Novelist, a Magical Turn as a Record Producer
description: Jim Lewis wrote this column for The Texas Tribune.

title: Corrections
description: NATIONAL

title: Timeline: Dennis M. Walcott
description: The life and career of the new chancellor for New York City schools.

title: Resistance to Gas Drilling Rises on Unlikely Soil
description: FORT WORTH  Texans pride themselves on being the heart of the nations oil and gas business. But even here, public concern about natural gas drilling is growing.

title: Special Handling for a Gift in a Fragile Package
description: DOES anyone eat eggs for breakfast anymore? With early risers favoring a regimen of whole grains, fruit and yogurt, eggs have moved to the dinner menu. In local restaurants of the farm-to-table persuasion, eggs are enjoying a kind of vogue as the must-have accessory  served sunny-side up as the sun goes down.

title: Deferred Dreams Still Resonate in Raisin Revival
description: The opening scene of A Raisin in the Sun is about waking up in the morning, not wanting to make your bed, politely answering your mother when she asks what youd like for breakfast and getting into the bathroom fast, because other family members are waiting for it. Its about your mother telling you to get your car fare and milk money out of her purse.

title: In Vivid Portraiture: Boldface Names of Bygone Era
description: The drama grabs you from across the room: three men confer around a table spread with documents, intent on matters of the utmost urgency and import. Are they contracting a marriage? Planning an insurrection? Concluding a peace treaty?

title: Gold-Hearted Dames and Benign Crooks
description: When Andra Burns struts across the stage as the nightclub chanteuse Miss Adelaide in Guys and Dolls, now playing in Northport, its like trumpets blaring. And when the veteran actor Ken Jennings, as Arvide Abernathy, delivers grandfatherly advice in the ballad More I Cannot Wish You, his singing can bring tears to the eyes. The brassy Ms. Burns and the gentle Mr. Jennings embody the heart and soul of the production at the John W. Engeman Theater.

title: In a Former Bank, Money Still Talks
description: WHITE PLAINS

title: Painters and Musicians, Improvising Simultaneously
description: CONCERTS in art museums are nothing unusual, but one in which musicians improvise while an artist creates a painting is a twist on the standard offering. That will happen next Saturday night at the Parrish Art Museum in Southampton.

title: The Lure of Green Spaces
description: Every day is Earth Day, in a sense, for Bill Ulfelder, the director of the Nature Conservancy in New York, a job that combines management and fund-raising. He and his family moved to Manhattan, where they live on the Upper West Side, from Denver about two years ago. On Sundays Mr. Ulfelder, 42; his wife, Natalie Aristy, 38, a writer; and their daughter, Isabella, 7, bounce between Riverside Park and Central Park, often with their dog, Willow, a mixed-breed rescue. ELIZABETH A. HARRIS

title: A Stage Full of Chapins, All Honoring Harry
description: IF the public sometimes gets Tom Chapins music mixed up with that of his musical siblings  his brother Steve and his late brother Harry  it comes with the territory, he said. Thats what happens when families gravitate toward a similar sound.

title: Two-Out Hits and Solid Relief Propel the Mets
description: Daniel Murphy was already receiving applause from a thin crowd on a gray afternoon at Citi Field, but he lustily slammed his hands together eight times when he reached first base in the eighth inning Saturday, as if he were trying to rid his batting gloves of every speck of dirt.

title: Big Cuts for Magnet Schools in Dallas Stir Conflict Over Spending on Education
description: DALLAS  On a muggy afternoon in mid-April, Mary Ruiz, an animated 18-year-old, bounced through the air-conditioned corridors of her South Dallas high school.

title: Haitians Forced Out of Tents to Homes Just as Precarious
description: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti  The way Robert Darvin sees it, he is one of the lucky ones.

title: Vows: Lauren & Amy
description: Amy Rogers and Lauren Schwartzreich fell in love after meeting at a Midtown drag show where a mutual friend was performing.

title: Tornadoes Flatten Homes and Close Airport in St Louis
description: Nine tornadoes passed through the area Friday night, downing trees, shuttering the airport and spraying debris across the city.

title: Tchani Scores, Sees Yellow, Then Red
description: When Toronto midfielder Tony Tchani was judged to have tangled with Columbus midfielder Kevin Burns in the 37th minute of their game at BMO Field on Saturday, both received yellow cards.

title: Photo Replay: Capitals 3, Rangers 1
description: The Rangers fell to Washington, eliminating them from the playoffs in five games.

title: As Usual, Baltimore Brings Out Best in Yanks
description: BALTIMORE  Before Saturday, it had been nine days since the Yankees last glimpsed that elusive celestial body known as the sun, and all the rain and gloom in the interim had made them question its existence.

title: N.F.L. Draft: Some Holes a Prospect Cant Fill
description: Mike Tanier will provide live analysis of the N.F.L. draft, starting Thursday night. He notes that N.F.L. teams talk about drafting quarterbacks or pass rushers, but they may have more pressing needs:Bills An inhabited region to play in. When future archaeologists excavate the Buffalo area, the pottery shards will reveal that the population disappeared in 1974.Dolphins Some retro-chic offensive gimmick to distract us from how boring the rest of the team is. How about the wishbone option?Patriots Anything except comeuppance. They received plenty of that in the last four years.Jets A Cone of Silence that fits snuggly over team headquarters.Ravens They must draft Pittsburgh running back Deon Lewis and Texas Tech receiver Detron Lewis to fill the roles Jamal Lewis and Jermaine Lewis used to play. For the Ravens, the Super Bowl comes with a three-Lewis minimum.Bengals A magic lantern that grants Carson Palmer wishes. With his luck, the genie will emerge and demand the ball.Browns Peyton Hillis must win the Madden 12 video game cover contest because he is the Butler Bulldogs of meaningless fan balloting.Steelers Videographers for Ben Roethlisbergers bachelor party. Come to think of it, The Hangover Part II opens next month.

title: Stimulus by Fed Is Disappointing, Economists Say
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserves experimental effort to spur a recovery by purchasing vast quantities of federal debt has pumped up the stock market, reduced the cost of American exports and allowed companies to borrow money at lower interest rates.

title: Palestinian Police Kill Israeli Visiting West Bank Holy Site
description: JERUSALEM  The Palestinian police shot and killed one Israeli and wounded four others early Sunday after the Israelis surreptitiously visited a Jewish holy site inside a Palestinian-controlled area, officials on both sides said.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, April 24
description: After President Obamas authorization of the use of predator drones there, Libya is high on the agenda of the Sunday talk shows. Senator John McCain, Republican of Arizona, appears live from Cairo on CNNs State of the Union and NBCs Meet the Press to discuss his meeting with rebel leaders in Benghazi, Libya. And the United States ambassador to the United Nations, Susan Rice, adds her thoughts on the unrest in Libya on Bloombergs Political Capital.

title: In Prague, a Witches Night for the Whole Family
description: It would be easy to mistake April 30 in Prague for a mad, mistimed Halloween, or perhaps even a return to the Middle Ages. Witches cackle through the parks, and effigies are burned atop blazing pyres. But the annual Carodejnice, or Witches Night, is a far less sinister tradition than you might think, one rooted in pagan rituals. Burning the effigy witch means goodbye to winter, and the costumed festivities that take place in Pragues parks are a frantic welcome to spring, featuring concerts, childrens games, and, of course, lots of beer and sausages. Here is a selection.

title: How to Take Concert Photos That Rock
description: If you think its hard to play a Stevie Ray Vaughan-style guitar solo, try photographing one.

title: QE2 Disappointment (Wonkish)
description: People have been asking me about this article on the disappointing results of the Feds quantitative easing. What I would say is that QE2 has been implemented in such a way that there was no reason to expect a lot of traction on the economy; the only channel through which we might have had large effects was via expectations. And that part mainly happened before the policy actually began.

title: Thailand and Cambodia Clash Again in Border Dispute
description: BANGKOK  Thai and Cambodian troops clashed for a third day on Sunday in the first major territorial encounter since an informal cease-fire that followed four days of fighting in February. At least 10 people were killed and thousands of residents were evacuated from border areas, according to reports from both sides.

title: Excerpt: 'Born Yesterday'
description: Nina Arianda and Robert Sean Leonard in a scene from the new Broadway revival of the play "Born Yesterday," at the Cort Theater. (Video courtesy of the production.)

title: Die Walkre
description: Scenes from the Metropolitan Operas new production of Wagners opera.

title: China Detains Church Members at Easter Services
description: BEIJING  The authorities stepped up a three-week campaign against an underground Christian church on Sunday, detaining hundreds of congregants in their homes and taking at least 36 others into custody after they tried to hold Easter services in a public square, church members and officials said.

title: More Syrians Are Missing, Hinting at a Wider Crackdown
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Dozens of residents have disappeared in Syria since Friday, many of them from the restive city of Homs and towns on the outskirts of the capital, Damascus, human rights activists said Sunday, amid signs that the Syrian government may widen its crackdown on a five-week uprising that has already killed hundreds.

title: Meaningfully Shopping for Insurance is Next to Impossible
description: Thats the title of a blog post by Nathalie Martin at Credit Slips. It describes just how hard it is for even sophisticated buyers to figure out which company is offering the best deal on such things as home insurance.

title: European and US Employment
description: Bob Gordon has an interesting paper on US-Europe differences (pdf) that actually comes down on the side of those claiming that Europe is hurt a lot by high taxes; I dont fully agree, but will have to come back to that some other time. But theres a very useful figure that I wanted to post:

title: Ramblin Man Is Seen, Twice, Off the Island
description: The ramblin man I wrote about on Tuesday managed to ramble off the island of Manhattan and back out to the wide open spaces.

title: The Language of Medicine
description: Rashi Fein directs me to a paper he published in 1982, which begins

title: Money Madness
description: Ive been fond of quoting the late Charles Kindleberger, who used to say that anyone who spends too much time thinking about international money goes mad. (By the way, thats just what I recall from class; if anyone has an actual reference, I be grateful).

title: The Morning After, Yankees Still Upset
description: BALTIMORE  In a sleepy clubhouse, a burst of excitement came when ESPN showed highlights from the Yankees game Saturday night. The image of Joe Girardi standing on the top step of the dugout pumping his fist, in slow motion, after Brett Gardners two-run homer in the ninth prompted Nick Swisher to put down his cellphone and seek out his manager  for a hug, a fist bump, something.

title: Bloomberg Advises Trump to Drop Birther Issue
description: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, who once harbored presidential aspirations himself, had some advice on Sunday for another billionaire considering national office: Stay away from the birther issue.

title: Interview: Dennis Lee
description: The director Dennis Lee discusses his film "Jesus Henry Christ," about a child prodigy on the search for his biological father.

title: Stoudemire Starts Game 4
description: Amare Stoudemire started Sundays playoff game against the Boston Celtics, despite a sore back that limited him severely in Games 2 and 3 and that threatened to keep him out of Game 4.

title: McCain Raises Specter of Libyan Stalemate
description: Senator John McCain warned on Sunday that he feared the conflict in Libya was heading toward a stalemate and threatened to create a vacuum that could result in Al Qaeda gaining control of the North African country.

title: A Boozy Word Slinger and His Obscure Objects of Desire
description: Austin McCormick, who runs Company XIV, is a choreographer far less interested in the particularity of movement than in a rambunctious theatricality that deploys dance as part of a sexy, colorful mix of narrative and stage genres. His new Lover. Muse. Mockingbird. Whore. at the 303 Bond Street Theater is no different in that way from his Judgment of Paris or Le Serpent Rouge!, which riffed on various mythological figures and stories.

title: Tribeca Video Interview: Dennis Lee
description: The comedy Jesus Henry Christ provides an offbeat take on the contemporary family. The story revolves around a 10-year-old boy genius (Jason Spevack) who is raised by a single mother (Toni Collette) and goes in search of his biological father.

title: Friday Night Lights Watch: Role Models Unite
description: So it looks as though the groundwork is being laid for some intriguing final-season plot developments on Friday Night Lights. Even though our introduction to her has been brief, Epyck already compels with what is a very clear sense of pained defiance. The Taylors role in Dillon, Tex., has always been to serve as de facto parents to all the lost children, and Epyck, with her 46 school absences and other issues, seems to be presenting herself as a master challenge.

title: Baseball According to Beckett: A Game That Wouldnt End
description: In April 1981, in a dumpy stadium in blue-collar Pawtucket, R.I., two minor-league baseball teams played one of the strangest games in history: 32 unbroken innings beginning in twilight on Holy Saturday and pausing, more than eight hours later, near dawn on Easter Sunday. The Pawtucket Red Sox and the Rochester Red Wings were tied 2-2 when the umpires were finally ordered to set aside the rule book  which, because of a preseason clerical error, omitted the usual curfew  and suspend play until a later date.

title: Italys Team Brings Home the Yeh Cup
description: The 20th Yeh Bros. Cup, a prestigious invitational team tournament, was held in Wuxi, China, about a 90-minute drive from Shanghai, last Monday to Friday.

title: Play That Funky Laptop, Wiry Boy
description: There have been fewer more bizarre, more distracting and more of-the-moment musical artifacts in the last year than the videos of Nike7UP. Haze, collage, abstraction: all the central tenets of the recent array of Internet-centric and Internet-native electronic music were captured therein. His clips are either goofy, mashed-up nostalgia or careful pieces of cultural assemblage. They jump among cats pounding at computers, girls in soft focus, conflagrations, metal-heads, war footage and flying birds. Its all soundtracked with heavily chopped-up samples of R&B and pop songs, overlaid with rumbling drones and percussion. What does it all mean? Has the need for meaning been obviated altogether?

title: Conductor Says Orchestra Is a Phantom
description: The Web site photograph depicted an elegant array of orchestra musicians in a glowing hall. A video clip showed an earnest young conductor leading players in a Tchaikovsky symphony. Below the picture, an official biography described the Tschaikowski St. Petersburg State Orchestra as an ensemble with unlimited musical possibilities.

title: Bloomberg Warns Trump on Birther Issue
description: The Timess City Room blog reports that New York Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg has some advice for Donald Trump: dont keep pushing the birther issue raising questions about whether President Obama was born in the United States.

title: Disaster, Disasterer, Disasterest
The Warrior, the Maiden, the Whole Schmear
description: You would think we had enough 19th-century-style ballets with incomprehensible stories and unbelievable characters, in which war is an excuse for dancing in hot pants, exotic maidens bare their midriffs, and love conquers all. But apparently not. On Saturday night, at the Baruch Performing Arts Center, the Lumire Ballet presented El Cid, choreographed by its director Venti Petrov, and set to a compilation of music by Jules Massenet.

title: Hes a Bit Old-Fashioned
description: There are many good things about the ballet programs put on by Avi Scher, whose mission is to present world-class dancers in intimate, affordable settings. Saturday nights program at the Alvin Ailey Citigroup Theater boasted reasonably priced student tickets, live music and the chance to be feet away from the likes of Carla Krbes, Misa Kuranaga, Tyler Angle and Sofiane Sylve.

title: Treasures Pose Ethics Issues for Smithsonian
description: Amid mounting calls by scientists for the Smithsonian Institution to cancel a planned exhibition of Chinese artifacts salvaged from a shipwreck, the institution will hold a meeting on Monday afternoon to hear from critics.

title: Diving Into the Past, but Definitely Still in the Present
description: Sean Combs was dancing: slow, deliberate, slightly awkward movements on a big stage, illuminated only by angelic light from the screen above, which was flashing slow-motion clips of the Notorious B.I.G., a k a Biggie Smalls.

title: Well-Connected Evacuees of Texas Wildfire Turn to Internet
description: MINERAL WELLS, Tex.  When wildfires threatened the upscale community at Possum Kingdom Lake just west of here a week ago, the residents were desperate for, among other things, better cellphone service.

title: Lover and Muse
description: Scenes from Austin McCormicks dance-theater piece.

title: A Fractious Family With Cancer on the Agenda
description: Spike Lee may have a problem with Tyler Perry  the two have been having a public war of words  but Mr. Perrys longtime studio, Lionsgate, certainly doesnt. It just signed him to another three years. Its not surprising: Mr. Perry has consistently shown Hollywood the magnitude of an underserved black female audience as no other director has, and now studios are struggling to keep up (for example the coming Jumping the Broom). The relationship between Mr. Lee and Mr. Perry is fascinatingly inverse: male-skewing perspective versus female; Northern sensibility versus Southern; jazz-rap orientation versus gospel-R&B. Fortunately its a big movie tent. But in box office Mr. Perry is winning.

title: Honoring a Composer and His Wide-Ranging Interests
description: It is easier said than done to organize a tribute concert for Gunther Schuller. What exactly will you pay tribute to?

title: All Guitar, and a Little Comic Relief in Unexpected Places
description: The Cuban composer Leo Brouwer has written prolifically for orchestra and chamber ensembles as well as for film. (His most famous work, to American filmgoers, is the score for Like Water for Chocolate.) But he is also an accomplished guitarist, and he has contributed a huge number of inspired works to his instruments repertory. By the mid-1970s several of his pieces  Elogio de la Danza (1964), Canticum (1968) and La Espiral Eterna (1971)  were part of the canon, and he has continued to write generously for colleagues.

title: MoMA Competition Seeks Better American Housing
description: Five teams of architects will rethink housing in the United States in light of the foreclosure crisis in a 14-month program to be announced on Monday by the Museum of Modern Art and MoMA P.S. 1. Each team will focus on a megaregion, a metropolitan area between two major cities. Amale Andraos and Dan Wood of Work Architecture Company will focus on Portland, Ore.; Michael Bell of Columbia University on Temple Terrace, Fla.; Jeanne Gang of Studio Gang on Cicero, Ill.; Hilary Sample and Michael Meredith of MOS on the Oranges in New Jersey; and Andrew Zago of Zago Architecture on Rialto, Calif. The program, Foreclosed: Rehousing the American Dream, was organized by Barry Bergdoll, MoMAs chief curator of architecture, and Reinhold Martin, director of Columbia Universitys Temple Hoyne Buell Center for the Study of American Architecture. A four-month workshop phase is to begin May 7 with a public symposium at MoMA P.S. 1, where the public can view the work in progress on June 18 and Sept. 17. Completed proposals will be exhibited at MoMA from Jan. 31 through July 31, 2012. New paradigms of architecture and regional and transportation planning could well be the silver lining in the crisis of home ownership, Mr. Bergdoll said in a statement. Foreclosed is the second part of MoMAs Issues in Contemporary Architecture series. The first, in 2009, was Rising Currents, which addressed New York Citys water levels.

title: Party Continues for Rio
description: North American audiences spent about $138 million on movie tickets during the Easter weekend, a 39 percent increase from the same three days last year (which were not a holiday), according to Hollywood.com, which compiles box office data. Rio, an animated 3-D film from 20th Century Fox, was No. 1 for the second weekend in a row with an estimated $26.8 million in sales ($81.3 million total). Tyler Perrys Madeas Big Happy Family, released by Lionsgate, underperformed in second place with about $25.8 million, about 38 percent lower than the opening weekend in 2009 for the previous entry in this franchise, Tyler Perrys Madea Goes to Jail. (But Big Happy Family cost only about $25 million to make.) The $40 million drama Water for Elephants (Fox) did better than some analysts had predicted, at $17.5 million for third place. The Easter-bunny-theme film Hop (Universal Pictures) was fourth with an estimated $12.5 million for a four-week total of about $100.5 million. Scream 4 (the Weinstein Company) rounded out the Top 5 with about $7.2 million for a two-week total of $31.2 million.

title: To Be in 3-D: Alec Baldwin in Hamlet
description: Alec Baldwin is set to appear in August at one of the theater worlds leading events, the Edinburgh Festival Fringe, playing the ghost of Hamlets father. But he wont be there to deliver his performances. With a busy summer that includes filming the movie version of the Broadway show Rock of Ages and preparing for a sixth season of 30 Rock, Mr. Baldwin, above, will tape his scenes as Old Hamlets ghost for the New York-based Fundamental Theater Projects fringe production 3D Hamlet: A Lost Generation, said Fundamentals artistic director, Sam Underwood. Mr. Baldwin and Mr. Underwood starred in a production of Equus last summer in East Hampton, N.Y. Mr. Underwood, who will alternate in the role of Hamlet with Anthony Rapp (Rent), said in an interview that 3D Hamlet would blend multimedia elements with Shakespeares text to create an interactive perspective for the audience and a feeling that they are part of the action. Mr. Underwood said he was looking into using a 3-D camera to record Mr. Baldwins scenes, which audience members would watch through special glasses. Kate Mulgrew (Star Trek: Voyager) will also star in the production as Hamlets mother, Gertrude. Mr. Underwood, who said he was directing and producing the work with fellow Fundamental members, said the play would have a short run in New York in July.

title: Monday: Old Spice Alternative
description: Congratulations to Jeffrey Schwartz of New York City, winner of the third annual Boston Crossword Puzzle Tournament, and to Matt Matera and Jan OSullivan, the 2nd and 3rd place finalists in the overall division!

title: Powerhouse Announces Next Season of New Plays
description: Duncan Sheik and Steven Sater, the creators of Spring Awakening, will team up with the director Moiss Kaufman (33 Variations) for a workshop production of Nightingale, a new musical based on the classic story by Hans Christian Andersen, as part of Powerhouse Theaters 27th season. New York Stage and Film and Vassar College produce this festival of new plays, which begins on June 29 with F2M by Patricia Wettig, best known for her television roles on Thirtysomething and Brothers and Sisters. F2M, the story of Parker, a college freshman whose search for her identity is stalled when her famous parents show up for an unexpected visit, will feature a cast that includes Phoebe Strole (The Metal Children), Keira Keeley (The Glass Menagerie), Deirdre OConnell (Circle Mirror Transformation) and Ken Olin, one of Ms. Wettigs Thirtysomething co-stars. Other season highlights include a workshop of Margaret and Craig, by David Solomon, with Mario Cantone (Sex and the City, Assassins) and Marin Ireland (reasons to be pretty); and readings of new plays by Mona Mansour, whose Urge for Going just finished a run at the Public Theaters Lab series, and John Patrick Shanley.

title: Footnote
description: Paul Reisers return to network television ended quickly last week when NBC canceled The Paul Reiser Show after two episodes, according to The Hollywood Reporter. The debut episode attracted only 3.3 million viewers, and the second one did even worse. At a news conference last week Mr. Reiser told The Hollywood Reporter that the show had been rushed. This was the shortest ramp-up in the history of television, he said.

title: Protesters Distrust Deal for Yemen Leader to Quit
description: Street demonstrators and youth leaders voiced skepticism on Sunday over an offer by President Ali Abdullah Saleh to leave office in 30 days after agreeing to a plan that would grant him and his sons immunity from prosecution for any crimes, saying they did not trust his intention to step down and would continue their protests.

title: Lawmakers Seek to Unclog Road to Confirmation
description: WASHINGTON  Hoping to unclog the Senate and spare scores of presidential appointees from what is often a grueling confirmation process, leading lawmakers in both parties are moving to cut the number of administration posts that are subject to Senate approval.

title: Deficit Cutting: Who Bears the Burden?
description: To the Editor:

title: In Eventful Day, Yankees Offense Does Just Enough for the Victory
description: BALTIMORE  Call it a coincidence, but storm clouds started forming above Camden Yards on Sunday just about the time the Yankees game against Baltimore started losing all semblance of normalcy. An exasperating, exhilarating final two and a half innings followed, and after a series of dramatic moments and a 40-minute rain delay, the ending to the Yankees 6-3 victory proved rather anticlimactic.

title: Wrong Lady on the Stamp
description: To the Editor:

title: Knicks Fall, but Not Without a Fight
description: A cold inevitability fell over Madison Square Garden late Sunday afternoon. The Knicks protested, pushed back against it and nearly chased it off for one more day, until their last burst of bravado finally buckled under an unforgiving avalanche of green.

title: Homering at Home, Wright Powers the Mets
description: David Wright certainly hit the baseball hard enough in his third at-bat Sunday, but he was sure it would curve foul. Wright, the Mets third baseman, has become the foremost expert on how many home runs Citi Field takes away, on how no one can start a home run trot early.

title: Election Fuels Deadly Clashes in Nigeria
description: The death toll and destruction from a wave of election-related violence in Nigeria last week may exceed similar outbursts of the past, though the underlying causes remain the same, experts said.

title: Helping the Fishermen
description: To the Editor:

title: Wal-Mart Tests Service for Buying Food Online
description: Wal-Mart has begun testing an online grocery delivery service, called Wal-Mart to Go, in the San Jose, Calif., area.

title: Struggling St. Louis Airport Takes a Shot to the Chin, but Recovers
description: ST. LOUIS  The gleaming Gateway Arch that presides over the downtown riverfront may be the architectural symbol for this Midwestern metropolis, but its true gateway was built a decade earlier just outside city limits  the Lambert-St. Louis International Airport.

title: A Voice for N.F.L. Retirees Amid the Din
description: NEWARK  George Martin, an 11th-round draft pick, played 14 seasons for the Giants, made captain, won a Super Bowl. Martin the philanthropist raised millions for charity, even walked across the country, through 3,000 miles and 24 pairs of shoes, from the George Washington Bridge to San Diego. Martin the businessman never held a position lower than vice president.

title: Message on the Subway
description: To the Editor:

title: In Galleon Case, Spotlight on Rajat Gupta
description: Throughout Raj Rajaratnams trial, which could go to the jury as soon as Monday, there has been an elephant in the courtroom: Rajat K. Gupta.

title: The Thinking Mans Slugger
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  The most dangerous fastball hitter in baseball came to the plate as the go-ahead run with two outs in the ninth inning last Tuesday at Tropicana Field. Paul Konerko of the Chicago White Sox fouled off four pitches from the Tampa Bay Rays James Shields, who commanded his repertory all night.

title: Effect of Oil Price on Earnings Fades
description: First-quarter earnings, due this week for several big United States oil companies, are set to emit a positive glow. But even the stocks that should be most responsive to oil prices, like Chevron and Hess, no longer seem to be tracking higher.

title: Flying the Flag, Fleeing the State
description: Leeds, England

title: Corporate Taxes Enter Debt Debate
description: The Obama administration is preparing to inject an unpredictable new variable into its economic policy clash with Republicans: a plan to overhaul corporate taxes.

title: Berber Rebels in Libyas West Face Long Odds Against Qaddafi
description: DHIBA BORDER CROSSING, Tunisia  For decades, the remote mountains of western Libya have simmered with resentment. An enclave of the Berber minority, mistrusted and neglected by Col. Muammar el-Qaddafis Arab nationalist government, the regions isolated hamlets were among the first to join the uprising, raising the rebel flag on the first day of the revolt.

title: Lets Take a Hike
description: When I listen to current discussions of the federal budget, the message I hear sounds like this: Were in crisis! We must take drastic action immediately! And we must keep taxes low, if not actually cut them further!

title: Islam and Democracy
description: To the Editor:

title: Libyan Rebels Say They Have Control of Misurata
description: BENGHAZI, Libya  Rebel leaders said they had consolidated their control of the western city of Misurata on Sunday, taking over the last two government outposts there even as government forces continued to shell the city from its outskirts.

title: In a Life Filled With Firsts, One More
description: WESTON, Fla.  Open lunchboxes are sprawled on the kitchen counter. Four dogs dart in and out. And three children rummage through backpacks. With the predawn bedlam at its height, the harried mother asks: Do you have your baseball glove? What do you want for a snack? How about the form I have to sign?

title: For Students Raised on iPods, Lessons in Bridge
description: YORKTOWN HEIGHTS, N.Y.  Four bridge players stared down at their cards, trying to determine which team would play the role of the so-called declarer and dummy.

title: Private Barnes and the Saviors of Washington
description: With President Lincoln looking on from the White House portico, a crack regiment of volunteer Northern soldiers marched along Pennsylvania Avenue in Washington, D.C., with parade-ground precision, resplendent in tailored gray uniforms trimmed in black. Nearly 1,000 bayonet-tipped muskets pointed into the spring sky and glimmered in the sun. Lincoln smiled.

title: Rangers Assess a Season to Grow On
description: Are the Rangers a young team on the upswing? Or are they the same mediocre team in a new guise?

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: DEAR DIARY:

title: Truck Drivers in Shanghai Plan to Resume Protests
description: SHANGHAI  A group of truck drivers who helped stage a three-day strike here last week over rising oil prices and high government fees said Sunday that they planned to resume their demonstrations this week, despite this citys promise to eliminate some freight transportation fees and reduce others.

title: Google, a Giant in Mobile Search, Seeks New Ways to Make It Pay
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif.  In early 2008, in the early days of the iPhone era, Google engineers began noticing something unusual in the search engines logs. Owners of these new phones were doing a huge number of Web searches.

title: Norio Ohga, Who Led Sony Beyond Electronics, Dies at 81
description: Norio Ohga, a onetime opera singer who plunged into consumer electronics, shaped the development of the compact disc, and rose to become chairman and chief executive of the Sony Corporation, died on Saturday in Tokyo. He was 81.

title: Classified Files Offer New Insights Into Detainees
description: WASHINGTON  A trove of more than 700 classified military documents provides new and detailed accounts of the men who have done time at the Guantnamo Bay prison in Cuba, and offers new insight into the evidence against the 172 men still locked up there.

title: President Obama and the Peace Process
description: President Obama began his presidency vowing to negotiate an Israeli-Palestinian peace. He backed off in the face of both sides obstinacy and after a series of diplomatic missteps. Since then, the stalemate, and the mistrust, have only deepened, and it is clear that nothing good will happen until the United States fully engages.

title: Multiple Inequities
description: For a generation, in one of the laws gross inequities that has fallen unduly on African-Americans, 1 gram of crack cocaine was treated the same as 100 grams of powder cocaine in federal courts. It didnt matter that the theory behind the law that crack  cocaine cooked in baking powder  was somehow more addictive and led to more violent crime soon proved false.

title: A Note to Readers: The Background
description: The articles published today are based on more than 700 classified files on past and present detainees at the Guantnamo Bay prison, including the governments assessment of the dangers the individuals represent. The files are from February 2002 to January 2009, and some of the information may have been superseded by later, still undisclosed assessments made by the Obama administration or by more highly classified documents.

title: A Statement by the United States Government
description: It is unfortunate that The New York Times and other news organizations have made the decision to publish numerous documents obtained illegally by Wikileaks concerning the Guantanamo detention facility. These documents contain classified information about current and former GTMO detainees, and we strongly condemn the leaking of this sensitive information.

title: Judging Detainees Risk, Often With Flawed Evidence
As Acts of War or Despair, Suicides Rattle a Prison
description: WASHINGTON  By October 2004, two years into his detention at the Guantnamo Bay prison, Ali Abdullah Ahmed had established a corrosive reputation among prison officials. Mr. Ahmeds classified file said he was a hunger striker, completely uncooperative with interrogators, and had a history of aggressive behavior in the camp, often defiantly failing to comply with instructions.

title: Libyan, Once a Detainee, Is Now a U.S. Ally of Sorts
description: DARNAH, Libya  For more than five years, Abu Sufian Ibrahim Ahmed Hamuda bin Qumu was a prisoner at the Guantnamo Bay prison, judged a probable member of Al Qaeda by the analysts there. They concluded in a newly disclosed 2005 assessment that his release would represent a medium to high risk, as he is likely to pose a threat to the U.S., its interests and allies.

title: U.S. Networks Add Britons to Royal Wedding Coverage
description: In November, when the save the date was circulated for Prince William and Kate Middletons wedding, Elena Nachmanoff immediately booked a trip to London. She was going shopping  for royalty experts.

title: App-omattox: The Civil War Goes Virtual
description: Its Day 10. The North has sustained 52 casualties; the South 3. Im not exhausted at all. Nor hungry. What I am is entertained and slightly anxious. I may even have a touch of period rush, as Civil War re-enactors call the intoxication of time-travel. Ive become spellbound by the History channels brilliant-creepy Civil War Today app.

title: The House Strikes, and Wins, Again
description: In another House-engineered setback for the environment, the compromise budget approved by Congress and the White House prohibits the Interior Department from spending any money to carry out a policy protecting unspoiled federal lands.

title: Good Enough to Please Dolan, if Not to Win
description: While no miracle resurrection, the overall result was not all that dissatisfactory for the Knicks from the organizational point of view. Behind their emotional leader, Amare Stoudemire, they pushed the Celtics on Sunday just enough to earn a season-ending ovation in the dying seconds of a four-game sweep.

title: Follow the Really Big Money
description: Things are going well for the wealthy. The top income tax rate is lower than at nearly any time since the 1930s. President Obama, who promised to repeal Bush-era tax cuts for the wealthy, agreed to extend them for another two years. And Republicans are pushing to slash trillions in public programs in order to cut the top rate more.

title: For Celtics, Big Tests Are Yet to Come
description: Doc Rivers handled his seasoned roster last year like a jalopy that was hiding a new engine. He carefully rested the core as losses piled up before pulling back the hood in the playoffs, unveiling an energized and united group, and arriving at the doorstep of another championship.

title: Civic Group Says Concessions Are Needed From the Construction Unions
description: A prominent civic group has joined builders and real estate executives in calling for major concessions from the unions that dominate the construction industry, saying cuts are needed to allow major projects to move forward.

title: Syrian Crisis Tests the Mettle of Its Autocratic Ruler
description: CAIRO  For years, President Bashar al-Assad of Syria has nourished a reputation as a youthful and forward-looking leader in a region full of aging autocrats, a man who might yet reform the repressive police state he inherited from his father, given time and opportunity.

title: Pursued All Season, Heat May Encounter One Battle Too Many
description: PHILADELPHIA

title: War, in Life and Death
description: Tim Hetherington was a war photographer in every regard. Tall, brutally handsome and modest, he had a British accent plucked from a Graham Greene novel and the body fat of a Diet Coke.

title: On Easter, a Sermon of Rebirth, and a Rally for Rights
description: Packed inside St. Patricks Cathedral on Sunday, nearly 3,000 people from around the world gathered to hear Archbishop Timothy M. Dolan deliver his Easter homily.

title: A Case for Hell
description: Heres a revealing snapshot of religion in America. On Easter Sunday, two of the top three books on Amazon.coms Religion and Spirituality best-seller list mapped the geography of the afterlife. One was Heaven Is for Real: A Little Boys Astounding Story of His Trip to Heaven and Back, an account of a 4-year-olds near-death experience as dictated to his pastor father. The other was Love Wins: A Book About Heaven, Hell, and the Fate of Every Person Who Ever Lived, in which the evangelical preacher Rob Bell argues that hell might not exist.

title: Who Gave Amen Corner Its Name? Read On
description: If returning to the golf course in sun and warmth is the greatest joy of a new golf season, then an attendant delight is welcoming the latest contributions to the legacy of elegant, instructive, engaging books on golf.

title: Charter School Space: Free of Rent, Maybe, but Not of Hurdles
